text: Very tasty and good value. Works well for staff lunches and the sandwiches have sealed ends and are great car food.

I highly recommend Zooks. I drove by Zooks for months always wanting to try it and now I regret waiting so long! The staff was excellent and gave us some great recommendations since it was our first time. I had the Turkey, bacon, avocado (sorry, I can't remember the number!) and my boyfriend had the #22 breakfast sandwich. Both were delicious. I wish we would have split our sandwiches instead of both eating our own! For sides, we had the potato salad and garbanzo bean salad, both were great. They had a slight lemon zest flavor which was a nice touch. The owner stopped by to check on us and she was very friendly. The lack of parking doesn't bother me because we walked from my apartment and it is walking distance from the light rail. Overall, we will be returning and recommending Zooks!

I brought my dad here while we were driving cross country. The service was great and the sandwiches were everything the reviews promised. I had the# 35, roast beef with horseradish and dad had the #25, ham and cheese with many delicious things. both were great, but we agreed that the roast beef was the better of the two. It's all about the horseradish!Each sandwich comes with either a salad or chips, we had the kale salad, it was pretty good. The owner came out to chat with us for a bit; it's exciting to talk to passionate people, and she is passionate about her business and the concept. Over all, we were very satisfied. It's worth getting off the highway for some true local flavor and to support a local business. Google maps navigated us there perfectly,.

This is my favorite sandwich place it 's delicious.  All the fresh ingredients come together perfectly in this wonderful mouth watering pocket of goodness.  Everyone is extremely friendly & welcoming.  I love the people there & they make my lunch enjoyable every time I stop in.  The kale salad is amazing & If you get a chance to try the special on a Wednesday your mouth will be pleased.

OH MY GOODNESS!!! I don't even know where to start with this restaurant! I ordered a turkey with brie and apricot jam, and it was one of the best things I have ever tasted! I totally recommend this place. There might be a little but of a wait depending on which sandwich you get, but its totally worth it.

What a lovely place! The owner came out to my table and talked with my mom and I about our order. She talked about how those sandwiches came to be and about how this new location was working wonders.   The food is excellent! My sandwich had green Chile and macaroni on it (it was a special that day). And holy hand grenades it was amazing! So warm and toasty, spicy but not hot, and made with love.   I chose to have the side kale salad with my sandwich as well. I didn't think I liked kale but gosh d*rn it was really good! It had this tangy vinaigrette on it and came with mandarin slices. I give it an excellent out of 10!   I just wish the sandwhich was a little bigger. But other than that this place is great and I will be back soon!

Great place and I can't wait until I come back!  I got the #20, a delicious turkey, bacon, avocado, tomato, and cheese concoction alongside the garbanzo bean salad.  Service was friendly and efficient. You just walk up to the register and order, and when your order is done, they will bring it out to your table.   They have water cups out in the table area and also a public sink where you can wash up without having to go to the bathroom.   Parking lot is a little small, but manageable. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

A good place to grab a quick lunch.   The sandwiches are uniquely packaged and yummy! The inside was clean and designed for in-and-out customers. The service was great and the manager came to each table to greet and ask about the food.   I will come back again.
Delicious. Love the press making the bread nice and crispy. Great side salads. Def recommend.

Still a huge fan.  Love the new location in Uptown Plaza, the new menu additions, logo and vibe.  If you have yet to experience Zookz, drop your boring sub sandwich in the trash and try these unique, fresh, toasted sandwiches.  I am hooked for life!

Tasty sandwiches and an extremely friendly owner. The last time I was in, she noticed I hadn't eaten my salad and offered me my choice of another salad or chips. Wonderful customer service, great food and very reasonably priced.

Great Sunday morning breakfast!. No long wait as is typical of most places at this time . super cute atmosphere. Our order came up fast. We ha the zingger. No longer on the menu but they put a picture up because everyone likes it so much. I can see why soooo good.I was happy to see the owner out and checking food talked with us to make sure we were happy . overall pleasant experience great food and awesome customer service. Will return for more! On a side not 2 sandwiches for ten bucks can't beat that
Unique, delicious take on the sandwich. The owner is always there, and will guide you through her culinary delights, which she preserved from her grandmother's cooking.

We discovered Zookz today after driving around endlessly looking for something "different" and finally finding it! This is the best sandwich I have had in YEARS. I used to love Bennigan's Monte Cristo sandwich but they went out of business quite some time ago and I couldn't find anything even remotely close afterward; Padre Murphy's Monte Cristo didn't cut it. Zookz' #30 with thinly sliced ham, brie, apricot preserves and roasted almonds isn't a Monte Cristo but it's just as tasty in it's own way. We will definitely be back to try everything on their menu - Zookz is that good! The Kale salad is awesome too. I have a feeling that everything will be delicious, no matter what we order. Thank you, Carol, for opening such a great restaurant! :0)
Delicious! The bread is buttery, soft in the center and a little crispy on the outside. The kale salad it fantastic as well as the potato salad. I had the turkey bacon sandwich. Very good!

This place is fantastic! Wonderful little unique sandwiches bursting with flavor, leaving you feeling very satisfied. Pride of ownership is apparent with such a cool little story about the founders grandmother and her influence on the restaurant. Will definitely be back for breakfast or lunch when I'm in the area.
Exactly what I expected! Sandwiches were perfect, creative, and fresh. Great atmosphere and service. I would eat here weekly if it was closer! Well done ZOOKZ!

Absolutely love this place. Everything was amazing! The service and food! The cashier and chef were extremely nice and they said that if I didn't like my food they can make me a new one. Of course that wasn't necessary because I loved what I ordered. 100% recommended.

Yelp brought me here as I was downtown in the morning and needed breakfast. Zookz had great reviews so I figured I would give them a try... Well the reviews were right! Great place. Nice atmosphere, great friendly service and decent prices. I had the Number 33 and it was so good I went back to try the Zinger special sandwich. So much flavor! Excellent place! Outstanding offerings! New favorite spot for sandwiches.
Phenomenal sandwiches, lame hours. If they were open past 3:00PM, I might be able to make it more often than once in every fourteen weekends.

This was one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! I had the No. 22 with the chipotle sauce! It was super yummy! The sandwiches came out fast, and hot and tasted so fresh. Service was great and the restaurant was clean! Definitely will be coming back soon

We saw this restaurant today after we saw it featured on the morning news show. We walked into a very clean bright happy atmosphere love the yellow flowers in the flower boxes on the outdoor patio. We were greeted by the owner and truly wanted us to have the best experience by explaining the menu. I had a #45 with a side of Kale and husband had a #60 with a side of Potato salad. The food was really good but the kale salad was amazing. I would stop by just for the salad alone. I am a diabetic and this meal really agreed with me. No spikes or crashes witch says a lot about the quality. For drinks I had a delish pomegranate ice tea and husband had a fountain cola. He would of loved to see a root beer. That was the only thing missing for his drink but they do have many other choices. We will be back!

This place was delicious! Tried it on a whim Sunday morning and I don't regret it. The staff was super friendly, and checked on us twice. We ordered the #44, #66 and the peanut butter Nutella sandwich.   The bread was nice and toasted. The ingredients were fresh. I also got their special, which was a mimosa with the sandwich, and it was yummy! Definitely recommend.
Sandwiches were a little small but delicious and very different as a toasted circle. The chipotle potato salad was worth the price of admission!

My pops swears by this place! The best local central Phoenix spot for something fast, easy and delicious. Especially for breakfast. The owner carol is always on hand to make sure everything is perfect which speaks a lot for place.

I love this place. Came here with my girlfriend and her sister for breakfast. Customer service was superb and the sandwiches were delightful. And the manager is so nice always checking up on how everything is going. Definitely coming back for more.  I got the sandwich #20

Yummy sandwiches, the price is unbeatable! The restaurant is cute and clean, the staff is friendly. I had # 66 it was SO good. My kids had a bacon, cheese and egg sandwich and loved it. I'll definitely be back :)
Went for breakfast and had the #66. Great crispy texture of toasted bread surrounding filling that included two perfectly poached eggs for $5.95.

I was in downtown Phoenix and planned to find a local place to pick up breakfast. Thank you, Yelp, for showing me Zookz around the corner from the office building I was at! Thanks to Zookz for an awesome, smooth cup of coffee (dispensed from pump decanter instead of burning on a hot plate of the coffee maker). The breakfast sandwich lived up to the Yelp reviews. It was a delicious use of premium soft cheese, poached eggs, tomato, etc. My tummy gave me a high five on the way back to the west valley. That's why I adore local eateries! So good!
Best sandwiches in AZ so far. We ordered #20 and #11. So good! Everyhing tastes fresh and they have good coffee too. Great ambiance, friendly staff. I will keep coming here.

Excellent food quality & variety, pleasant ambiance, misters for warm days. Had the special chile relleno with ham & side kale salad. Salad and sandwich were delicious. Sandwich was hot and yummy, great taste. Salad was moist, mandarin orange, nuts, really good. Staff and owner are some of the best people Phoenix has to offer. Friendly and genuine. The restaurant is open, airy and very inviting. Best sandwich place around. Great place to visit.
This is my first my time eating here Zookz. An Interesting and tasty twist to the typical sandwich. The potato salad was tasty too.

Breakfast sandwiches served all day long. It is like a dream come true. If you also a late riser, missing the preposterously early 10:30 AM mark, then, my friend, this is also a dream come true for you. They close early-ish so no breakfast sandwiches are to be had for dinner. But, hey, first world problem.  The bread is odd and tasty...like a cross between a pita and a hot pocket. I dig it.

WOW- I've never tasted anything like it- the method of sandwich-making at Zooks is unique and delicious. They perfectly toast the edges of the bread to encapsulate the ingredients. I got a breakfast sandwich and made my sister get a turkey sandwich so we could trade halves. It's the perfect serving size- not too big; not too small. Also the Coco Loco was a perfect sweet tooth satisfier. Service was great and the owner was very kind!

These sandwiches are nothing short of spectacular. Fresh, flavorful ingredients in a unique, easy to eat sandwich. You must first get over the shock of just how beautiful the cross section of these are but once you do I assure you it will be one of the greatest sandwich experiences of your life. The options and combinations let you make any sandwich you can imagine but I went with a simple regular menu item and I was not disappointed. On top of it all the restaurant itself is lovely to be in, open to the outdoors with water misters and greenery make it very comfortable and pleasant to wait for your to go order or dine in with some friends. Great place all around and I will be spreading the word and taking everyone I know.

After months of having this place bookmarked I finally went. Me & my coworker ordered a #20 (turkey, bacon, avocado,  tomatoes & cheese, sounds delish I thought) & I got  the kale salad...we got it to go because I work way too far for for my 1hr lunch.  I got to my desk and to my surprise they're was no avocado in my sandwich :( & I love avocado!! I thought they just maybe had my order wrong but as I moved on to my other half there was one tiny piece in there. My coworker had the same issue.  Also the edges on their sandwiches are really hard. But honestly that's just a nitpicking complaint.  So the kale salad was really flavorful if you like greens, their green tea is pretty good. & I give the sandwich I got a 6/10. I'd try this place again but I'll ask for extra avocado even if I have to pay for it. (Which I shouldn't have to since it should be already in there, but whatevs)

This place was amazing. Server at the front was very helpful and explained if there is anything you order and don't like, you can choose something new. We had the #25 and #35, the food came quick and the iced tea selection was superb. Will come back again soon!

Super yummy toasted sandwiches!! The potato salad is AMAZING!! The owner came by our table and is just a lovely person! Great choices of iced teas and Coke products. Hubby had the #10 Turkey sandwich and I chose the #17 roast beef. Excellent lunch and service!! And breakfast sandwiches are served all day. Patio with misters and indoor dining.
Amazing food! Fresh ingredients and incredible service! The owner, Carol, is a rock star!!! Go there!!!
Really delicious and unique sandwiches. My favorite are the breakfast selections, which are served all day!! The garbanzo bean salad is also very tasty. Stop in...You won't be sorry!

Zookz wasn't even on my gastronomic radar as I was driving south on Central Avenue on my way to Burton Barr Library around lunch time today.  However, it was the first restaurant on Yelp's list as I searched on my phone.  I caught a glimpse of it as I drove by to my right and immediately took the first right to circle back to it.   Very friendly staff is what greeted me upon walking in.  They could sense immediately it was my first because I most likely gave an impression of a Golden Retriever puppy that walked into the neighbor's house: confused, lost and maybe a little intimidated due to unfamiliarity.  The staff eased me in however and made me feel at home within moments, explaining what they offer and serve.  I asked what their recommendations were and both gladly obliged.  Tara (I didn't get her name but calling her that because she looks like the young Tara Reid) chose No 11; while Guy (just because he was a guy) picked No 45. Both choices looked equally appetizing based on the ingredients' description from the overhead menu, but I was leaning towards No 11 because it was Tara's choice plus it had cream cheese which we both like.   As Tara was taking my order, Guy threw in a last-second recommendation - No 25 - which he said I could customize by adding cream cheese (yay Tara) and bacon.  I decided to sit outside on the patio so I could enjoy this fantastic weather and have a chance to observe the surroundings.  Soon after, my order was brought to my table, enclosed in the paper bag Tara had written my order on.  Taking the sandwich out of the bag, the aroma alone whetted my appetite even more, but I was a little disappointed because a wall picture inside had me visualizing a more substantial delight.  I stared at it for a few seconds as I struggled to mentally grasp what I was looking at because it looked like two slightly larger dollar-sized pancakes fused together in a panini fashion. Nonetheless, my first bite could not have prepared me for the explosion of flavors in my mouth; all the ingredients popped and the flavors blended well together with every bite.  The consistency of the sandwich was toasted/baked/paninied (however they made it) perfectly.  It was crusty on the edges but soft and gooey in the middle.  As unsubstantial as I thought it was, I took my time relishing it anyway because the place invited me to just relax and to enjoy the moment.  The head cook/chef perhaps owner even took the time to check on each customer which added to the relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.    Overall, it was a worthwhile snappy decision to choose this place and I'll definitely be back.  P.S.  Owners of Zookz, give Tara and Guy raises because those two were excellent wait/counter staff.  They were both helpful, engaging and definitely knew what the cafe had to offer.  One last thing, can I get Tara's number?  ;)

I feel in love with Zookz the first time popped in one Friday in March 2013.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich requesting no meat and was immediately offered fresh spinach as a substitute! Wow!! I have been hooked ever since and absolutely adore the curried turkey sandwich with kale salad. Alone or together these elements are outstanding!! Truly delicious with a wonderful melange of ingredients and a mild curry sauce. I like really hot curry but this subtle sauce works well for a general palate. The physical space is light and airy and the outdoor seats are nice. The place is always spotless (including the restroom.) This locally-owned eatery should be a must go-to place on a foodie's list. The pastry of the "sandwich" is neither heavy nor greasy and provides a nice crunch to the ingredients. Do yourself a favor and support a local business and enjoy some tasty food.

Zookz is the place to go for breakfast and lunch doesn't matter the time it's all so very good! you get a nice yummy sandwich with and edge and a side of your choice. All the side foods are so darn good it's a challenge to pick which one you'd like to eat. there are millions of good things I can say about zookz. I highly recommend this place for sure !!!!

Such a delightful, fabulous find. So refreshing to find a delicious, hands on (the owner is there everyday), perfectly priced breakfast and lunch joint.  I can't say enough about how unusually scrumptious these pressed sandwiches are with their unique fillings, both for breakfast and lunch. And, I'm so glad the restaurant as moved into a new location around the corner with MORE parking.  The sides are amazing as well (your choice comes with each lunch. The ymmy kale salad has already been positively hailed in the other reviews). Do your taste buds a favor and give Zooks a try-I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

I'm still not completely sold on the concept as a regular thing but these "Zooks" are pretty dang tasty.  They make the sandwiches to order (expect a couple minutes wait) using a few simple but fresh ingredient combinations (ie. mozzarella, tomato, greens or egg, bacon, cheese, beans).  The owner is very friendly (and the other staff for that matter) and the place is always clean (why can't all other fast casual places do this?).  I do wish the sandwiches were just a little bit bigger though.  If you're looking for a unique 'sandwich' option give it a shot for breakfast or lunch.

Zookz is my new favorite weekend lunch spot!  Their sandwiches are unique (they are crunchy and shaped in a circle) with great ingredients.  You can't find these anywhere else (that I'm aware of) so check it out when you are in the mood for something different.  The owner is always there and is very nice.  They are still new but I really hope they make it!

Great sandwiches and EXCELLENT customer service! My husband and I place pick-up orders often, and today there was a mistake on my sandwich. I called to let them know and Carol offered, practically insisted, to drop off a new sandwich for me without even knowing where we live!!  That's what I call amazing customer service- thank you!!! We're happy that your kindness will keep us coming back because we love your food!!  If you haven't been to Zookz, support local and eat delicious food from caring people! ** The above portion was written for Zookz Facebook page. I've decided to add it to Yelp, too!  Again, the food here is delicious- every sandwich is amazing!  Don't forget to get the kale salad on the side- I could drink the dressing.  Carol and her staff simply know how to treat customers- they are the best!
Love this place.  Best sandwiches around.  The owner is always there and she genuinely cares about her food and the service is awesome.  Highly Recommend.

I've been dying to try this place for months; I bookmarked it over 7 months ago. Mr. B. and I decided to give it a try on Sat. (we loved it so much that we went again after our Monday morning workout). The customer service here is second to none and the menu is perfect (not too little, not too much).  Saturday the cashier suggested we try the potato salad along with the jalape√±o chips (key here is to use the chips as the spoon..holy toledo Batman!). As a first timer she asked if we like Kale salad and offered it up for free (another excellent selection). The dressing is made of mandarin oranges and it is good.  I had a #33 (feta, parmesan, tomatoes, spinach, fresh basil and 2 poached eggs [they were more on the soft boiled side in my opinion but, good nonetheless]) and added bacon. My entire face was in my plate but, Mr. B. had a #66 (cheddar, 2 poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes, green onions and zookz ginger cream cheese sauce). That sauce that was absolutely divine.   Monday we tried #'s 45 & 60 with a few modifications that didn't disappoint. This is definitely a place to stop by if you're in the area or drive the distance if you're not. Regardless, you won't be disappointed.

Omg!!! I absolutely love this place. I came in here one day after seeing the billboard at camelback & central. The sandwich looked soooo delicious. I tried the #11 and now I'm hooked. I brought a sandwich in with me to work and now my coworkers are hooked too. So now I'm ordering for my coworkers and myself on certain days. Nothing like ordering 7+ sandwiches at a time.  This is a great concept. All the employees are super friendly. And the food is super delicious.

What a cute fun way to eat sandwiches! They look small but don't let that deceive you. My sandwich was very filling but it did not make me feel disgustingly full after. I loved that it comes with a side of salad of your choice. I will come back next time I'm in Phoenix.

I usually go for the kale salad with chicken, but today I tried the pulled pork sandwich. Delicious! Sweet pork and a spicy cole slaw in the sandwich with potato salad for side - absolutely wonderful! A new favorite. The new location is easy to get to and has plenty of parking.

This is my favorite sandwich shop in all of the Phoenix area. The salads are amazing, so flavorful and unique. The sandwiches are like nothing I've ever had. We drive about 30 minutes each way so often to come here - highly recommend!
Love the new location.  Great energy, music and now some local brews.  Nice updates! Only wish I saw the 10% off on yelp to use on my order. Will be back to do so!
The freshest looking wall of all time. Beware:there are patrons that hold the sriracha hostage.
Incredible food. Hot sandwiches come out quickly and everybody here is so friendly. Highly recommend. Worth the 30 minute drive from Cave Creek.

Really cool concept. They have a special griddle that can take two pieces of bread that grills your sandwich while piching around the edges to create a sill, thus making a pouch to hold all the yummy goodness inside. Nice atmosphere and staff was very helpful. Only downside is the sandwiches are on the small side and do not feel up my teens.

We first tried this place a long time ago at their old location off Central. I still love Zookz and their new location is not far from their old location. It's the perfect little spot for a light/healthy lunch or breakfast! My favorite sandwich is the No. 25. The side kale salad is amazing too!

A place we found after flying in to the Airport and starting our day.  Very unique sandwiches with a French flair on the toasted bread.  The breakfast sandwiches, which are served all day, were particularly delicious and included great flavor profiles and poached eggs.  Highly recommend!
One of my favorite sandwhich places. Much better than others in the area. I got the #20 and it was delish.

This is the best place ever try the number 66 always on point and always smiles . I love the inside of this place especially the sunflowers , if your looking for the best toasted sandwiches in PHX and a wholesome welcome then zookz is the place .

Overall: Best sandwich shop in town! (Possibly ever). Can't wait to go back!  The food:  Delicious! We tried 7 different sandwiches and the 3 sides--everything was excellent--fresh and flavorful.  The service: Exceptional! Very friendly staff, made me and my family feel welcome.  I especially loved how involved and incredibly gracious the owner was. She came around to every table to ask about their experience and seemed genuinely interested in making everyone feel welcome and happy with their meal.
The owner was kind and friendly to us. The kale salad and potato salad were very unique and delicious! Our sandwiches (The Zinger and #25) were very tasty too.

I agree with most everything Greg W said, though I don't think they are overpriced as he implied. The sandwich was pretty good, but small. I had the #15-- turkey, dried cranberries, almonds, shredded carrots, and curry sauce. All of the ingredients were really good but still not sure about the bread/wrap. Definitely unique, not offensive in any way, just don't know that I like it as much as regular good old fashioned bread. It's a nice change of pace at least. You also get a side salad or chips. I had the kale salad and it was quite tasty. Service is very friendly and they care about what they do so my review is really a 3.5. Bottom line: good quality food and friendly service but maybe just not my cup of tea.
Amazing customer service! The food was amazing and fresh, they even know my order! The teas are refreshing! And the owner is awsome!!!

Our intention was to go to Mazie's next door, but there was a 30 minute wait so we decided to give Zookz a try and we are so glad we did!     I'm not exactly sure how to describe their sandwich:  a round panini,? a round grilled cheese sandwich with other stuff in it, or as they say "a warmly toasted, round and sealed sandwich?   However you describe it -- it is fabulous!  My adventurous hubby tried the No. 15 Thinly sliced turkey, dried cranberries, shredded carrots, roasted almonds and a mild curry sauce.   My adventurous 12 year old son tried the No. 45 Fresh Mozzarella, tomatoes, fresh spinach, roasted red peppers and fresh basil with honey Balsamic Vinaigrette.  And, I, probably the least adventurous on this day, ordered the No. 20 Thinly sliced turkey, crisp bacon, fresh avocado, tomatoes, shredded cheddar and Sweet Heat Mustard Sauce ( I was told it was the most popular sandwich ordered).  All three  of us tried each others sandwich by proclaimed our respective sandwich the best.  The sandwiches are served with a little side of Kale salad.    Price point for sandwiches is around $5.75  They do serve breakfast sandwiches as well, which we plan to try!  Operational Notes:  Hopefully you are enticed enough to give them a try, but beware of their hours - M- F 7am - 3:30pm (they aren't open in the evening).  I believe they are closed on Saturdays (that seemed like an odd decision), but they are open on Sunday's (which is the day we happily came across them).   The interior is cute, and they have outdoor patio seating.  Staff is super friendly as noted on other reviews.  No alcohol is served, but who needs the alcohol... will only numb your tastebud's from savoring those flavorful sandwiches!
Different but great.  The sandwiches, sides are awesome. In a nice plaza with outdoor and indoor seating.  For your health.
Great place! Love the food, love the atmosphere, love the service! All around a great place to eat. Carol is the best I love her glowing smile. Shout out to #22 sandwiches

Stayed in a place up the road from this place. We came in on a Sunday morning and beat the rush. The restaurant is really nice and the windows were open because the weather was fantastic. The sandwiches were so good, unlike any other breakfast sandwich I've had. The owner took the time to welcome us and thanked us for coming in. Also, their iced teas are really refreshing and have a great variety of flavors. I will definitely come back when I'm around these parts.

Came here today for the first time with coworkers as it's super close to our office. My husband has raved about it so I had to bring friends to try it out!   We ordered a variety of different sandwiches - both lunch and breakfast sammies - and we all enjoyed what we ordered. I got the curried turkey sandwich and side kale salad. The real star here is the customer service and friendly staff. The owner came out to personally ask if we enjoyed our meals and offered to replace the sandwich, no questions asked, if we were unsatisfied. They were super fresh and delicious! I also really liked the kale salad.   The only thing I would agree with about other reviewers is that the portions are not huge. In many ways this is great, and I left feeling satisfied, but I was STARVING in about 2 hours. I think many local places overserve you and Zookz does not. I would have probably had room for dessert. However, the prices are fantastic.   I can't say enough pleasant things about the customer service and that will bring me back for another lunch experience. Next on my list is the ham sandwich with black beans and chipotle sauce...yum!

Very cute interior and the staff could not have been friendlier. They were so pleasant!  Craving a sandwich of some kind, I went here on a Friday afternoon. I'd read a few reviews prior to going so I was expecting to be little disappointed in the size of the sandwiches but not the quality. And that was true.  Greeted so kindly by a host at the door (which is an old garage door, very cool) with a menu and suggestions for what to order at lunch, I knew the place was so hip and cool. The guy at the counter greeted me and again helped me order a sandwich with plenty of helpful suggestions. I ordered thier most poplar sandwich, #25. Anything with turkey and avacado is my weakness. I grabbed bag of chips and paid like $8 for it. The register girl complimented me on literally everything I was wearing. Um, hello new best friend.  The sandwich was hand delivered to me and was so delish. They're more like sandwich pockets. We used to make the same things as a kid but put pizza in them. Just take 2 slices of bread, add your ingredients in the middle, take a circle cookie cutter to punch it out. Then Glaze it with butter or something and bake in the oven. Zooks did the same thing but way better. Was I sad to see the sandwich was so small? Yes, I was. But was I pleased with the shredded turkey, avacado, tomato, and spicy mustard... you betcha.  I'd give Zooks a 4 but I wasn't exceptionally im pressed with the interior or seating arrangement of the place. But don't get me wrong, it's still really good!

I've been to Zookz 3 or 4 times and haven't had a sandwich I didn't like. I plan on working my way through the menu and Carole and the rest of the staff are outstanding.  Zooks is close to work so it is easy to pick up a quick breakfast or lunch sandwich and get back in our 30 minute time frame.    I don't eat my green veggies like I should (or at all) but I can survive on the Kale Salad.  It is to die for.   I would recommend Zookz to anyone.  It is located on Central across from St. Francis RC Church.    Try the Nutella, peanut butter banana sandwich as a dessert.   My friend and I share it as it is too sweet and filling to eat after a full sandwich.  Prices are great too.
Wow! I was really surprised! I have never had a sandwich like this! It was so good. I had a breakfast sandwich and my husband had a turkey. They were both really good. The staff was really helpful!
Amazing sandwiches and such a pleasant atmosphere! Sandwiches are not your run-of-the-mill like you find everywhere else....tasty & reasonably priced. Owner and staff do a great job!

Zookz makes outstanding, unique and affordable sandwiches and salads. Their new location in Uptown Plaza is terrific.   What separates Zookz is their care. They have a custom panini press, special-made bread, fresh ingredients and attention to detail. You won't find a traditional sandwich on their menu. The owner used to bottle salad dressings for AJs, and their kale + tangerine salad is heaven. Some restaurants have fantastic food, some restaurants have fantastic service, some restaurants have fantastic atmosphere, but finding a place that excels at all three -- and is affordable -- is rare. Love supporting local businesses where the people are just as exceptional as the food they make.  Great place for families, lunch dates, solo bites and indoor/outdoor eating in the cooler months.
These are hot pockets. Portion size way too small. Taste of sandwich was ok, but I'm an adult and need an adult sandwich. Does not live up to the hype, sorry.
Delicious, unique, and you will be so glad you tried it! Best. Sandwich. Ever. Plus, amazing service!!!!! Thank you Zooks!!!!!

I don't want to sound like a broken record but...place is amazing. Order the #25 and chase it with the #55 peanut butter banana masterpiece. The kale salad was excellent and this is coming from one serving of vegetables a week guy.  The establishment was immaculate and the staff friendly and efficient. I highly recommend it. Parking is tight so you may have to walk a bit. It will do you good. People should move around more.

This place is great pretty awesome! My girlfriend and I come to Phoenix every year for at least a few days for Spring Training. Found this little place and it was amazing. I was referred here by the Dutch bros coffee place down the street and we were so happy we visited. The sandwiches are great! Such a cool take on breakfast sandwiches that I wish we had one of these in socal. Service was also great l, very fast and efficient.

One of the best sandwich place I have been to, hands down! Went in here with family and each of us ordered a different sandwich. We all loved it except my daughter decided she didn't care for the one she ordered without even tasting it. The owner was so nice she decided she was going to make her an other sandwich to her liking - on the house!! Who does that?.. wow!   This place is a little far for us but anytime I am near the area, I'll make sure to visit this joint again.

It's not that Zookz Sandwiches are bad... they just aren't good.  The location is nice and the staff is great, but the sandwiches are very bland and unsatisfying.  The bread is grilled in a novel fashion but that was the highlight of our visit.  There are better options if you are looking for something with flavor.

Occasionally, you find a place you like so much, if the staff is bad, you eat there anyway.  Then, there are places with food that comes out so-so, but the service is so amazing you choose to support them in spite.  This place is the best of both those worlds.  I needed some breakfast, and the wonderful yelp community pointed me to here.  That's where the story gets better.  After being greeted by the owner when I walked in the door, conversing with her gorgeous self for a few minutes, and staring at all the amazing sandwiches, she finally convinced me to try the zinger.  I thought it was amazing!!  A sandwich that easily fits the Aristotle creed "the whole is greater than the sum of its parts". This sandwich had poached eggs, which I thoroughly enjoy, some ham and various vegetables. Then, they put that between some delightful bread and make it into more or less my favorite sandwich in the whole wide world. GRILLED CHEESE!!  I think when you grill a sandwich, it can only be as good as the bread allows it to be, and they don't lack in this.  I heard her say the bread was fresh baked for them, and I should find out from where cuz I would buy bread from that place any day.    So, to be short, this place is amazing, I want to try every thing on the menu, but I don't get to visit Phoenix often.  I will be visiting this place whenever I have a chance though!!
Very unique sandwich shop.  The ham, Brie and apricot preserve was great.  And don't miss out on the kale salad - seriously - not what you think it will be - its really good.   Top notch place.

I've had this place bookmarked for a few months now and finally had the opportunity to make it here today. The staff was very helpful and polite. The sandwiches that my girl and I ate were the number 45 and 35. Both were excellent in flavor and taste. The only thing that I felt was missing was the portion size.  I felt it was a tad bit small for one person.  The kale salad was excellent as well. I would recommend this place to anyone and will definitely be coming back to try other variations of panini style sandwiches!

Not only does this place have some of the BEST and creative sandwiches in town, but the staff is amazing. They have made a sandwich and side for me 2 times now that was a special at one time, but not on the menu, they are so sweet and extremely accommodating. Their salads are fantastic and I love that the sandwiches are stuffed with so much great stuff and it wont fall out because its pressed. YUMMMY toooo

This place is delicious! The sandwiches are reasonably priced and very filling! If you get a non-breakfast sandwich it will also come with a side. Both times I have visited the owner is there and she is very pleasant and will explain the menu in depth to first timers. The zookz chipotle sauce is also quite tasty and adds a special taste to the sandwiches. I would recommend this place to anyone. The only downside is that it is on central and parking is very limited, especially because the hotel behind the restaurant won't allow parking on their lot.

Zookz never disappoints.  The flavors in each sandwich are perfectly balanced to make your mouth water.  Plus since the sandwiches are made fresh if you don't like an ingredient just ask for it to be left out.  However with the quality ingredients they use I doubt you will want to have anything taken out.    My only complaint (as if it's really a complaint) is that I can't convince Carole or the Zookz crew to become my free personal chef.

Came here on a Sunday. The cashier was extremely friendly and was patience while I stared at the menu for a good hour deciding what I wanted (everything looks good). Finally, I ordered the one with poached eggs, spinach, and tomatoes. The sandwich was small but filling, it was nice and toasty, and the bread was delicious.
Great for lunch, perfect portions....(unless you just finished trying out for the Cardinals then you might needs something a little more substantial).

One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time! I got the #35 with the cabbage salad. My boyfriend had the #20 with potato salad. He said its one of the best lunches he's had in downtown Phoenix. Great customer service too!

My husband and I just had Zookz for the first time. Got the breakfast sandwich and roast beef. Couldn't wait to take a bite so we jumped in on the breakfast one when we got in the car. What a flavor blast!! We live far but we will definitely be back. The owner Carole took time to talk with us and was very sweet. Highly recommended! !

We stopped by for lunch today and we are so happy we did! We walked In and right away were greeted by the owner. She was so sweet and explained the menu to us. We got two sandwiches and a desert and they were all so delicious! Our meals came with a salad option and we got the kale salad and the potato salad. Both were so good! Definitely recommend stopping by!

This place is absolutely amazing! I went there today and it was awesome! I went with my boyfriend and his sisters, and we all fell in love with it from the moment we stepped in.  I had one of the breakfast sandwiches and I about stopped in my tracks. The owner was so sweet in helping me make my decision -- something I struggle with. LOL. I wanted a salad as well, and was about to buy one. The owner gave me a fresh serving of the kale salad for free. I have never tried kale before, and it is amazing!!!  The salad was delicious! It was so good I ordered another one to bring home. I also had one of their desserts. YUMMY! Everyone left happy and full. Definitely coming back for more.   Everyone there was so nice, I can't wait to go back. Maybe next weekend... :)

Zookz was great! I went because of all the reviews and the pictures just looked awesome. Very unique concept. The owner was behind the counter and introduced herself, and thanked me for coming in. You don't see that much anymore....you can tell she cares about her business and her customers. Great sandwiches, highly recommend!

This place is delicious. The food is incredible. I thought it wasn't going to be very filling, but it was very filling and tasted great.  service was unbeatable and at a fair price. I will definitely be coming back when i am on central for lunch!

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. Every single item we ate (two different turkey sandwiches, the peanut butter/Nutella/banana sandwich, chickpea salad, and the kale salad) was an absolute delight!  The owner is lovely and what a great story gave birth to the idea and the restaurant.

What a wonderful find in the Central Phoenix area!  We just finished the Children's Museum and wanted to get a quick, healthy bite to eat before heading home.  After two attempts at different deli establishments (both closed on Sundays), we stumbled upon Zookz.   I had #15 (the turkey, cranberries, roasted almonds, and a light curry sauce) with a side of Kale salad.  It was light, tasty, filling, and satisfying!  The combination of these wonderful, fresh ingredients made my mouth as happy has can be.  Of course, the best part was the toasted bread-you've got to experience it!  You'll see nothing like this anywhere.  My boyfriend had a breakfast sandwich (don't recall which one it actually was), but he said it was delicious too!    If you crave something fresh, healthy, and original (the toasted bread-like Panini pocket), you have to try this place, it's totally worth it!

Yelp brought us here. Very cute and trendy little place. Great service and reasonable prices. But we were disappointed given all the very positive Yelp reviews. The food just isn't anything special. Decent but not great.  I have to believe the Yelp ratings are based on service and price rather than flavor. All these things are important but food should be king. My wife ordered a #10 (by mistake she really wanted to try the #15; our fault ) and I had a #20. For the ingredients in my sandwich it should have had a lot more flavor. Turkey is shredded so more like a turkey salad. I saw the avocado and the bacon but no discernible flavors from them. Off day? Not fresh? The toasted bread itself was just really dry and the crust extra hard. My wife's was dry too and felt the apples were to overpowering. Maybe too many? Any way there are a lot of great places to eat in this area so I see no compelling reason to come back. Feel like Yelp failed me this time.

I got the #11 breakfast sandwich with eggs, bacon, cream cheese, shredded cheddar, tomato, and basil. Sounds delicious, but it was not. It was bland, overpriced, small, and chewy. The bread seemed to be regular white bread that was microwaved making the crust too hard and chewy to eat and then pressed into a round mold to look toasty. Not impressed.

First time goers.  Three of us really enjoyed the unique sandwiches there yesterday.  Talked with the owner, Carole, and very interesting background.  Loved the kale salad that she suggested.  Definitely a repeat place.

I have been wanting to try this place since it opened and when my dental hygienist told me to go because she loved it, I finally decided to stop by. I'm not too big on eggs so I went with their lunch sandwich. I got the #20; which is turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and cheese. It was delicious! I devoured it! The way the sandwiches look reminded me of the frozen PB & J's we used to get in school. It's sealed along the sides and stuffed with goodness. Loved it! The place itself is small but they do also have outdoor seating. The customer service was great! Also, if you check-in while you're there, they offer a 10% discount! Give this place a try, you'll love it!

This is a great neighborhood spot! Their bread is from Wild Flower A local bakery that delivers it fresh every morning. Everyone of their sandwiches comes in a delicious pocket. The Coco loco is a great after sandwich treat. It is like a mounds in a pocket. If you haven't gone you are missing out on this downtown Phoenix gem!

My buddy Jared has been telling me about this place more months. Now that I finally live here and he had a day off we ran down here for brunch. I had the number 33 plus bacon. So good; fresh, and perfectly cooked. I will definitely be back with my wife. Zookz is where it's at for a grilled sandwich and the value was incredible!

First time here and we will absolutely be back! Stopped in for a quick bite before golf and we were pleasantly surprised. Food is delicious and homemade. It's like being at your moms house. Service is great and the owner is very friendly and you can tell she really cares. Great job! Great food!

Zookz is trendy and modern with delicious breakfast sandwiches. I got the No 22 and it was really good. The bread used for the sandwiches were different from your typical sandwich. This is a very cool little spot and I would highly recommend!

Was craving sandwiches but wanted something different. Really glad we found this place! Love the decor and the open concept. The restaurant was bright, colorful and friendly. The server was very friendly and provided us with great recommendations. I was curious what their mustard sauce tasted like and before I could ask the owner came out of with a spoon for me to taste. We ordered one breakfast sandwich and one lunch sandwich. Both were delicious but I liked the breakfast one better.   Definitely coming back!
Very tasty and original! Need to go back again soon to try some other sandwiches. They should get some decent locally roasted coffee.

I've had both their salads and sandwiches and it is my favorite lunch spot. The people are always so nice and the food is always so amazing. They have a lot of interesting sandwiches; i suggest that you go out of your comfort zone and try out something new!
Fantastic customer service! Delicious food! My sandwich was soooo yummy! And reasonably priced! So glad I came in!
This place is great.  I love the story behind the place and the sandwiches are very unique.

Soooooo good. Lives up to yelp reviews. Although not big portions, it was just the right amount so I didn't feel like I was going into a food coma. Ordered the Zinger and it was so tasty. Cream cheese made it different than your average breakfast sandwich. The man who took my ordered was so friendly and helped me sift through the menu. He even came by after to see what I thought and like he said the cream cheese adds some "zing or pizzaz". Service was great.

This is great, fresh and delish.  My only complaint would be that I would love more salads.  I am a wheat free, gluten free person and can't eat the "bread."   I love the kale salad and hope that in the future, they will expand their salad menu.  Love the crew that own and work here.

In town for business and caught a cold, I looked up sandwich places so I could get soup.  Ended up that soup was a brand new menu item.  I loved the sandwiches and the soups were also very good.  The owner came over and asked how my meal was, always a nice touch.    Definitely going to try and return before I head back to Chicago.

Had the opportunity to visit Zookz twice over this past weekend.  The menu was amazing with both traditional and nouveau flavor combinations that were absolutely delicious.  Two of my favorites were the pulled pork sandwich with zookz cole slaw and sauce, and the poached egg sandwich with bacon spinach and zookz cream cheese sauce.    The owner was charming and treated us just like family.  A must go!

I really enjoyed my sandwich very much, I don't eat meat and the veggie sandwich was probably the best veggie sandwich I have ever eaten. The flavors collided together to provide such a unique taste that was delicious! I will definitely return for another sandwich!

This was my first time here; but won't be my last. I enjoyed a #25 off their menu. The way they craft their sandwiches is innovative. These pressed and baked sandwiches have several intesting types of combinations. The staff is real friendly too. Just the right size. -Andy
All I have to say is the food is delish! If you want to grab a quick delicious sandwich come to this place. The owner is super sweet too!

Went there for the first time today. Ordered a breakfast sandwich and coffee. It was so good I immediately ordered another, different kind to enjoy on the spot! Nice lady at counter; good and fast service.

Really tasty sandwiches!  The menu has good options and the sandwich style is different, creative, and delicious.  The restaurant is clean and has a minimalist feel to it.  The service was great and the price of the menu is easy on your wallet.  I got a #22 and I cannot remember a better tasting breakfast sandwich.  My girlfriend is vegetarian and the manager was very accommodating: offering to make her additional items not on the menu.  I wish there were more locations.

Been hearing good things about this strange sandwich shop. I love a warm, toasty sandwich and these were definitely Tasty. The Zook is served with a choice of side salad, unfortunately all their salads have nuts. I have nut allergies as do many people in this world, so be aware of the ingredient list when you order. I complained about the nuts, the owner said she would make me a new salad. I was not in a mood to wait after driving around for 5 mins. trying to park. So I took my order and went back to work. 15 mins later the owner showed up at my shop with a nut free salad! WOW, now that is customer service. I'm not even sure how she tracked me down, I was amazed. Thanks Zooks Lady. She even said she is going to rethink having nuts in so many menu items.

Although our offices are in North Scottsdale,. We always get a yearning for one of these great sandwiches.  And although the drive is 35 minutes one way we come and partake in these unique sandwiches and desserts.  The only complaint I have,  is they do not have a location in Scottsdale.  I hope the people of Central Phoenix and Downtown Phoenix appreciate this wonderful restaurant.

I really appreciate the creativity of this place. It's more than just your average sandwich. I personally enjoy the breakfast themed items. The staff always have great recommendations and the owner always comes out to ensure my food was made correctly and thank me for visiting. It's a cute place to grab a quick bite to eat or to hang out and enjoy the fun atmosphere.

I typically don't like warm pressed sandwiches but this is totally different. The bread is really good, great sides (we had potato salad and kale salad), easy to eat on the go, can be eaten with one hand if necessary, reasonably priced, filling.   What I like most: fast, variety, healthy options, truly unique, great staff. The owner is very nice and truly passionate about this business.   Will be back next time I'm in the area.

Wow!!! I can't believe this was my first time here. This place was amazing! We ordered a #66 (breakfast sandwich with eggs,bacon, cheese, tomatoes, and green onion) and #20 (lunch sandwich with turkey, bacon, cheese, tomatoes, and avocado). They were both equally delicious! I also got a freshly squeezed orange juice and it was worth the $4.  We sat outside since it was a beautiful day and enjoyed our delicious sandwiches. I love the vibes and ambience and I definitely recommend!
Unique spin on the sandwich & a delicious one!  We brought in a large group with no prior notice and still got all of our food within 10min.  Everyone was very helpful & the variety was excellent.

After taking a look at reviews on Yelp, a friend and I decided to chance it and head over to Zookz.  We found an empty restaurant at 11:45am on a Monday, which piqued our curiosity.  The inside was adorned with a few flat screens, a gourmet beverage station, and the clerks even took our orders on iPads.    The staff was attentive and helpful, explaining that their sandwiches required a custom-ordered machine - sounded enticing.  We ordered and received our food promptly.  They were tasty, but the sandwiches are literally the size (and shape) of a baseball.  They are kind enough to serve their sammies with a side of salad (potato or kale salad), that is around 1oz. That's right - a baseball sized sandwich with a 1oz. salad - for approximately $8, not including a drink.  The sandwiches were solid, albeit a bit different than your usual fare.  But we left unsatisfied, and headed over to AJ's to grab an additional bite.  Check it out if you must, but you'll leave hungry.

Zookz gave me one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. We actually went for lunch and liked it so much that we went the next morning for breakfast.   Carol, the owner, was incredibly personable and made me want to come back. She has put a lot of work into making a great business, and I highly recommend Zookz for breakfast and/or lunch (they serve both all day).   Get the #22 if you go for breakfast.

I'm here at least once a week getting sandwiches and salads to go.  The sandwiches are creative, delicious, healthy and made fresh while you wait.  And service is fast and efficient.  I have gotten hooked on #60 and #10.  Salads are creative, delicious, and healthy too.  Owner Carole and staff are fantastic.  I actually dream about these sandwiches.

We just strolled over this morning to the new location at Uptown Plaza.  The modern rustic-luxe environment is perfect for Zookz.  Located directly next door to the trendy organic and healthy Flower Child by Sam Fox, Zookz has delectable unique sandwiches that hit the spot.  They offer about 20-25 variations and even have a few that are for dessert.  We chatted with the owner this morning and she informed us that since moving from their previous location near Maizie's on Central, their numbers are up about 300%!!!  We love supporting unique local eateries that offer great food in a cool environment.  Check them out soon!  Also, they are hiring due to the increase in foot traffic.
Always amazing service, and the food is delicious and different. I like how the owner is always involved in the day to day, and interacts with the guests.

Very, very over rated!  The only thing that stands out is the service.  If you are the person that raves about a market sandwich from Pane Bianco this is not for you.  Very simple and very average ingredients. My mom has been making sandwiches like this for me my entire life. I think I was expecting similar flair like the sandwiches from Culinary Dropout.   Food Guy Out!

Super yummy!! My husband and I ate at Zookz today and it was truly delicious. We ordered the breakfast Zinger and the lunch #20 and shared-both were fabulous. You wouldn't believe how many restaurants can screw up a poached egg, but Zookz is great. Oh, and the potato salad was superb. My husband is not a potato salad fan and he loved it. The Owner was so nice-very engaging with all of the customers, helped with setting a highchair at our table for our baby boy, and made sure we knew about the specials available. All in all great food and service. We will be back!

I don't know if it was it the hunger or it was just that amazing, but I devoured my sandwich! I had the No. 40 which is one of their veggie sandwiches that has carrots, kale, roasted almonds, & this amazing dressing that brought out a great combination of amazingness all in one sandwich! They pretty much just have salads & sandwiches. I did wish they offered some lattes or something, but that's okay there is plenty nearby.

This was our first time here. We called for directions because we were a little lost. It was a wonderful experience from that phone call to the time we left. The sandwich we ate was #33..from the billboard! It DID NOT DISAPPOINT! The owner and manager came out to greet us. You can tell much love and attention-to-detail that went into, not just the restaurant, but also the phenomenal sandwich.   Why can't more places be like this place?

Why don't I come here every week?! Delicious food! The staff are very friendly and the place is cute. Most importantly, the food concept is great. I ordered a #10, turkey with cheese, apples, and mustard. The flavors are complex but Mix together in a perfect arrangement. They do a neat thing with their bread, toasting it together like a pita. My boyfriend had the #35, roast beef, cheddar, horseradish. It tasted like prime rib! The sandwiches came with sides, we ordered kale salad with mandarin oranges and potato salad. Again, many ingredients that come together in perfect harmonious flavors. The portions seem small but they are perfect and fill you up.

Okay, brought my hubby here to try and he loved the #35.  He did say pastrami one would be good. Carol also made some amazing potato soup that was the best I had especially on this cold day. Hopefully they keep making it!

Amazing sandwiches. My coworker would eat the egg sandwich everyday if she could. I had a salad which was incredible fresh but could have had more chicken.  I understand they are mostly a sandwich shop but I wish their other menu items got as much lovin! The entire staff was very friendly, great location, clean, and inviting.
Charming place and a story to go along with the excellent food. We had the #10 and #66 and both were wonderful. I give this place my highest praise which is "great food!". We will be back!

Solid sandwiches (4 star) and great service (5 star). They were very helpful at the counter in explaining the food and gave great suggestions. The #20 and #25 were excellent. Owner and staff very welcoming.
Great food and customer service! :) #20 was good, so was the Zinger and mozzarella sandwiches.

We got sandwich #25 and it was probably the best sandwich I've ever tasted. The bread, the meat, the cheese... Everything was just perfect! You get a side salad with the sandwich so it's totally worth it. I also ordered a green tea pomegranate which was super refreshing.   The service was exceptional. They offered my dog a treat while we were eating out at the patio. The owner, carol, also came out to survey for our opinion. She is a very neat lady and I'm so glad that we found this place.
Food was great along with the service, everyone was friendly and welcoming and made sure we enjoyed ourselves. We will be making this place one of our regular spots.

A wonderful, casual "sandwich" place.  My friend and I had ordered the #35 lunch sandwich and the #11 breakfast sandwich and traded halves.  We also got the #7 salad to share.  The lunch sandwich also came with a side of potato salad, so it was a bit of a sampler on my first time there.  Everything was excellent.  The owner picked up on my deer in headlights look and came out from behind the counter to explain the menu in a bit more detail.  I really appreciated that.   Apparently the breakfast sandwiches can have the eggs tailored if you prefer scrambled as opposed to poached/over-medium consistency.  There are some spicy items, which I did refrain from because I knew my friend wasn't a fan and we'd be trading halves.  However, he must've missed the fact that there was horseradish in the lunch sandwich we picked...and although I detected it, he didn't seem to notice (or maybe didn't mind) so I assume spices here are not overpowering.  I will definitely be back if I am in the area.   The space itself is decorated in a homey, cute, cozy, charming way.  There ceiling fans inside keep the fresh air flowing in from the giant window-type bar area.  The 20 foot bench up against the wall provides seating for the east side of 5 different tables, and has cute accent pillows.  The vibe is chill, the clientele is a good mix  (young, old, hispanic, caucasian, families, lunch dates)

I'm a regular here for lunch on the weekends.  I've tried just about every sandwich on the menu, and I've loved them all.  Definitely made with love.  They come with a little side salad of your choice, which are also really good.  Not huge portions if that's what you're looking for, but perfect, in my opinion, and decently priced.  The front patio area is nice too.  Highly recommended.

Found this place on accident. Pleasant surprise. Super friendly staff, they seem to really like the place and excited to talk about menu. The sandwiches are round with a crunchy crust. All seemed very fresh. Price point is at the higher end but still within range.   I would definitely come back. Great food, clean, fast, friendly and nice vibe and patio. Small so not a lot of people but...

Today I took my two teenagers into Zookz and we had not been there before.  We were greeted by Carol, the owner and she was so so so nice and sweet and helpful.  She provided stellar customer service and made us feel welcome. She gave a few recommendations and explained that they serve the breakfast sandwiches all day. We ordered two of the turkey bacon avocado sandwiches and one of the roast beef.  This is going to be our new fave place.  The food hit the spot and tasted amazing.  The potato salad is to die for and they even have a few different flavors of fresh brewed tea to choose from. Our favorite tea was the peach flavor.  We also tasted the Nutella banana and peanut butter dessert and it was so good! I will definitely be back.  Next time I will go for breakfast.

Amazing. Simply amazing sandwich. I came here on a weekday afternoon and it was PACKED. The interior was fresh, bright, and airy. The story on how Zookz was created was on the wall and tables which was nice to touch to learn about. Carol, the owner, was so pleasant and truly doing her part to make sure everything was running smoothly and personally ensuring that the customers were happy.  I was starving so I grabbed a garbanzo salad from their grab and go fridge and ordered a number 20. I had every intention of eating a little bit of the salad while I waited and saving the rest for later. Yeah, that totally didn't happen. I ended up eating the whole dang thing. The sandwich was delicious as well. I can't wait to try more flavors. I also split a nutella peanut butter sandwich as a dessert. Can you talk about heavenly?!   I will definitely be back.... often..
Very yummy! Staff was uber friendly and enthusiastic. I had the Zinger minus the bacon and the sauce was awesome.
Great place to eat, friendly staff and the food is good!  I like the unique style..definitely recommend this place!!

It was alright. Not sure if it lived up to its hype. Husband and I both got the #60. I had the brown rice salad which basically tasted like brown rice with salad dressing. Husband had the beans and corn salad which he only ate because he was starving while waiting for his sandwich.   Service was great even though we arrived around 45 minutes before closing. Sorry for that!

No. 5 salad was the best one I've ever had! The service was so good! Also they make their own dressing which is so cool. It was a refreshing place to spend a hot day! The door is super amazing also. Thank you Zooks staff for treating our 30 person group kindly.

We were looking for a light breakfast this morning and this place had great reviews. The set up looks friendly and welcoming. We were greeted right away and we're told of a breakfast special of $10 for a sandwich and mimosa. The mimosa was a smaller portion but it had great fresh orange juice and the owner opened a fresh bottle of champagne. I ordered the No. 66 and Danny ordered the No. 22. All the sandwiches to be honest looked yummy! The sandwich itself was crunchy but not over cooked. The poached egg was great! I would recommend coming to this place, not crowded, great service, great food.

Sandwhiches are my favorite food because you could be so creative with it.  This was the firat time and I LOVED it!  The staff is so friendly and the environment very clean.   I ordered a No. 66 with avacado  and Chipotle sauce.  Sooo...delicious!  Lots of flavor and filling.  The poached eggs are more on the firm side ao if you dont like runny egg yolk, you will be good with a breakfast sandwhich.  All sandwhiches are available to order at anytime and you can substitute all you like.   I also ordered the chocolate & coconut sandwhich for something sweet.  This had too much coconut for me.  I suggested to the staff to have a bannana foster one or a blueberry & cream cheese  one (like a danish) for those that want a little bit of sweet with their meal.    They have awesome herbal unsweetened ice tea.  You have to try a cup.

Wow, what a great sandwich! I didn't expect it to be that good, simpliy because I didn't know exactly what is was. it's basically a super thin but mega crisp pita like pressed sandwich packed to the gills with great ingredients.  I went with the number 20: Turkey with avocado, bacon, cheddar, tomato and honey mustard. What can I say but VERY good! They had quite a few other "sandwiches" there that looked good as well. My sandwich came with this little corn, black bean salad that was dressed perfectly. I also got to sample this oatmeal cake, that was super good. All in all, great little place to pick up a unique sandwich for under $7. My only drawback would be the limited hours they're open, but I get it for the area. Luckily I was home sick today so I was able to get there for lunch.

Zookz offers panini-type sandwiches.  They're the shape of a circle and they're delicious!  I don't like the crust on my bread so this works out for me!  Being from Seattle, I grew up eating Tim's Cascade Chips and miss them so much -- to my delight, they offer them here!  Such a great surprise!  And they offer various kinds, too!  Even better!  They also have a killer kale side salad available!  It really is good - and this is coming from a kale-hater.  Anyway, they are also open for breakfast - not just lunch.  And during lunch they're pretty busy and parking is limited/tight but it's sooo worth it!

I consider their sandwiches adult hot pockets, and they're awesome. I've only had breakfast here but #11 is really good and #22 is my favorite. The owner is always here either in the kitchen or out talking to guests. It's a quiet atmosphere with a very tasteful decor. I get down here about once a month because it's 30 miles out of the way but if it was closer I would come here daily they're that good! One of the few places I've been to that deserves a 6th star.
This place was amazing! Absolutely hit the spot for a breakfast sandwich! I had #22 and hubby had #11. Both were awesome! Will definitely be going back to try the lunch sandwiches
We had a couple different sandwiches here and they've never failed on their taste! Will always recommend to out-of-towners for breakfast!

this place totally reminds me of when my mom bought me that lil sandwich press that made them into triangle pouch type of things in the early 90's. YES pls.... I live the pot pie looking shape.  staff super friendly and helpful and I watched him straight up perie back to the register which was tight after giving a sandwich to a customer. talent!  I got the special which was chorizo in a cream sauce, poached egg, avocado, jack cheese. saut√©ed onions. the chorizo sauce was super yummy but it had very lil (ie pix) and a big juevo.  the kale salad was a lil sweet for me but I really like the orange dressing thing going on there & it came free w/my special.   but it was alright and novelty but something the kiddos would like.

I have been meaning to come here for a long time.  Now that they are at their new location,  I finally made it in. It was delicious!!!! I had the number 40 lunch sandwich. Whoa, was it flavorful. My friend and I both had the garbanzo bean side salad, and I think it was the owner, brought us an extra kale to make sure we tasted it. She also made sure to come back by to ensure we enjoyed everything.  I will definitely be back and highly recommend :)

It's such a simple but brilliant idea.  I am not a sandwich person, as I never really crave the whole bread, cheese, lettuce, meat thing, but I find myself craving Zookz quite often.  Their fresh off the grill, stuffed, crustless sandwiches are amazing, and I absolutely love it!  Lots of variety, quality, and all at a reasonable price.  Would come again and again and again.
Awesome place and atmosphere!!! Super friendly employees as well. Great food highly recommend.

Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix! The sandwiches are unique and really tasty. I typically get the zinger which has poached eggs, cheddar, green onion, bacon and zinger sauce. However, they recently added the 60 which has Apple pulled pork, Cole slaw and Monterrey jack cheese and it's a new favorite as well. I also like their kale salad and pomegranate green tea a lot. They keep the restaurant really clean and the manager is super friendly and cares about her customers. All around a great establishment.
Wow, excellent sandwich and a great kale salad. Meet the owner Carol, she was great. Highly recommend this place.

Great concept, round sandwich shop. It also has other healthy options like Kale salads.  Great little spot for a quick bite. The breakfast sandwiches are my favorite with simple fresh ingredients. Nice service and clean. Nothing fancy but quaint place to eat.
The service was amazing. I got a sandwich that wasn't up my alley. The owner came out and brought me a new one free of charge! Amazing food and I love the salad instead of chips! Awesome place
Yum! One of a kind place.  Such nice people,  great vegetarian options. Somehow, the tomato and mozzarella with basil was Really juicy yet the outside was crisp. Can't wait to go again.

Really cool place to eat. Friendly and fast service. Sandwich was bomb, but the price was a bit high for the size even though it's a neat concept for a sandwich. Just wish the sandwich was a little bigger.

Zookz is a great quick sandwich option for lunch. I have been in the restaurant and also have had their catering at work.   I've had the No. 33 Breakfast Sandwich (2 Poached Eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh spinach,tomatoes and fresh basil), and the No. 45 Lunch Sandwich (Fresh Mozzarella, sliced tomatoes, basil and arugula, Zookz Honey Balsamic Vinaigrette)  The bread I would describe as a croissant type texture, with a pita pocket shape. It's super yummy, and not as carb-loading as a normal sandwich bun would be. If you are really hungry, I would suggest getting a side salad along with your sandwich.   The price point is low, around $5 for the breakfast sandwich, and $7 for lunch.  Their catering is great, it came with labeled boxes, a sign that had the description of every sandwich, and 2 large side salads. Really organized, and a quick clean up.  If you go into their restaurant, you can get in and out quickly, the food comes out fast.  Overall, wonderful, affordable sandwich shop with a little twist! It's definitely a good break from your normal Potbellys, or Jimmy Johns.

Wow, so I live in the west valley, and I sometimes have appointments or errands in this area. I was looking for a light lunch to have with my family, and found this near my location with high reviews. I checked it out and good god I was impressed. The owner had AMAZING customer service, she went over the menu, and all the best sellers with us, and even suggested what the kids would like and how they would like it. At first, I thought to myself "I might have to get two sandwiches because they seem small and I'm really hungry". Well, I'll admit I was wrong. I ordered a lunch sandwich that comes with a side salad (potato salad with black beans). It was all great.       I had to have a bite of everyone's sandwiches at the table, and every single one was great. I had a #10, with turkey, Parmesan, apples, walnuts, cranberries and their sweet heat sauce, and I might have to make that my usual. But I want to try the rest of their menu as well. DEFINITELY a lunch spot I'll be returning to over and over any time I'm in the area!

This place right here.  I've been going to Zookz for probably close to three years--as long as I've been living nearby.  I'm a regular, going once every week and a half or so.  90% of the time I order a #22.  Most of them know me by name, and know I'm going to order a #22.  I'm convinced this is the best sandwich in Arizona.  I want them to name it after me.  I'd have the best sandwich in the state named after me.  It's perfect for breakfast, lunch, or brunch.  Filling, crispy, but not too heavy.  Cures a hangover too.  It's magic.  Every visitor I fly out to Phoenix, friends and family alike, I take to Zookz while they're here.  Every time they're back in town they beg me to go back.  Every single person I've brought here.  I've even flown a #22 2000 miles across the country, just so my friend could have another one.  It wasn't soggy either.  Like I said, those things are magic.  Conveniently located near the light rail too, on the Central corridor.
I think good things come best from simplicity and this is the most perfect simple place! It's cute and the food is so good!

While in Phoenix during Christmas vacation, we are hear.  We shared the No.25 (ham,etc.) and the No.35 (roast beef, etc.).  They both were really tasty.  If either sounds good, I'd recommend trying them.  We also ate the sides of potato salad and kale salad.  The sides were quite good compliments to the sandwich.  The owner came by and said hi.  She seems nice and that was a plus.  If there was any downside, it's that sometimes I have a big appetite and the portion was just enough to satisfy me.  In fairness, when the food is really good, I tend to want more than I need.

It's like eating an adult uncrustable, but better and not soggy. The ambience is nice, and they have a washing station! Say what??! Order the #55, it's the best dessert sandwich. It's like eating a Peanut butter, banana, Nutella goodness. Their #15 with turkey and mild curry was a little sour for my taste which isn't a flavor I expect from curry.

Zookz is a fantastic untraditional sandwich and salad restaurant in uptown Phoenix.  I have had several of their breakfast & lunch sandwiches and salads from here before and I just keep on coming back for more. This place rocks! The inside is extremely well kept and visually appealing. The staff members are all friendly and are prompt to help you with any questions you may have about the menu. These guys work pretty quickly too in order to get you your food in a timely manner. The menu itself is pretty extensive too. Sometimes I would prefer shops like this to specialize in one type of product but their business model works (and taste) great! So much so that they close pretty early around 3 o'clock on the daily. I have loved all the menu items I have tried here.  If you find yourself in uptown for lunch you have to give Zookz a try!

My husband's been wanting to try this place so we decided to check it out on one of our trips into Phoenix.  Very friendly staff, simple menu, very delicious food.  I can't really explain what the sandwiches are like.  You just have to try it out.  It's like a closed in sandwich but when you bite into it, there's just a burst of delicious goodness.  Although I wasn't "full" after our sandwich (they're not very big but I would say probably the size of a sandwich that we SHOULD be eating) I was very satisfied.  Next time we're in the area I'd definitely go back.  Their green iced tea was yummy too!

I always order to go but I just have to say that their sandwiches are the best sandwiches EVER. I love them so much. I think about them every time I'm hungry. Who ever prepares my orders thank you so much, you guys are the best.

Good prices, great concept, no flavor. Maybe I should have asked for salt and pepper. The bread has very little flavor and very tough on the teeth. Thank God I have perfect teeth but many don't and this sandwich could be uncomfortable to eat. Mouth feel of a soft thin brick. Egg was cooked rare and without the salt and pepper had no flavor either. The pictures look amazing but the product has some shortfalls.

I stumbled upon this place with my boyfriend as we were driving up Central Avenue looking for a place for brunch. It's perfect if you're looking for a relaxing, tasty experience that won't be expensive. They serve sandwiches for breakfast and lunch with fantastic side dishes. My favorite sandwich is the one with ham, brie, apricot jam, and almonds! I have been back multiple times and I have never had something I did not like. The absolute best thing there is the kale salad, which seems crazy I know, but they dress it up so well that the kale is soft and sweet. I could eat multiple bowls of it in one sitting (this coming from someone who despises kale in most settings.) The owner always comes to check on how we liked everything and sometimes brings us the sandwiches when they're ready. They have a nice patio with outdoor seating and the front of the store opens up so everyone can enjoy the morning breeze. Overall this place consistently provides delicious food and awesome service!

I love breakfast sandwiches! Zooks are amazing! I went off menu with a simple pouched egg, bacon and green onions with gluten-free bread.  Loved it.  My spouse had number 66 and she was very happy also.  Sure hope this becomes a franchise and will spread across the country!

We got our salad and sandwiches to go for our hiking trip. We got the No9 kale salad and 4 other sandwiches. Even after hiking for 2 hours our food was still good after putting them in a food saver bag. The kale salad was one of the best kale salads I ever had! The kale along with the mandarin oranges and they dressing was so delicious! I would definitely come back here to just eat the salad. The sandwiches all came with either chips or small salad. My family chose to get the different small salads and they were all good! Such a cute concept with the circle sandwiches and everything was fresh tasting.
Super yummy Gluten Free sandwiches! I ordered the No. 10 (Turkey with cranberries, apples and cheese) I could eat the Kale Salad with citrus vinaigrette every day.

Excellent service! Have talked to the owner a few times and she is such a beautiful soul. The food is really good. They are really willing to help you find something you'll like.
