They also make the effort of you have allergies to ensure something great regardless of your limitations! A weekly meal!

This is an outstanding lunch spot.  The sandwiches don't look too big, but they're actually pretty filling. I got the #20, and it was absolutely delicious.  I had a salad on the side, and that was very tasty and super nutritious, too!  More than anything else, the service was great.  Both people working the day I came in were incredibly kind and patient, offering solid menu suggestions, but without rushing anyone.  I really hope to return soon.    ENJOY!

Came here for breakfast today, and it was a great experience. Ordered a number 33 with a cake. Really good food. Came out fast, and the decor is really cute and modern. Excited to come back and try other sandwiches !   Only thing I would say is maybe have Tabasco as a condiment to accompany Siracha. I like adding a lot hot sauce lol
I am not a big fan of this sandwich. Maybe it's because I compared it with other stores and I like others more than this one. However, I like their kale salad.
1st time here.. interesting place. Food was good, on the small portion size. I will try it again.

They put chicken in our vegetarian sandwich order. Agreed to give refund and then called to tell us we were wrong that it was mozzarella. The turkey sandwich ordered had a fishy taste :( and the corners of the bread were very hard and inedible. Almost all of it went in the garbage.  Pictures looked so good on the menu. Was very disappointed and then angry the owner called to tell us we can't tell the difference between mozzarella and chicken. I am sure most anyone can tell the difference from cheese and chicken. just...no. Stay away.

One of my favorite places to go when I'm around my office near downtown Phoenix. My to go items are the breakfast No 33 and lunch No 20. The portion looks pretty small at first but it definitely fills you up. The food service is pretty quick so it's perfect for in between work. The parking is alright - can be hard to find space during lunch time.

Crisp light lunch in a perfect size, round, grilled sandwich. It's not your typical, greasy Phoenix food. When I eyed the kale and coconut salad (which is really good, by the way), I was transported back to LA. Food here is both healthy and delicious. It made me feel good about yourself instead of feeling weighed down and heavy.

This was my first time trying Zookz and I was extremely pleased! I tried #20 which was a turkey, cheddar, bacon, tomato and avocado sandwich which was fantastic! Their sandwiches are round and toasted to perfection to where the cheese melts throughout the sandwich.  All lunch sandwiches include a side salad which was the perfect amount to compliment the sandwich. I choose to try the Garbanzo bean salad which was delicious.   The service and seating was superb! After you order you sit down and they bring you your meal. They have an open air concept with indoor and outdoor seating with misters. I had a great meal and experience and will be looking forward to my next sandwich here!

Delicious looking menu, friendly service. I ordered the caprese sandwich, the roast beef sandwich, and one of the sweet sandwiches (I don't remember the numbers). Ordered to go which was probably a mistake because the bread was on the soggy side when I got home. My fault completely. The garbanzo bean side salad - best part of the meal.  I will be back but I will be eating in.

Very Tasty, but I left hungry...  Sandwiches are very well made and then pressed in a sandwich maker to seal the edges. $8 gets you a sandwich and a side salad. Only issue is I could have eaten 3 sandwiches, but if you have a smaller appetite you will enjoy, I will not be back.

I took the fam out for breakfast on Memorial Day...this is a major undertaking because NONE of us can agree on anything these days!  Option A was too expensive and Option B was too loud.  Option C was not open for the holiday...you get the drill.  I made the executive decision to go to Zookz...it's been on my bookmark list for a while now and I had ceased to care about anyone else's opinion ;)  We arrived at 10:30 and were all excited about getting caught up.  After ordering, we grabbed a table outside under the misters and noshed on a coconut/oatmeal cookie for our appetizer.  Breakfast was delivered quickly and was packaged picnic-style.  The outer layer of these sandwiches is intriguing,.....sealed all around and crisp.  The insides contained poached egg, cream cheese, and a host of delicious options.  Our menu selections had been recommended by the staff and we enjoyed them.  I took half home for the next day's lunch.  The sides were all interesting...Nephew got the potato salad and declared it delicious.  The cookie was really yummy as well.  Niece and I had coffee which was excellent too.  The price was reasonable...I fed 6 people for $55 and we all left satisfied.  All in all, it was a nice outing and a great get-together.
Amazing!!!! The best brekky sandwich and lunch sandwiches. The only thing I don't like about this place is that it isn't open for dinner. Owner is awesome and people working there are super friendly.

I love and miss this place so much!!! They're sandwiches are not your normal sandwiches or panini for that matter. Stuff between 2 slices of bread? Yes. But it's the way they prep/cook it. They're round and toasted in custom jaffle molds. Sandwiches come out piping out and filled with deliciousness. My favorite are the breakfast sandwiches, particularly #22. But really, everything is delicious.

Mediocre sandwiches. Great service.  I like veggies, especially lettuce and tomato on mine and there is none of that.  Also no crusts, they are cut off in the process of sandwich making, so I guess all the best parts are missing.  No kids menu means a 16 dollar lunch for an adult and child.    Eh, won't be back.
Best sandwiches in the vally. Very cool atmosphere (digging the orange patio furniture) and super friendly people who seem like they love their jobs. Top notch location!

I am a freshman at Grand Canyon University and recently ran out of money in my meal plan so I have been adventuring off campus to get food since I'm not limited to spending money on campus anymore. Zookz is by far my new favorite place to go. The employees are very nice and helpful, the place is very modern and inviting. The food was not what I was expecting. I honestly don't know how to describe it but the sandwiches are similar to paninis but not similar at all.. take my word for it, this place is worth the extra cash! I will definitely be coming back and bringing my friends!!

My wife and I were checking out eating places we haven't been to for lunch and came upon this hidden, one of a kind sandwich restaurant.  We went in because of the mouthwatering pictures on the billboard just outside the front door. The outdoor seating looked like a fun place to catch some rays and enjoy our lunch.  Upon arrival the outside tables and tables inside restaurant were clutter free and the restaurant was very clean. We were greeted by the Owner, Carol, and she welcomed us with a big hello. She was very helpful in explaining all of the sandwiches and asked us what we liked and then guided us to specific flavors and toppings that we might like. I had the #50. It was awesome. The capers, olive, tomato and the artichoke tapenade really married with the mozzarella cheese and ham. The crispy crust on bread was flakey like a empenada. So different and one of a kind, than any sandwich on this continent. Carol designed and Patent the sandwich press to be just hers. It was designed after her grandmothers cooking vessel from South Africa, where she got the idea from grandma's breakfast she always was served. My wife had #44. I tried the sandwich and was in heaven. The eggs frittata were perfectly cooked, moist and super flavorful. The roasted peppers and cheeses blended together with the bacon, basil and ham. My wife didnt want the feta and substituted cheddar instead. Carol explained, we will make whatever you want. She was so awesome and friendly. The cashier was super too. Very helpful in describing what ingredients were in food. The potato salad is crazy good!!! Wasn't real sure by looking at it, corn and black beans in it, but it is my new favorite potato salad. This place is so different, you have to try it. Cant compare this type of sandwich to anyone. One of a kind. Very creative. Carol does it right. By the way, for dessert we got a treat. Carol made us #55. A great way to finish lunch. Warm Peanut butter, Nutella, bananas, and roasted almonds. Very sinful. Not being a big dessert type guy, all I could say was, oh my God. Chef John's Stamp of approval. Definitely will be back soon. If you go, tell Carol, John and Linda recommended trying Zookz.

Very different approach on sandwiches and I like it.   I love the ingredients and all the different options that they have. It is fresh and yummy for sure.   Portions are perfect but not everybody would agree with me on that one. For me it is just right amount of food.   Service is great and atmosphere is nice. Location is awesome and I cant wait to go back again!

I forget the number but I got the turkey, avocado, and bacon sandwich and the kale side salad. The sandwich was really good and I loved the salad! I asked for my sandwich w/o tomatoes and it was delivered to me with tomatoes so my husband took it back for me to get it fixed. It wasn't a big deal, I'm a picky eater and used to my food not coming out to me the way I ordered it, plus the food didn't take long to cook.   While we waited a woman came out, I think the owner, and apologized and offered dessert to us dessert on the house. She made us this delicious peanut butter, banana and  Nutella sandwich, so good!!  Overall, the food was really good but the 5 stars is for the service. I used to work for a well-known foodie deli in Ann Arbor, Mi (Zingerman's), where not only was I taught to appreciate food but also the value and importance of great service. If we made a mistake, we went the extra mile to fix it. Even though I wasn't upset about the mistake, I REALLY appreciate that they went above and beyond to make up for it. This is part of the reason eating at local, small businesses rock!

Guys, these sandwishes (if you can call them that?) are amazing.  Hands down, they were some of the best sandwishes ive ever had. We tried 4 different ones and we loved all of them.  And my wife loved the kale salad also.   That being said, im giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because i felt like the price was a little high considering how large the sandwiches were.   Will i be coming here again next time im in the area? Yes!  Would i come here often if i lived in the area? No. Too expensive for my big appetite.  My wife on the other hand said she was filled between the kale salad and the sandwich. Me? I ate 2 sandwiches and most of my kids sandwich (2 and a half) and i could have eaten the other half...

Amazing place!! Their sandwiches are out of this world, especially the #22 of the breakfast, which is what I personally had. Hands down this is the best sandwich shop in the U.S. A trip to Phoenix would not be complete without this restaurant.

Oh my GOD!!! This concept is perfect. The food is absolutely nothing I've ever heard of, and yet somehow perfect, homey, and like comfort food. We go the  #35, roast beef, cheddar, horseradish and the #66 Breakfast sandwich with bacon, cheddar, cream cheese. Grrrrrrr! I wish I lived near here and could eat here EVERY DAY!!!! The fresh squeezed OJ!!! Amazing! Cute place. Really nice decor, sweet staff. They have a great back story, perfect food, and people who clearly like their job, who work here. I hope they expand to more locations (hint hint, nudge nudge!!)
Got #20. Awesomeness made in a small pocket. In a world where now a "toasted Sammie" is not unique, Zookz deliverz!  Can't wait to make it back and try another one.

This is a special sandwich as good as I have ever had. We tried 4 different ones and each was better than the next. A great concept, well executed and very tasty. Btw, the sides were fantastic as well.

Convenient parking, fresh and delicious food, great menu, friendly and helpful staff. I especially enjoyed the outside seating. I understand the necessity of packaging the kale salad in a plastic container, but I am all about waste reduction. I cannot remember if they recycle, but if they do it would make for a better dining experience for me.   I will definitely be back!

Our family loves Zookz. We've eaten here countless times. The sandwiches are good. The side items are good and the desserts are good. But the friendly, lovely owner makes this place so great to visit. She is ALWAYS so kind to my entire family. She has given us free sides when they've just been introduced to get our feedback, or a surprise treat for my children. Just a really special lady that cares about the people she serves and the food she puts out. Great combo. The people know your name and your order because they care and pay attention when you walk in.

Modern and trendy sandwich place.  I got the #25 and it was OK overall... It tasted basically just like a normal hot sandwich that just happened to have a unique shape to it. In other words, it was fine, just nothing memorable. Prices are high given the quality of ingredients (which IMO, seemed pretty run-of-the-mill) and portion size (small).  In short: More flash than substance...

After driving by this place many times, I finally made it over for lunch...and I wish I had done it sooner. It was absolutely delicious. The staff was super friendly and the chef/owner herself walks around to make sure all customers are satisfied!

Heaven. I love it when a place offers breakfast all day. Not that I got the breakfast, but just thought I'd mention that nice perk. First of all, the employees are all so helpful, kind and accommodating; and they were eager to please. These sandwiches are absolutely delicious. They are all pretty unique in one way or another, but my husband and I split two different sandwiches and were equally thrilled with both. Their crust is enough by itself to make any sandwich taste good.  For those of you with a picky palate, they are willing to make a sandwich however you please, so don't fret when you don't see anything on the menu that sounds good. Also tried the kale salad and potato salad. Both were absolutely delicious and unique!  All in all, my tummy was extremely happy when we left and I will definitely be back.
Awesome breakfast sandwiches and love love love the you can substitute avocado for bacon!
Love this little place!  Great food, great customer service, and reasonably priced.  Highly recommend trying out this little neighborhood shop!
Stacy was great and had amazing customer service.  This #33 add turkey is bommmmb.com. beefy good portion size for the price

I love Zookz and it has been an integral part of the central and camelback neighborhood for many years. Zookz offers a unique sandwich filled with delicious ingredients that have not been replicated elsewhere. I recommend the #35, with roast beef and horseradish and the kale salad. I will have to return to try the soup that will be coming to the menu soon! The owner is very warm and personable and the story on how Zookz came to be is very inspiring!

Love this place! Unique little sandwiches with quality ingredients! The best service, not the kind where they pester you, but the kind where they ask if you're enjoying your food and if you've been there before. I like this spot when I'm in uptown Phoenix.

Had breakfast here a couple of weeks ago, after a hike, and their sandwiches were delicious. Both my friend and I loved them. And the prices like the service were fantastic. I will definitely be back.

LUNCH OUTTING.   I've been driving past this place since I moved here April 3rd and finally stopped in....   I am now kicking myself for waiting a month before I was introduced to coolest places for sandwiches.   We first walked in around 1145am and it was too crowded but we had to wait in a small line. My friend and I l we discussing to each other what we were going to order. As we wakes up the lady at the counter was already on top of our order from hearing us and wrote down a 15 and a 20 on our bags. we then proceeded to talk to my friend about the 15 and how they tried it with a new ingredient recently which enhanced the sandwich. At that point I asked the lady if this was her shop. She told me it was hers and that they would love to hear our feed back with any suggestion on sandwiches and ingredients.she always gave us her recommendation on which side was her favorite and the most popular. (the sandwich comes with a side or a bag of chips).   I ordered the turkey with avocado and bacon and a spicy Dijon sauce. My side was the garbanzo bean salad. We sat down at the table and the owner delivered our food herself. The sandwich came out pressed, toasted, and eye popping. My mouth began to salivate immediately!!    The sandwich was as delicious as it looked. crispy from the toasted bread. smokey from the bacon. creamy from the avocado. spicy from the mustard.  would I go back?  Verdict: ABSOLUTELY!   let me mention it was impressive to get such personal service from the owner of the business. she was attentive, helpful, inclusive, and genuine. you don't get service like this very often from the proprietor very often. the price was appropriate and the service was above and beyond excellent.
So today was the 4th time eating here in about a week, (I live like 25 min away)  still shocked how amazing the food is! Good job ladies!!!!
Easily one of our favorite sandwich places in town. Even the side salad that comes with the sandwich taste great.

We had the breakfast sandwiches. The chipotle one and the basil spinach one. I liked the basil spinach one the best. The eggs ended up being more hard boiled than I was expecting since the menu described them as poached eggs, overall they were really good! *Be sure to read the cute story on their wall about how they started!

This is a fun place to try Imagine round filled pastry/bread filled with tasty ingredients.  I had number 45 Turkey and Latte Nice people who offer to answer questions Yes they have almond milk and some high tables for outdoor seating

Found this place using the "nearby" feature on the Yelp app and decided to give it a try. The menu is small but varied, the price is awesome ($4.50-$4.75), and the product is delicious. I got a vegetarian breakfast sandwich (#33: two poached eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh spinach) and my boyfriend got the Nutella, peanut butter, banana, almond sandwich. We both happily demolished them immeditately. Both Carol, the owner, and the young guy working the register were pleasant and conversational. Carol seemed to make fast friends with every customer who walked in, making sure to check on them and ask their names. One unusual thing about Zookz is the addition of a small sink at the beverage counter. This is so useful for dumping out leftover ice and liquids and rinsing plastic containers before you place them in the recycle bin next to it.   Oh, and they have punch cards! 10th sandwich is free! We will definitely be trying this place again.
Always tasty, always nice staff and always satisfying. The husband always craves to come here. It hits the spot when you are look for fast-casual, freshly made food.

The sandwiches here are delicious! On the smaller side but they bake the bread so it's more like a hot pocket style. Was delicious. The salads are on the bigger side. Every sandwich comes with a side salad but they aren't very appetizing looking. The restaurant is open concept but I believe they close the windows during the summer. Overall good food, decent prices, and they have $5 mimosas. The teas are also really good. Would consider if you're in the area and want a sandwich.
I try to eat healthy but really can't. When you taste the salad and any sandwich your mouth will water like never before  Amazing Service

Stopped in for breakfast and left a happy camper.  I love toasted breads and the outer crust of this sandwich was cooked/paninied/whatever-they-do perfectly. I really enjoyed the 33 but wish the egg yolk was left a little runny...not sure if that's possible with these sandwiches. I also sampled the 44 but did not like it as much. The egg ratio was way too much and I was hoping to see more crispy bacon. Breakfast prices are reasonable but if lunch portions are the same, then I'd be a bit more hesitant.

My first time here, and I had to kick myself for not coming sooner!  Delicious sandwiches and salads. The kale salad was so good I could actually picture being a vegetarian. I will definitely be back for great food at a great price.

What a great find! Driving back to CA we yelped this amazing little sandwich shop and it did not disappoint. Circular, pressed sandwiches full of yummy happiness. We tried the turkey curry & turkey apple cranberry, delicious side salads, topped off with a gooey chocolate chip cookie.   The Zooks crew was also so accommodating to our picky 5 y.o.... Happy kid happy parents. :)  We will definitely be back!

I had lunch at zooks with my family. We had a fantastic experience. The food was delicious and between the four of us we got 4 different sides that were all great. The owner was amazing and sweet. The ice tea selection was great and delicious! I will definitely be back anytime I am in Phoenix.

Luckily I saw ZookZ on check please Arizona, what an incredible place to go the sandwiches are absolutely perfect, I had the number 66 and it was incredible and for desert I had the 55 . The service was impeccable and the owner absolutely knows what she's doing, the perfect hostess, great job can't wait to go back, I recommend this place to everybody 10 out of 10 .

I absolutely love the vibe here! It's so modern and the service are just amazing! I did some research before coming in so I already know what I wanted. But the girl at the counter as all ready and about to explain the menu to me cause I told it was my first time. She was so nice and helpful.   The food itself was very good! The crust was a little hard to chew on but the sandwich itself was a must have! It so good, the break is very soft and crispy, nothing fell out of my sandwich, and it also came with a side of your choice!   I would definitely come back here. Love it!

This was my first time here.  When I opened the bag and pulled out my sandwich, I thought they accidentally slipped me a Kid's meal.  Although the food tasted good I expected an actual adult meal for what I paid.  Once was enough for me. Then I had to do the walk of shame passed my co-work that I convinced to try it as well.  She glared at me as I passed with my head down in shame !!

Love Zooks!!     I actually crave the chickpea side they offer (you get one side with your sandwich) ... and I order two chickpea sides so I can have one for later.    I've had a few different sandwiches here  and loved them all.     The owner is also very nice and you can sense the passion she has for what she does  :)
This is the best breakfast sandwich I've tasted anywhere! I've come two days in a row. My favorite is the No. 22. It's flavorful, warm and very filling. I can't wait to try the lunch ones!

This place is so over rated on yelp. Only went because of the ratings. Had a #20 with potato salad. Portions are small prices are high. Not a great value. The sandwiches are not like anything I've ever seen before very innovative, but doesn't change the taste... It's just very trendy and in an area with a bunch of trendy people. Worth a try, but not anything to ever recommend to anyone.

Zookz is the best sandwich in the game, period! Most sandwiches in Phoenix are overpriced, traditional, & particular boring - whereas Zookz is cheap, unique, & healthy! Everyone from management to the cashiers are respectful & loving, & I am always excited to eat the best sandwich in Phoenix!
Breakfast prepared just right with a good blend of seasonings, not too greasy, bread had a nice bite to it. Recommend breakfast no. 44.

This place is great.   Zooks is just a stones throw away from where I live. My girlfriend recommended to me so I thought I'd check it out. Zooks is kinda like a Cornish Pasty co. on the go and less hearty. Although, I believe Zooks food is completely fresh. I will most likely be back and would recommend this place to others. For breakfast the number 11. sandwich is great.  Pros:  -great service -short wait times -awesome tasting food -great prices  Cons: -I feel like there are random close times on the weekends -not much parking

My husband suggested going here for lunch today as he's a sandwich lover and we hadn't tried Zookz yet. I really wasn't expecting much as sandwiches are typically pretty straight forward.   We walked up to order and I saw they had breakfast sandwiches, I asked if they sold breakfast all day since an egg sandwich sounded really good. They said that they usually only serve breakfast in the morning, but will check to see if they would do it for me anyway, I said "No prob, I'll just order from the lunch menu." as I didn't want to be a pain. They checked with the kitchen anyway and said it would be no problem to make a breakfast sandwich. I asked for mine with no parmesan as I can't eat cow's milk. The chef then came out and asked if I would like anything else in replacement, I told her I couldn't eat cow's milk dairy, so she then offered to give me goat cheese instead. How cool is that? I try not to be a pain with my dietary issues, but they went above and beyond with their service and to accommodate me.  As for the food; my sandwich was really tasty, eggs were cooked right with fresh spinach and tomatoes, and the bread was nice and crusty, and it had extra goodness due to the added goat cheese.   My husband had the turkey avocado, I tried a bite and it was equally as good as my sandwich. The sweet mustard dressing was a really good addition. His also came with a kale salad which was as good as the sandwiches.  I would highly recommend Zookz and will definitely be back!

Delish! A foodies grab and go dream! Looking for a perfect panini-style breakfast sandwich with perfect poached eggs for breakfast or something original for lunch with quality fresh ingredients!? Try this locally owned ladies sandwich shop who is twisting up something unique and creative. I want one at the airport and in Scottsdale. Yummy!

I was in the area and saw many great reviews of this place on yelp so I decided to try a breakfast sandwich..#66 its a popular one and I thought it was very delicious! I just think they're way too small, I saw a review that said it was big and filling and I personally thought it wasn't because its way too small. I felt good with what I ate but they're small for the price. The lunch sandwiches are like almost $9 and honestly not worth the price. If anything a breakfast sandwich is worth it because its cheaper.

Stopped in to get breakfast after reading Yelp reviews.  Sandwiches were yummy and really fresh.  My husband got a lunch sandwich and loved the kale salad that came with it.  Great coffee as well.  Owner was really friendly and helpful.  We live in Washington, DC and are sorry that this is not a place we can frequent!

Been wanting to come here for a while and finally stopped in earlier this morning. I got the number 20 and it was pretty good. The potato salad on the side was okay, nothing special. Overall it's a nice place, food is good, but I feel like the portions are small.

We live in Medlock district, within walking distant to Zookz.  Watched it come up and intended to give it a try early on but didn't.  One Sunday morn, on a walk with my older girl and with the baby in her mei tai, I realized they would be open by the time we finished.  When I arrived they had JUST opened for the day.  I was a sweaty mess and dragging my girls in.  The owner Carole was working and she was a VERY gracious host.  Explained the concept, asks us to make adjustments as desired and mentioned the kale & mandarin orange salad that is given with catering orders when I inquired for my office.  I got a few sandwiches to go so hubby and son could try them out as well.  She packed everything nicely for my walk home, poured the drink for me AND tossed in a sample of the salad.  BTW: Kale isn't high on my 'delish' meter.  However, this is now my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE SALAD hands down.  I actually drool at little whenever I think about it (darn it, there I go again...).  We have now gone a few more times and each sandwich has been warm, moist, toasty, crisp, flavorful and so wonderful it makes my husband smile to think about it.  One of our top 5 eateries and I personally LOVE her backstory (check out the About portion of their website).  Start-up businesses are rough.  We have a lot of great local-owned food establishments in the valley.   I truly wish her the best.  She's got a few more fans and regular customers from my house!

Delicious! Had the kale side salad with a #60 sandwich (pulled pork and Coke slaw). Husband had the garbanzo bean side salad and a #15 (chicken with yellow curry, carrots, pineapple, and cranberries). Both fishers were great, but I would get the garbanzo bean salad with the chicken curry sandwich again. Waiting on the peanut butter, banana, and Nutella sandwich now!

Sandwiches were very yummy! It's a quick little restaurant that's good for dine in or take out. I got the mozzarella tomato and basil sandwich. I also tried their iced teas which were fantastic! I was visiting Arizona with my dad and this place did not disappoint. If I were back in town I'd go again.   Tip: check in for a small percentage off your bill
This place this unbelievable awesome. I am a vegetarian. I didn't know no.45 has cheese at first. After I noticed, they customized a no-cheese veggie sandwiches for me free! Great service!
It's like a giant fancy uncrustable. If you like a toasted sandwich this is a must try. We might even come back tomorrow.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after waiting way too long to be helped at Ellys and I'm glad Ellys didn't work out because this place was awesome. As soon as we walked in the owner greeted us and gave us some suggestions. I ordered the 44 and my boyfriend ordered the 35 and they were both great (he just wished there was slightly less horse radish, but no biggie). As we were eating she brought us out a complementary kale salad which was very good. I didn't realize they had coffee when I ordered so I asked for a coffee instead of my drink and she gave me my coffee for free! Awesome place, awesome service, awesome food.
Oh, this is just the best! Sandwiches, side dishes, everything. I was taken there by a friend who said it was a good restaurant. I say, GREAT. A refreshing alternative for the usual ho hum.

I really enjoy eating lunch here....so much, I've come here 2 days in a row and I don't ever do that!    The portions are perfect...you'll be pleasantly full.  But more than that....your taste buds will thank you!  Everything I've had here was uniquely different and delicious!!!

A very cool twist on the traditional sandwich.  Great menu choices.  Side salads were different and wonderful.  Don't miss the peanut butter/Nutella sandwich as a desert. Great staff.  Terrific food.  We will be back for sure.
I ordered using UberEATS and had placed a comment that my friend had an allergy and they happily accommodated a sandwich to her liking. Amazing place and great service !

Zookz is one of those places where the cool concept works well. I had one of the breakfast pockets number 66 and all the fillings tied together perfectly. In that delicious pick was poached eggs, cheese, a chipotle sauce and some other filling that I forgot. Each bit was crunchy, savory and just damn good.

There is this cool, clamp sandwich applicance my family has used for years that was originally developed in India. Well, this brilliant Arizona female entrepreneur has taken that basic concept and adapted it to a larger, toasted sandwich filled with all sorts of incredible ingredients. I had a breakfast sandwich filled with poached eggs, feta, spinach and tomatoes that was delicious. I also appreciated how the owner came out and spoke with customers, many who were trying her sandwiches for the first time. I suggest that everyone give this creative endeavor a try--they're yummy! They have both breakfast and lunch items. Congrats, and best wishes to this winner of a new concept.

Stopped here for a lunch after reading good reviews. They were pretty spot on. The owner is a very nice lady who is very involved and is local, which is cool by me. Always good to support local small businesses.  The menu isn't too large but you can customize your sandwiches. I tried to have my sandwich with chipotle sauce instead of mustard, and it even said it on the bag, but i definitely still got mustard, or their chipotle sauce tastes exactly like mustard....   The sandwich was pretty good. A little small and the flavors are kind of all blended together which is a little different, but good. They have Tim's chips which are amazing (try the sour cream chips) and the price is reasonable, although if you are really hungry this is probably not going to be a place to order just one sandwich.  I appreciate the owner's dedication and effort in a tough area (near the light rail in north central phoenix), but I worry about the ability to run a successful business there. I think a place like this would do amazing in old town or PV or near ASU. Probably even in growing rural parts of Chandler and Gilbert. It's got a tough battle being located where it is, mainly because of the lack of foot or car traffic. I hope they do or that they move somewhere closer to me because I did like the place.  I will definitely stop by here again if I am in that area and I wish this place the best, thanks again.

This place is great for lunch! The sandwiches are made fresh and the sides are delicious.  I ordered a #45 (Very similar to a caprese style sandwich), all the ingredients were put into a pita style bread, it didn't taste like pita, it tasted like bread if that makes sense.  Then the sandwich was pressed and heated. It was very tasty. My only complaint is that it was a little small. I easily finished it, and I rarely finish my food.  They have several sides to choose from, she gave me two so I could try them both. One was the kale salad the other was a chickpea salad... both were super flavorful. In fact, I next time I might see if they will put the chickpea salad in the bread and grill that up! Obviously, I plan on going back =)
Delicious toasties and teas in a breezy open air cafe. I'd definitely go back if I'm ever in town again!

There's definitely a lot to like about Zookz and their unique twist on a sandwich shop.  The prices are great, the service is friendly, the atmosphere is chill, and online ordering is a snap.  I wouldn't call my first visit here a home run, but I can see why so many CenPho folks make this place their lunch staple.  I actually decided to venture here after leaving early from work on a Tuesday.  I had read the stellar reviews on Yelp (as well as a glowing recommendation from my sister) and figured I'd give it a go.  Their website makes a point of advertising the online ordering process so I figured I'd play it safe this time and order in advance in case of a big lunch rush.  The online ordering process is quite easy as you just pick your sandwich, choose a pickup time, pay, and done (I understand some folks may have reservations about paying for food in advance but I digress).  I came by around 11:30am to pick up my food.  As many have accurately pointed out, parking here is a chore.  In fairness I knew that in advance as I've patronized numerous restaurants and businesses in the area but parking has always been scarce.  Here's a tip, park a block north of Zookz on Pierson Street.  There's usually a decent amount of street parking and I believe the parking lot on the northwest corner of Pierson and Central can be used (though don't quote me on that).  I parked in that parking lot today and had no issues, so there you go.  Or if you take the light rail, the Central & Camelback station is just a couple of blocks away.    The restaurant itself is fairly small, but actually has a great deal more seating than I expected (including a decent amount of outdoor patio seating).  The orange and green color scheme is rather, eh, interesting, though they do keep the restaurant pretty clean.  Maybe I came at the right time, but there was barely anyone there when I got there at 11:30am.  Perhaps the lunch crowd hadn't yet flowed in.  In any event I came up to the counter, my food was ready, they let me pick a salad (I went with potato), and off I went.  The sandwiches here are unique in that they're made using an old school stove-top method.  They describe the process on their website, but essentially you get a sandwich that almost looks more like a stuffed pancake.  I got the #20 lunch sandwich (turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, cheddar, and Zookz' own housemate sweet mustard).  Super tasty sandwich and for the most part the unique bread was a good compliment.  My only complaint was that the outer crust of my sandwich was pretty rock hard.  Not sure if thats normal, but it was a slightly unpleasant part of an otherwise pleasant experience.  The potato salad side I got was also pretty tasty.  Total price for the sandwich and side salad was $7.  I actually got a $1 off my order as they had a holiday online promo code I could use.  And I believe a Yelp check-in can get you 10% off if you're just a walkup customer.  Good price for a good amount of food.  I didn't feel uncomfortably full, but satisfied.  I'd certainly come back here again for lunch or to try one of their breakfast sandwiches.  I'm not sure they allow it, but it'd be nice to customize my own sandwich with my own choice of ingredients.  I'll investigate that possibility the next time.  Overall, a good choice, Yelpers.  A few kinks to work out before I give it the 5 star treatment, but Carole Meyer's creation shows a lot of promise.

I had the #11 and #20. I didn't really like the breakfast sandwich (11), the poached egg was not what I expected.  The yolk was completely cook. I guess I thought it was gonna come a little runny. The lunch one (20) was fantastic! Threw a little hot sauce on it... YUM!

Came to pick up an order. But when I got there I got an iced latte with caramel flavor. It wasn't the best drink but it wasn't the worst drink either. Definitely want to come back to try their food. The menu looked great. They have seats outside and a huge open window which is cool. Also their door is so big but definitely not heavy.  Check in on yelp & get 10% off

What a darling little sandwich shop!   Do you remember those old fashioned round sandwich makers our grandmother had?   The owner,  Carol, took it to a whole new level.   Yummy stuffed sandwiches,  from breakfasts to lunch,  to sweet.   Give it a whirl.  Try #66.  A breakfast favorite.
So impressed! Will definitely be back again. The #20 was delicious and reminded me of a better hot pocket but with fresh ingredients! Fair priced and tastes good. Also have gluten free that is good!

I would NEVER pass up an opportunity to stop by Zookz when I'm in the area. Heck, I'd even drive a few miles extra to be able to stop by and grab a sandwich pillow full of delicious goodness, made with fresh ingredients, toasted and sealed to perfection. Quite honestly, Zookz has the BEST sandwiches I've ever had -- they're a cross between an adult gourmet version of hot pockets and paninis... and if THAT'S not a great combo, I don't know what is!   Not only do I make it a point to stop by Zookz when I'm in the area, I bring someone with me every time. One bite of the deliciousness served up by Zookz and you get hooked, I'm telling you. I brought my mom with me and at first she was a bit skeptical, but it was love at first bite. She ordered the No. 35 (Thinly sliced roast beef, crisp bacon, fresh tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and Zookz Horseradish Sauce), which came with a side kale salad. I ordered the No. 66 (Cheddar cheese, 2 poached eggs, bacon, tomatoes, green onions, and Zookz zinger cream cheese sauce). It was all extremely flavorful and delicious, so much so that it's almost a sad and disappointing moment when you finish your last bite and realize you don't have more left. On the plus side though, you can always order more (if you're still hungry), or come back for more another time. Yaaasssss!!!  Moral of the story: Don't judge a sandwich just 'cause it looks small and cute; not only will Zookz satisfy your tastebuds, but it will also satisfy your hunger.

Absolutely fantastic place. We are from out of town and found zookz on yelp.... best decision we made all day! Food is a great price, the staff and owner were extremely helpful, and best of all the sandwiches were DELICIOUS!! We highly recommend #20, #25, and #55 as well as the kale salad.   Excellent place to stop for breakfast or lunch! The grilled circle sandwiches "with an edge" are original, unique, and refreshingly full of flavor. The specialty dressings that come are delicious as well. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone looking for a new place to grab a meal.
Yup... delicious! Bread was unique and superb while the sweat heat mustard was incredible on the Bacon, cheddar, turkey, avocado sandwich

I had the opportunity this morning to stop by and try the new Zoosk on Camelback and Central   And I can say I was extremely impressed with the sandwich,  service and ease of ordering.   I ordered a great lunch sandwich instead a breakfast sandwich.  They have so many great sandwiches to choose from,  You should  make up your mind before you go to the counter.  I live in North Scottsdale but I'm definitely going back and trying some other sandwiches as this one was fabulous keep up the great food and service.

When you need a hug from the inside out, head to Zookz! Sandwiches + Salads + Service with a SMILE.  The entire staff is an incredible team that makes you feel right at home. Healthy, indulgent, and custom options available, including Gluten-free, meat-free, and dairy-free items. Their beverage offerings are tasty, too! Say hi to Carole or Bevy Jo if you get a chance!
Love this place! The zinger is so good! I live right next door so i always stop by for a breakfast sandwich. The owner is really nice as well.

These are unique and fabulous sandwiches. The "edge" keeps the juices in the sandwich not running down your arms. I often order these for my office when we have a working lunch.  It doesn't feel much like work when we get to tuck into these. Just one try and you will be hooked.

This an awesome place to have breakfast customers service is great the food is wonderful the owner is very nice she was asking everyone for there opinion and introduced herself she's very nice. The food came out fast and very well cooked my husband and I had a wonderful experience here.

As a lover of any form of food wrapped in carbs, this place was wonderful. The sandwich fillings themselves aren't too special, but their unique method makes for a great balance of crispy and soft. The story behind the place is pretty cool too.

Friendly employees, fast service, amazing refreshing kale salad, and one of a kind sandwiches.  To top it all off, it's local.  Cannot wait to try all their sandwiches. I met the owner as well who was just amazing.  I highly recommend this place!

Seriously don't even remember the name of the sandwich but I am much better with numbers, it was a number 44 and fell from heaven into Zooks.  These sandwiches are tasty!  We stopped in on the way to the National Championship (Clemson v. Alabama).  Stacey waited on us and was super sweet.  After our meal, she surprised us with some sort of Nutella marries peanut butter concoction.  What!  Delicious.  The owner Carol also stopped by and shared some of the story of how she started, super sweet woman.  This business will turn into a franchise down the road, just wait.  Until then, I'll stop by when I am in Phoenix.

Decent sandwhiches. Ordered the number 22 with no cheese. They didn't put the sauce on it, that should have been. It a was a tad dry. The coffee was good, however it was almost as expensive as the sandwhich. 3 stars  To make it even worse, the owner came up trying to beg us to correct the issue. As we were walking out, the cooks and cashier starred us down. Wont be coming back here. As a professional yelper, zookz has failed.

All my family love this place. Usually we eat at home. But when I'm not in mood to cook, first place that coming to our mind is Zookz. Great people, great atmosphere, unique delicious sandwiches. I highly recommend this place. My favorites- for breakfast #66 and for lunch #60 (But others good too).
Great place to eat! Salads are on point!!!! However based on the portions I would not suggest going if your Starving. I gooooo Zookz for their Salads!!!!!!!

I recently came across this new place a few months ago. My dad was in town and we wanted to grab brunch. As I yelped up something to eat, we figured to give this place a try. My dad was in love with the sandwiches and even last weekend he brought up how good the breakfast sandwich was at "that one place that starts with a Z". I got the No. 33; poached eggs, feta and parmesan cheese, fresh spinach, tomatoes, and fresh basil mmmmm Can't go wrong with some fresh basil. My dad got the No. 44 and apparently it was to die for, obviously since he's still talking about it. We met the owner who was super nice and down to earth. Explained that they were in a different neighborhood and recently moved to this new location. It's in the "new and up and coming" neighborhood of the uptown plaza; Located next to Chipotle and Flower Child off of Camelback.   The atmosphere is small, quiet. I love that all the windows open so it's like you're sitting outside. I think they even have mimosas now which is new. I've never had their lunch sandwiches, but i'll definitely give them a try.

Interesting menu but great food and love the eco friendly type atmosphere. When I read breakfast sandwich I was intrigued but the way they make it is amazing. My eggs were poached I believe and everything else in the pocket sandwich was great! When I'm in this area would love to stop by this place.

My friend told me about this place so I had to check it out.  Everything about this sandwich place was five stars. Friendly staff, cleanest environment (saw one of the staff constantly cleaning everywhere), cute decor, wonderful owner, and the most delicious sandwich I have had. This place will be my must go restaurant when I visit Phoenix. My friends from Tokyo (gourmet eaters) also gave their big thumbs up and said Zookz would be a hit in Tokyo if they ever come to Japan.

I wish I could give 4.5 stars. It's just shy of 5 stars due to infrequent issues that have happened. Overall - this is a great little sandwich place. The owner (Carole) is friendly, down to earth, cares about her customers.    She has come up with a unique type of sandwich you just have to try. It has interesting toasty bread and different fillings that one would not expect.  You don't just get a boring old turkey sandwich here.  My favorites are 1) the Zinger.  A breakfast sandwich with fluffy eggs, cheese, bacon bits, green onions and a zesty sauce. 2) I think it is #55 - a dessert sandwich with Nutella, bananas, peanut butter, and nuts. I also love their turkey sandwich but can't remember the number. I just know it has green apple on it and a tasty mustard sauce.  The other big pro for this place is these sandwiches aren't pricey.  They are very reasonably priced and most come with a side (either a salad or chips). The sides are also very tasty and unique. Even the potato salad side is twice as good (and different) than other potato salads.  Right now this store sits on Central south of Camelback but will be moving to just north of  Camelback soon. That is good - since parking at the current store is very tight. The new location will alleviate the parking issue.  If you are in the area, do yourself a favor and try this place. I found it from other Yelp reviews and I'm glad I did. I live in the north part of town, but make a point to get here at least once on the weekends. It's worth the trip!
Wow...this place is delicious!  I tried the No. 10 with turkey, apples, parmesan and sweet mustard with a side of oranges and kale salad - amazing!  It was fresh, flavorful and healthy...a real hit!

What a fabulous late lunch we had today at Zooks  ! They have a location now with plenty of parking , it lived up to  every review I've ever read.  We had # 10. It has the best combination of flavors . The staff and owner are our new best friends.  See you tomorrow. It was that good.

My hubby and two young kids happened upon Zookz on a Saturday (which they are now open on) & loved it! Hubby had a roast beef something with the kale salad, I had something with cheese & eggs, both kids had the bananas Nutella and PB sooo yummy. The kale salad is more fine and like a "slaw" than a regular salad. I really want to go back & taste something else on the menu. The major plus for this place is the family owned feel. The owner talked to us a little, and was eager to answer our questions about ingredients, how the sandwich was made, etc. For me - good Customer Service is never forgotten!

Found this place by accident, best gluten free breakfast sandwich in awhile. Sort of like hot pockets. I told them it was our first time here. They brought us a complimentary Kale salad, seriously good tasting. I usually don't like Kale. They had a special breakfast sandwich and Mimosa for $10. Such a deal! We sat outside, beautiful day, the owner stopped over and introduced herself. Trendy little place for a quick breakfast or lunch. Has a happy, open vibe! Loved it!

Zookz makes some tasty sandwiches!  The sandwiches are in a tasty bread shell.  I had the no. 20 and the flavor combinations are excellent, and the ingredients tasted fresh.  I also had the black bean/corn salad as a side and it was very tasty and refreshing.  The service was also very good, and the sandwich came out quickly after I ordered.  I would definitely recommend it!

Today was my first time back at Zookz since they moved locations. It is beautiful! Zookz never disappoints and I seriously cannot express how much I love this place. Great food and the customer service you receive is unbeatable. This is a truly all around amazing place!

It was about damn time when I finally went out and tried this sammich shop. Zookz takes a delicious new look at the classic panini, and I couldn't be happier to report that they're friggin' tasty!   I had a No 25 filled with ham, fresh tomatoes and avocados, seasoned black beans, shredded cheddar cheese, and housemade chipotle sauce. Already the sammich sounded delicious, but I was given the advice, which I kindly accepted, to add bacon. Everything is apparently better with bacon, and this sandwich was no exception to that rule. With my sandwich I had a side of Zookz's potato salad that was also tasty, and definitely fresh!  Friendly staff mixed with delicious and inventive cooking make Zookz a hit in my book, especially for lunch. The only negative I could possibly have is the serving size. If you're a hungry person, they're sandwiches may need to settle a bit before they'll fill you up. That said, don't let that stop you from dropping in! I personally can't wait to go for breakfast!
Came here for lunch today and I was pretty impressed! I think it's a little bit pricey, but at least everything is freshly made and is very yummy! I got a #25.

I came here mid afternoon for lunch on Sunday. It's in a plaza with a few other very popular spots in an area with quite a few good dining options so it can be easily overlooked. If you have a hard time looking for it just turn into the big plaza on central and camelback.   The interior is set up for a small-mediumish occupancy. You order food at the counter and they bring it to you. The open windows and large glass panel door is a really nice touch as it lets the sun in and brigthens up the dark wood/industrial interior.   I ordered the #33 adding avocado and chicken. Be aware that the sandwiches are quite small, one would probably easily in the palm of an adult's hand. But they are packed to the brim with their fresh ingredients and are quite filling.   The one thing I was really looking forward to was their poached eggs they put in the sandwich and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. It was a soft deliciously poached egg smack inside of a toasted sandwich. I'm not sure how they actually put the poached egg in there to be honest. I wish the yolk inside would've been runny but I can imagine it'd make the sandwiches a lot messier.  Although the ingredients inside the sandwich were terrific I really disliked the bread they used. I'm not sure what it was but it felt like toasted plain white wonderbread brushed with olive oil. It tasted flimsy with little substance and I found myself wanting to skip the bread and just eat the insides. I wish they used bread that was a bit better and more substantial but overall this is a great spot to get a quick bite to eat.

I must be missing something  here.. I stopped in yesterday  and ordered the #35.. Very little ingredients  for the stiff price of $9 with tax.. I found it average at best and won't  be rushing back.. (Woman at the counter  wasn't  very friendly  either)

New place and I must say... WOW  New start up businesses take notes, this is how you get happy customers. Staff is friendly and understands the products. Neat atmosphere, Great food with a Unique touch and very fair prices.   Has a very new age urban feel, yet still professional.

This place is amazing. The second time I came here the owner told me her story and talked with my friend and me for a while. She also had us try a side that she was working on at the time. It was great to witness such genuine passion. The food: absolutely delicious. Their breakfast and lunch options are incredible. I've tried almost all of them, and have yet to be disappointed. In addition to this, it is always extremely clean. The employees are all pleasant. The prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of food you get.
One of my favorite Places... The prices are now Fair and the Food is always on point,, The  Owner is Just So friendly..

This doesn't even fall into the category of sandwich because it is so much more amazing than just a sandwich!   Nom nom nom!  If you like anything between bread you have to try it. That's all there is to this place. A must stop. Cute story, cute decor, kind staff and amazing food!

Fantastic and fun sandwich shop on Central! The sandwiches are all interesting and delicious and pressed with perfectly crispy edges!   I had the #25, Chipotle sauce with avocado, black beans, ham, cheese, and some sort of Pico salsa. It wasn't spicy, but it was delicious. My husband and daughter both loved their sandwiches as well.   Aside from great food, the costumer service here is beyond exceptional. I'm hard pressed to think of any place I've been that's more accommodating, helpful, and sincerely good with kids. I love this place and we'll definitely be back!
This place is amazing. I have tried almost every Breakfast sandwich on their menu. It's all a homerun. So inventive and original. Quality product and great price.

Boy, are you in for a taste sensation! ! I ordered #25, ham and cheddar, etc and hubby got #35 roast beef. Wow oh WOW! ! Both are excellent,  can't decide which is favorite,  both are just pain yummy! ! And that potato salad is to die for,  a long with the kale,  which I could eat every day!! The place is just south of Camelback, on the west side of Central Ave. Very cute and clean interior,  with outside eating also. Staff is very friendly,  and eager to explain "Zooks". Carol, the owner is delightful, warm and friendly.  They also cater, which is good news, because you just want to share these sandwiches and salads with family and friends! !     They serve breakfast and lunch sandwiches,  all is available during store hours.
Awesome.  It's different, it's (can be) healthy, it's clean, it's delicious, it's, quick, and it's a great price.  Good spot for sure.

Had lunch there today and the sandwich #10 and kale salad were amazing. Next time we'll try one of the breakfast sandwiches. Owner is a sweetheart and the place has a great vibe. Highly recommended!!!  Teas are also amazing.

New fave little cafe! This place is so cute, very bright, and the ambience emanates! Staff was very friendly, I had difficulty finding it, called, and they were incredibly helpful. They gave me order suggestions, but I had an idea of what I wanted. I got a passion fruit mimosa that they fresh squeeze the juices, and was DELICIOUS! I also got a turkey, cranberry, pineapple, carrot, almond and curry sandwich, served almost on a panini type sandwich. DELISH! Will absolutely be back and can't wait to try the whole menu! They also have delicious looking breakfast items, and a plethora of coffee options.
Popped in on a Sat morning.  Cute place,  delicious food.  We had the number 44. Very tasty.

Zookz is awesome and the owners are so nice! My daughter cant eat eggs, so they accomodate her No. 44 request No Egg - Extra ham every time. They are wonderful and the ZOOKZ are so tasty and  priced affordably. We try to get to Zookz at least every few weeks. If you have not tried this place, you will not be dissapointed. Try it!
Wow yes!!! I will absolutely come here again!!!! The owner greeted us and told us favorites we picked the No 20 sandwich! It's sooooooooo beyond good!!!!!!! Thank you for an amazing lunch!!!!!

Wow the food here is on point, I love the space ship looking toasted sandwich. Not to crispy and not to soft, perfect blend. Fast, simple and very enjoyable. M To bad I didn't check in on Yelp to get 10% off. I want to come back again. 5 Stars all the way!
So good! The sandwiches are delicious! The portion size is normal sized for a an average person. I got full off of a lunch sandwich and side of potato salad. Definitely will be back again.

Real pleasure stopping in for an awesome breakfast sandwich this mornng, meeting Carol and learning about her awesome shop.  She said she's poured her heart and soul into the shop the last three years and it shows.  So happy she's moving a few blocks north to the restored Uptown Plaza.  Sounds like a great indoor/outdoor seating area right on Camelback is coming.  Save me a spot please!

My coworker and I were looking for a place to go to lunch the other day. She said that I had not steered her wrong yet on picking restaurants based on yelp reviews. Zookz Sandwiches helped me continue with my success. Their sandwiches are unique and delicious. I would describe them almost like a fresh hot pocket, but way better than a hot pocket.The owner is super nice and let my friend and I try the kale salad, cause she said it was a must. She was absolutely right! the kale salad was amazing and I will definitely be ordering it my next visit. We both thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and experience. My coworker even went back the next day with another coworker.  :)

What a great find!! The food was exceptional and we loved the vibe of this place. The owner Carol welcomed us and walked us through he menu- feels like a family here! I'm visiting from San Francisco - please open one there!
Even though we had were already kind of full, we had to hit up Zookz. Love all the food, great service, awesome place!! Thank you Carol, Bevy Jo, and the rest of the crew!!

We went to Zook's from a friends reccomendation.  We walked in and it was the cutest clean and fun all mixed together.  The staff at the counter were smiling and happy.  Later found out one of them was the owner.  She was great and personable.  I tried the ham, brie and apricot preserves sandwich.  when it arrived, I was surprised by the cute pocket sandwich.   Hot and fresh.  The kale salad side dish was great too.  ( I am not a kale fan).   Definitely a place I will return to and try one of the morning poached egg sandwiches.  They looked delicious.  Hours are 7 am - 3pm.  Stop by for a great healthy breaskast to start your day.
I really enjoy coming here for a breakfast sandwich and on Sunday they have mimosas. The people are friendly atmosphere casual. I am a fan and will definitely continue to return.

WHOA - I did not expect that much deliciousness from a simple breakfast sandwich! the staff was patient & kind despite the place being packed for lunch. I couldn't decide between two, but the sweet cashier gave a recommendation that I was THRILLED with! The #66 has to be one of the best brekky sandwiches ever! skip the boring bagel, and try this unique little sandwich pocket!!!

Such a cute place with large windows so you have lots of natural lighting. Portions are a filling size and it comes with a side salad!! I'm a health freak so I'm super into super foods and they had a mandarin kale salad that was delish! Employees were very sweet. I'd say y'all should go in and give it a try:)

Ordered a number 11 breakfast sandwich via Uber eats with an espresso coffee. I was super hungry and in a rush to get to work, and needed a quick fix for breakfast. I decided to give them a try because of the reviews.   Not sure if I chose an underwhelming sandwich or if it declined in quality from the ride over...but I probably won't order that sandwich again. Hate to say it, but I would have preferred a breakfast sandwich from the mermaid queen of coffee aka SB. Might be awhile before I try this place again...To each their own. On the plus side the coffee was good and delivery was prompt.

Omg zooks is so delicious....the staff Stacy, Goergee were both awesome and delivered great customer service...I highly recommend this place my daughter , my grand daughter and myself...  Order#60 & #20 both were fantasic ...the sides are awesome too!!!

A girlfriend of mine recommended this place so I decided to stop in and check it out for lunch.  The staff was very friendly the second I walked in the door and I was greeted by a number of their staff.  I had never been before so the employees were helpful and made recommendations based on their personal favorite sandwiches as well as popular orders from other customers.  I selected the #20 without tomatoes and the citrus kale salad as my side.  Both were excellent!  Overall it was a great experience, great food, pleasant staff, very reasonably priced and awesome outdoor patio.  I will definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I passed this place driving by and thought the storefront looked fun so we thought we'd give it a try.   Zookz is kind of an order-up sandwich place. Order at the counter, sit down and they serve you. Nice and casual.   One thing I really liked about this place is that the person at the counter was very helpful and was ready with suggestions for those of us newbies. The sandwiches here are interesting in that they are sealed/seared into circles so all the goodies are on the inside not leaking out the back end. The other great thing is that they are really open to substitutions and customization so that you can have the exact sandwich you want. I don't even think they charged me for adding an ingredient. We each got the #20, which is the bacon turkey avocado. He got his per the menu and I swapped the mustard for the chipotle sauce and added roasted red peppers.   On first impression I will be honest I thought I would still be hungry when I was finished, but watch out the size is deceiving! Halfway through I had started to get full, so portion size was actually perfect.  Oh, and try the kale salad. I was skeptical about this as well because I don't normally like kale but this was really good. Julienned with mandarin oranges and almonds. Really tasty.   All in all, a very yummy lunch for about $17 for two. I'd love to go back next time I'm close to downtown.

I wanted to give Zooks 5 stars but it falls a tiny bit short. The flavors are amazing and unique. There's definitely nothing like this anywhere! The Kale salad and it's house-made dressing are phenomenal!! :) BUT! Two-bites and it's gone. The portions are way too small. Not a good idea when your boyfriend refuses to go because he needs at least 3 sandwiches to feel satisfied. If you do the math, that's about $18-20, with no drink. Hopefully Zooks will add a "Big Boy" size one day soon.

I enjoyed Zookz sandwiches quite a bit.  Their breakfast sandwiches in particular, as I'd pick one up before work.  No more.  I learned a dirty little secret.  Their bread is delivered and stored outside their back door on the ground.  Yep.  On the ground.  They keep it outside for several hours while they are open and could possibly move it indoors.  Aside from the obvious, they're located in the same complex as a large condo building, one that's dog-friendly, and has lots of pets.  So, the next time you have a Zookz sandwich, check to see if there is perhaps a little extra flavor to the bread.  Shame on you Zookz.  Change your ways.
The sandwiches are good, but the crust is a little tough.  We had the carrot cake and it was out of this world fabulous!

Wonderful!  Fresh, fun sandwiches and more.  Tasty and unexpected combinations make the sandwiches delightfully unique.  Great new location in Uptown Plaza is a hit with lots of seating.  Service is great too.  I have been many times and never a bad experience.
One of my absolute favorite places here in Phoenix! I love love love this place. My favorite is the #25 with Turkey replacing the ham. I recommend this to all of you!
You've gotta try it! A great variety of delicious combinations, toasted into sandwich pockets. Worth going out of your way for.
Great little sandwich!!! Make sure to read the whole story on the wall about how zookz came to be! Just with that makes you want to order mother one for grandma!

I can't recommend this sandwich joint high enough!   It makes paninis look old hat.  We tried the turkey and cranberry and the ham and Brie with apricot chutney.   Yumm!  The kale salad and pasta salad are fresh and delish.   The prices are very reasonable for such high quality ingredients.   To top it off, they are canine friendly in their patio and offer dog treats!

The sandwiches are very flavorful and a decent size (not too big) for lunch. Also comes with salad. I enjoyed the #35 Roast Beef & cheddar with tomato, bacon, & horseradish. Quite tasty! And the kale salad is light an refreshing with mandarin oranges.  Very healthy option when you're looking for fast-food alternative.
Quality good but portion small. Easy place for informal business meet. Staff super pleasant and helpful but may need 2 sandwiches next time to fill this belly!

Both the sandwiches I shared were delicious.  They use uncommon ingredients that really give this quick sandwich place such upscale flavor. I love how crispy and warm the sandwiches are.  The sides were awesome especially the kale salad.

Omg let me just say best sandwich ever ! Not only is there sandwiches the bomb .com but the customer service is outstanding  the decor is amazing gives you a beach vibe very vibrant and they play good music !! Get the number 20 with the potato salad and must get a cookie lol very good will be back and I will recommend
This place is delicious, a cool concept, and has awesome customer service. I love their breakfast sandwiches! GET THE KALE SALAD.

One of the best "sandwich" shops in all of Phoenix. Its circular design is very unique and traps in all of the goodness inside. They have a wide range of breakfast and lunch zupas to choose from, and their side salads such as the Kale are super good. The owner is super friendly . She truly enjoys what she does, and is often times behind the counter serving her guests. If you haven't tried it out, you should. BTW they also do catering!

Cool concept in a very cute environment.  Cute trendy place serving grilled sandwiches in an uncrustable type fashion. Yummy sides to go along with your sandwich.  Great choice of iced teas  Will be back.
Delicious excellent flavor combinations not over powering friendly helpful caring staff will be back definitely!!!!!

3/4/17 I ordered a #22 - 2 1/2 stars  I ordered a #3 - 4 Stars  FINALLY - a good salad, the vinaigrette was delicious.  I will definitely be back for this salad.  I do have a question about the pricing...it's my fault that I didn't ask for a receipt.  $19.88 seems a bit pricey especially when I had 10% off with my Yelp check in.

we order here several times every week because it's delicious healthy fresh food.  The pricing is fair even when you include Uber delivery and the customer service and the owner is amazing.  I wish everything were as amazing as Zookz

My husband and I took a late morning ride to our fave bookstore and decided to use the gift card for Zookz that someone had given him, for an early lunch. Now is the time to experience this place...while it's still not too hot out. We sat close to the wide open doors and got a nice mist going while we ate our sandwiches.  Try the #20 on the menu, their most popular sandwich.  If you've been stuck out in the burbs of Phoenix, now is the time to support the small establishments that have cropped up in the central corridor area of downtown Phx.  A great place to try out some awesome sandwiches, either breakfast or lunch. They have outdoor seating, but the parking is on the short side, so do this...............get there early on a Sunday morning, bring your fave electronic gadget or NYTimes, and enjoy the kind of weather other parts of the country will only see in 2 months............

In AZ on vacation and wanted to try something new. Was extremely  happy with the food and atmosphere! The portions are a good size,  enough to be full but not over stuff yourself. They have a couple of natural teas with no added sugar which are all really good too. I highly recommend the No.20

Amazing sandwiches!  Perfectly toasty, melty and delicious. We had the breakfast sandwiches,  which were some of the best we've ever had! So good we took 2 "to go". If you've got a sweet tooth try the dessert sandwiches ... they too are something special!

I live in San Franciso and was visiting mom in Phoenix, when two of my mother's friends turned us on to Zookz for sandwiches.    My mother and I have lived all over the world and we really appreciate a good meal and yes, and it takes a little to surprise us -but Zookz did in a very delicious way.     Zookz sandwiches are indeed unique/cutting edge and incredibly flavorful.  We had #30 and #45 - we split them so that we could each try two, additionally, the kale salad was tender and flavorful.  (Despite the amazing nutritional properties of kale, I am only a kale fan if it's tender,  doesn't have a real strong kale flavor and is tasty - this salad met all of those requirements :)) Last but far from least was Zookz chocolate dessert. It was truly an after thought as I really didn't think a "sandwich nook" would have an exceptional dessert in their "to go" refregerated case; however, my mother who has a real sweet tooth insisted on splitting a dessert :)   I am a true chocoholic - very selective - I went in for that first bite with an average expectation and wow!  My mother and I were competing for the finish :)  Carol, the owner, came up and introduced herself while we were trying to decide on what to order.  We peppered her with questions on sandwiches as well as Zookz origination, given we just read the history of Zookz on the wall which begged more questions... We found out that Carol too has had the fortunate history of living abroad along with a real passion for baking and cooking.  Prior to starting Zookz, Carol made and distributed a number of her own receipes, including homemade sauces which she incorporates into her sandwiches.  Carol is a true inspiration starting Zookz after the age of 50.  She is an energetic, very attractive businesswoman who has created a unique and delicious sandwich not just to Phoenix but the United States - I have never had anything like it!  I look forward to returning on my next visit,  tasting several more sandwiches along with another chocolate dessert :)!!!

Fantastic place and the idea is genius! I love the sandwiches, they taste so good, perfectly seasoned and totally out the box idea! I met the owner and I loved hearing about her background and how she came to open the restaurant. I'm looking forward to going back for seconds soon!

Ok small toasted sandwich for $8.50. Kind of like those Crustless PBJs you can buy frozen. Came with a side salad. I picked rice salad, the rice was not cooked, the salad was inedible. Wish I gone somewhere else since there are others restaurants in the shopping center.

One day, after scouring Yelp for a breakfast spot loved by all I stumbled upon Zookz Sandwiches, a central Phoenix, family owned shop specializing in crafting circular sandwiches. After visiting a few times and receiving consistent service I have been a regular, visiting once every two or three weeks, just enough for the small group of employees to remember my name and order. The menu is fairly simple with no more than two dozen sandwich choices for their breakfast and lunch menus, which is served all-day. Identified solely by numbers the ordering is a little unique. When placing an order the number gets written on a small brown bag, similar to a pastry bag, and handed off to the back. Remaining loyal to my 44, partially due to the cheaper price, I've never been disappointed. Frittata eggs, bacon, ham, basil, red peppers, and feta cheese are all toasted to perfection in a special apparatus used to craft the pockets. After placing your order at the till, you are given a number and choose a seat, where an employee will deliver your order to you. Their sandwiches are delivered on long rectangular trays, a little odd, and inside that brown bag from earlier is your sandwich on a round paper plate holding the halves together. As you wait for your meal or eat away, employees coming around to wipe free tables or tend to the floor strike up conversation and make sure you enjoy your visit. Their customer service is genuine, the conversation flows organically and never seems forced. When you walk in you are greeted by a smiling face and a genuine hello, typically from the owner.   The concept of a circular, panini like, sandwich was introduced to the owner by her grandmother while she lived back in Egypt. The modifications her grandmother made to recreate them for her grandchildren became entrenched in the owner's childhood and eventually the motivation to begin this shop here in Phoenix. They offer breakfast and lunch sandwiches, with breakfast sandwiches priced at $5.95 and lunch sandwiches are around $7.95 although they are the same small size. This is the only downfall, the relatively high price of a full meal with sides, as they cost just as much as the lunch sandwich options. It's only due to the excessively large drinks, either a choice herbal tea or soft drink my breakfast choice can get me full. They also offer a few alcoholic drinks like five-dollar mimosas and some local beers, a plus to them, but I've yet to try any to really share an opinion on whether this seemingly low price is a good deal or speaks to the quality of the drinks.   They do tend to get pretty packed in the mornings and lunch time, as they are located in a high-traffic area but there's plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. With small two-person free standing tables, a long cushioned bench along one wall, a larger table along another side, and individual seating neat the door they've got you covered. These wooden tables and the bright yellow and gray themed d√©cor and intimate feel inside fits well into the somewhat posh area. A sweet touch is the large mural of the owner's grandmother that runs along one wall. I assume due to them being in central Phoenix their hours are more catered to accommodate a typical 9-to-5 worker's schedule, making it the perfect breakfast and lunch spot. However, their hours from 7am-4pm, have been another downside for me, as I can hardly find the time to make it in, during their slower times. All-in-all Zookz is definitely worth a try, their friendly service and unique product will leave you wanting more.

LOVE this place...not only for their food but their excellent customer service which seems to stem from the owner herself. Each time I've been here I've been greeted pleasantly by both the owner and staff. My first visit, the staff was in the middle of changing shifts and my food took a little longer than usual. The owner recognized this without me saying anything and brought a free dessert. She even stopped by up make sure I enjoyed everything. My second visit the store was actually closed, but both the staff and owner were more than willing to still take my order. The owner even wiped our table off before I ate because she noticed the recent storm had blown dust on the table just minutes beforehand. It's service like this that really makes this place shine and coupled with the delicious sandwiches will keep me coming back!

Wanted something quick and easy and found this place thanks to Yelp. My husband and I shared #20: thinly sliced turkey, crisp bacon, fresh avocado and tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, Zookz sweet heat mustard sauce. The sandwich comes with a side of your choice (kale salad, potato salad or garbanzo bean salad) and a drink. We picked the garbanzo as a side and pomegranate iced tea. The sandwich came out hot and toasty and the first bite I had was pretty tasty! They bake their bread in a special cylindrical pan so every bite had a lot of flavor and it was so crispy! I love cheesy crispy bread! Reminds of me grilled cheese sandwiches but better! The garbanzo beans was also a good choice! I choose this side because it was different. I've had many kale & potato salads before so thought giving garbanzo salad a try and it was very good. I actually want to try making this at home. The pomegranate ice tea was a refreshing choice and just what we needed since it was so HOT today! While we were eating, the owner also came up to us and asked us how everything was and was really sweet.  We really enjoyed everything we ordered here and definitely want to go back to try some of their other sandwiches especially their breakfast ones!
AWESOME!! If you are in PHX, you need to to go. Stacy was awesome and we loved hearing the amazing history of the sandwich (epic!) from Carol. Thank you

The morning was still. A late night of golf, cigars, and Super Smash Bros has worn out our lowly bachelor-partying crew, and we were desperate to find a breakfast place to energize us on our long trip home to the promised land of Tucson.   But lo! We discovered Zookz. The owner herself greeted us as we wandered inside, took our order and hand-delivered our sandwiches. The sandwiches were absolutely delicious, no additional fluff needed. My only complaint is that there isn't a Zookz in every room of my house.   This young fellow will be heard home with a grin and full stomach. Many thanks to you, Zookz.
