Popped in for a sandwich while in AZ for business. The owner Carol greeted me with the warmest welcome in the desert.  She's truly a sweetheart. The sandwiches are empanada-like and mine was DELICIOUS. I got the #10. Some turkey concoction that would order again and again.    Thanks for the yummmy lunch Carol

Stopped by for breakfast on our way out of town.  The ladies were very friendly and didn't mind some special requests (for my kiddos).  The sandwiches were very tasty and just the right size. Will definitely come again to try their lunch sandwiches/salads.

This place was so cute! I loved the decorations as well as the vibe of the place!  It was pretty modern, yet rustic at the same time! I really enjoyed the uniqueness of it all! But, on to what I'm actually here for, I really liked the food! I got number 35 and my bro got 20. Next time, I'd probably get number 20 because the horseradish sauce on number 35 was a little too strong, and overpowered the rest of the flavor that I otherwise could've enjoyed. I don't count that against them because it was my choice on the sandwich. I tried some of number 20 and my mind was blown! It was so good! My mom also got number 20 with ham instead of turkey. From the circle-sandwiches to the sunflowers, this place was awesome!

Very friendly staff, and a good sandwich, with fun side salads to try. They checked on me during my meal and grabbed a napkin for me without my having to ask. Would recommend to anyone in uptown for lunch.

First time here at Zookz and so excited to be here after reading the reviews on Yelp. Met the owner Carol.. She was so nice and gave us good recommendations. Picked the #66 without the onions and added avocados. Loved it! Choose the Kale Salad as your side, it's the best  If you're in the Phoenix area, make sure to check this place out for breakfast and lunch!
Delicious sandwiches.  Unique, tasty, flavorful...  #20 & 35 are my favorites.  How do they make those sandwiches so crispy and perfect?   If you are downtown, do not pass this place up!  Love it!
Amazing sandwiches! I have had the #11 and the #20. They were fresh and delicious. The kale salad is also delightful! If you haven't tried this restaurant, you have to go!

I know Zookz may not be everyone's favorite sandwich joint, but I think it's all about ordering the right sandwich for you.  I love #20 and my husband always loves #66, and I appreciate that their sandwiches are always warm and toasty without the greasiness of a grilled cheese.  Their teas are delicious and I love not having to wait for them to bring me my side so I can whet my appetite as I wait.  Service is always exceptional, regardless of how busy they may be!

Just came in for breakfast. Checked online for their nutritional information and couldn't find any information so I asked the employees about the nutritional information taking them I didn't see anything on their website. They all seemed lost and asked each other and went to the back then came back out and said there is nothing on our website. I said, " I know I checked the website that's why I am asking if there's any where else I can find any nutritional information". They said, " no sorry I guess not". Ok. Poor customer service as well as not good to not provide any nutritional information for those of us who have to log and keep track of sugar levels for diabetic reasons.

This was our first time here because we're from LA. The owner greeted us and helped us pick our breakfast. We got No 11 and No 66 and substituted for egg whites. Both so good! Definitely recommend. Overall, great experience.

A splendid little uptown spot with arguably the most unique sandwiches in the city -perfect portions and great texture - upbeat and friendly staff completed the experience. I would definitely come here again.

We've loved this place since it first opened.  But about 1.5 years ago my s.o. had to go gluten free, among other dietary changes...so we didn't come as often.  But now they have gluten free bread! And it's amazing! In some ways it's even better than the regular bread.    Zookz has the most wonderful sandwiches & it was a happy day for us when they were able to make a gluten free one :)

Zookz is a fun little stop to grab breakfast. It has seating both inside and out (the outer seating is very limited). Everything is made into these wonderful little sandwiches and it follows the recent trend of counter service with a flair. Although I cant recall the name of the exact breakfast sandwich I had consumed, I can tell you that it was delicious! The restaurant itself is both cute and quaint being tucked into the easternmost portion of Uptown Mall.   Twyla and I opted for the Mimosas which were a little top heavy in O.J. My first comment was that if they were going use a disposable glass for the drink, at least get something that Champagne would be served in. A 5oz squat plastic cup was not the ticket for me and really retracted from the experience of drinking a Mimosa. Additionally, If your operation does not have a dishwasher, there are ways to give your customers a more upscale feel without tapping into your profitability too heavily. I'm sure that they do not pour hundreds of these per day. Is the "Dollar Store" ringing a bell.   Our patio location was very enjoyable and ambiance was great for our breakfast. All of the staff that we had encountered were super nice and very helpful. Don't worry Zookz, We'll be back to see you but I'm going to ask what glass my Mimosa is coming in or I'll bring my own disposable...  #Irishcatv2 #vino2 #Vinosquared #vino2ultimate

Decent roast beef, bacon, cheddar, and horseradish sandwich.  No. 35.  Taste is decent nothing extraordinary.  3-stars.  The roast beef is standard low end roast beef you can get at the grocery store.  Bacon, not even good quality bacon.  The cheddar cheese was on the mediocre level.  All lower end ingredients.  The kale salad is very good.  It has a nice fun taste to it.  4-stars.  They are fun to eat and the place has a nice selection of caffeinated and non-caffeinated teas.  Nice atmosphere and friendly service.

Wait Time: 10 minutes for food.   Unique Factor: 5/5 - Elevated Smuckers! - That might be an understatement. Unique flavor combos served between toasted crustless bread is something so simple, yet satisfying. Great place for a light lunch, or nice breakfast. The eggs in their breakfast sandwich are cooked perfectly. We need one in the Bay Area!  Service: Friendly Staff and Owner. We were offered a dessert sandwich on the house!

What a great unique little find. These sandwiches are not only fun but delicious. The owner came over to personally check on us and was very nice. Make sure you finish with the Nutella, peanut butter, & banana for dessert... DELICIOUS. They lose one star for parking but I hear new locations are on the docket and I look forward to them as well.  Overall the food is worth finding a space. Delicious, quick and fun for all ages.

Unique sandwiches & perfect portion for a light lunch. I had the pomegranate green tea & the kale salad to pair with my sandwich (#20 is the most popular). Kenny was very helpful in suggesting what sandwiches were best to try. I ordered The Zinger (one of their most popular sandwiches posted on the wall) for breakfast tmrw & he made sure it was in a to go bag & not cut in half, that way you could heat it up with no issues for the next day. If you get a lunch sandwich you can combine it with a salad of your choice or a bag of chips. They have iced tea or you can choose a beverage from their fountain drinks. If you choose a breakfast sandwich, it's a la carte, so i suggest a lunch sandwich to experience the whole shebang! You don't want to cut yourself short on a foodie adventure. No one likes a person who half-asses anything. Go all out! Or be bold an order 2 sandwiches! They also have something sweet for those of you who are sweettooths.

Fabulous! New favorite place to eat! Cool atmosphere and excellent food, as well as quick service! I ordered the #22 breakfast sandwich and would definitely order it again. They do breakfast all day, and also have lunch sandwiches available too. My only complaint, is that there's only one location! Crossing my fingers for more locations!

Love this little, unusual sandwich place with the nicest owner, Carol. Fantastic tasting sandwiches that she happily custom orders. Really yummy, I can't wait to try more of those tasty little pouches. I will say though they are a little on the small side; and, their juice/sparkling water could use a lot better selections, but Carol and her genuine friendliness make up for it for this rating.

I love how genuinely happy and helpful the staff are. Of the two times I've been to Zookz, the owner has approached me and asked if everything was up to par and how I heard about them.   I had the Turkey Avocado sandwich (I believe it's No. 20) and it's delicious! I also had the kale salad which was really good :) I'll be back!

So after reading all of the reviews and seeing the delectable pictures of the sandwiches here, I just had to try this place out. I happened to be in the area, so lucky me.  I was impressed by the store front. Very modern, with large open windows and this really cool, big glass door. I can see this place great as a spot to work at.  I got 2  breakfast sandwiches. I don't remember the numbers though. One was their classic one made of poached egg, bacon, basil, and cream cheese. The other was made as a frittata with red peppers, bacon, ham, and Chipotle cream.  They were definitely stuffed and I loved the crispy bread. But with the rave reviews, I was expecting more. I feel like flavor was lacking and I find myself sad after eating it. I make breakfast sandwiches that are so tasty and I wasted my appetite on something less than expected.  While the sandwiches weren't bad, I will just find myself somewhere else for breakfast.

This place was AWESOME! Think of those uncrustable pb & j sandwiches but AMAZING and filled with all sorts of things-like turkey, avocado, etc. all in warm bread! This place is a huge hit and I can't wait to go back.
I wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone. Food is meh. Nothing special. Wouldn't eat here a second time. Save your money. You're just buying gentrified uncrustables.

I travel to this area periodically on business. I always include a stop at Zookz for a sandwich. I have ordered several of the lunch sandwiches and all of them have been very good. Additionally, the staff are very friendly and the service is super fast. Although one sandwich is plenty for me, a larger eater would not be filled up with just one. My teenage son who plays football would need about four of them :-)

I was looking for a place to eat breakfast or lunch and thanks to Yelp I decided to try this place out.   Zookz has a really relaxing atmosphere, owner is very friendly and helpful. I got the #25 which consisted of ham, tomatoes, avocados, black beans, shredded cheddar cheese and chipotle sauce. Portion size was good for the price too ($7 and some change for the sandwich).  All menu items sounded delicious, and the sandwiches come with either chips or kale salad (for all you kale lovers). I'd definitely come back here again and hope to try out the breakfast items next time.  Bonus tip: Check in on foursquare and you'll receive 15% discount. It's a May deal only so I highly suggest you check this place out and get the discount!

Delicious, Fresh, Great Price, Fast Service!  Ordered a #3 mixed green salad online for a quick lunch one afternoon and I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh and delicious it tasted.  I was early picking up my order but they had it ready for me.  Was greeted by both the owner (I think she's the owner) and the cashier - great customer service.  My expectations for a healthy salad at lunch were not very high, but this was absolutely delicious, had chx breast, black beans, sunflower seeds, corn, and this awesome honey balsamic vinaigrette.  Even though it was simple ingredients, the fact that they were fresh and high-quality made all the difference.  Normally I don't get salads this good without paying over $10 OR making them myself.  Highly recommend this place for a delicious lunch and it's super affordable.  The sandwiches look amazing....brie and ham for less than $7??!

Very friendly service! My friend had been dying to try this place. When we came in we were greeted and while looking at the menu, the owner came out and greeted us and struck a conversation with us and helped us with the menu since it was our first time. I believe I got a No. 40. The sandwich was unique and delicious . It was surprisingly filling too. I couldn't even finish it. This place is definitely worth a try as it will not be like any sandwich you have ever had.

I've never been a fan of sandwiches, but when I read about Zookz and saw how unique their style of sandwiches are, I had to stop by during my trip to Phoenix.  They have this cool contraption that makes the sandwiches and they end up a circular shape.  I got the no. 11 sandwich.  It was one of the breakfast sandwiches with 2 poached eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, basil, and cream cheese for $5.75, very delicious.   I love how all the flavors just mesh well together and the touch of basil really gives it a good kick.  The amount of cheese was just right.  The service was great and it is in a big plaza, so parking will not be an issue! Great sandwich place!

Ahhh the memories of camp pies. Sitting around the campfire with a cast iron press, grab two slices of bread and some filling and you're on you're way. Egg, roast beef, spaghetti, berries, apple pie, or what have you. Zookz have capitalized on the idea and have turned it into a thriving business, and their sandwiches are top notch.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  The service is fast and friendly at Zookz, and they're simplified the process so that you'll have a sammie in hand shortly after ordering at the counter. Star Granted.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  The sandwiches at Zookz aren't huge, but they're priced affordably, and my #22 breakfast sandwich with egg, ham, black beans, and chipotle sauce came to only $6.50, which was a great price point. Star Granted.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  As others have stated, the bread is what really makes the difference here. I don't know whether they add some spices to the mix or what, but I could have eaten the bread plain. From there, the fillings in my breakfast sandwich came together nicely into what was a good sandwich, although I'll note that my sandwich was seriously lacking in the ham department. Single Star Granted.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  I've known of camp pies for decades now, but I'm thrilled that someone has made a great business out of it. I'd gladly come here daily. Star Granted.

"Meh, I've experienced better" perfectly describes this place.  In fact, I ditched my plug in grilled cheese maker years ago, maybe they are coming back into fashion, I don't know. Either way, all the sandwiches here are pressed and grilled in a circular fashion.  Not many options for a herbivore either, I think one sandwich, and maybe a sweet nutella version.  Again, totally underwhelming experience.  Won't be coming back....well, ever.  Make the trip a few blocks south to Pane Bianco, you won't regret it.

Just tried this place for the first time for lunch, and it was really good! It's a really cute spot and in a great location, next door to a lot of other fun places like Huss or Flower Child.   They have really good prices, and you get a lot for your money. The sandwiches all come with your choice of three side salads, but the sandwiches themselves are definitely filling enough. I also noticed you can get craft beer for only $3.75!  We each got the No. 44, which is basically a caprese sandwich. It definitely wasn't the best one I've ever had, but it was still really good! I think what I didn't like was that the cheese wasn't melty and the sandwich wasn't that hot, which is more of a personal opinion :) And their bread is amazing!  The staff were all really nice and helpful, and the owner even came out and asked us if we enjoyed our food. It was really nice! I'll definitely be coming back.

I'm hooked on Zookz!  A friend raved about their sandwiches to me on a Saturday, and since they're only open M-F now, I was craving them even before my first bite! And my friend was right about it all... Delicious ingredients- hot, flavorful, fresh, wholesome- in an easy-to-eat pocket sandwich with crispy sealed edge. The serving size was perfect- just the right amount without leaving me hungry or too full. And the price was great- I think I spent around $6 for the #44 (2 egg frittata w bacon, ham, feta, parmesan, roasted red peppers & basil) and a large green iced tea. And I also had to buy the #55 to-go, because how could I walk away without dessert for later... peanut butter, nutella, bananas, and  roasted almonds! A great big YUM! The staff was super friendly and helpful. Carole, the owner, made it a point to say hi and ask how I enjoyed my food. I loved the garage door front that allowed in the beautiful fall morning air and sunshine. And even the bright natural colors and fruit/veggie mural on the wall gave it a feel-good vibe. I will definitely be back to try even more of their sandwich creations... as well as their salads. I hear Carole's homemade dressings are amazing!
Sandwiches taste good but not blown away and they are pretty pricey for what u get. I have to order two to get a meal big enough to fill me up.

I think this place is awesome! The restaurant alone is adorable and the owner who I got the pleasure of meeting is really nice! It had great customer service and it's easy to order a delicious sandwich. I ordered the #20 with the garbanzo salad which was super tasty! My favorite part of this place is not only was there a beautiful portrait of the owners grandmother on the wall but also there was a collage of her story on how she started  Zookz! I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants a warm fast sandwich!
Super friendly staff and amazing sandwiches. Definitely a must try. It was our first time here and it definitely won't be our last. Had the #66 breakfast sandwich. Delicious!

The food was delicious and the service was great! The place is cute! I somehow came across this place on Instagram and couldn't wait to try it. The price for a lunch sandwhich is a bit overpriced however. I understand that it comes with a side but it is still very very pricey. Please re-consider the Lunch Sandwhich prices.

Number 22 is my favorite, I've been going here since it first opened up years ago and I go at least 3-5 times a month. They always have great customer service and delicious sandwiches. Keep it up guys!

Quick easy place with delicious food! Stopped here this afternoon and I had bookmarked it a couple of years ago. Was happy to see a few delicious looking vegetarian options! I got 45 which had mozzarella, spinach, tomatoes, and some kinda delicious sauce on it. The sandwich being pressed that way made it a little easier to eat while driving haha. Plus the crisp bread was fantastic. I got a kale and carrot salad as my side and it was delicious. While I was waiting the owner was walking around and talking to people, she seemed very friendly! Food isn't priced too bad either for such wonderful stuff. I'd be happy to come back here!
5 stars just cause i got a free sandwich for waiting too long. lol i'm a lazy writer but i had a good time so five stars.

Nom nom nom!!!! So I dont remember whats my sandwich was called but it had apple and turkey along with something else.. it was suggested to me by the owner..and it was a good call..ps she was super sweet.. but the bread part was delicious!!! You should def give them a try!

You have to read the story on the wall.  I read the story while I waited for my zook and it made me enjoy my meal so much more.  I dunno, it really touched me, like I still think about the story weeks later.    Zookz are unique and unlike anything I've ever tasted, they're delicious though.  The strip mall is currently under construction so it wasn't easy to find but it was well worth the search!

Food: Sandwiches comes with a salad or bag of chips. I had the Kale salad which was good.  - #10: Thinly sliced turkey, slices of green apples, Parmesan cheese, and sweet mustard sauce. Ohhhh, this was so good! My husband and I went halvsies so we can try both sandwiches and I wanted to steal his half! lol. The sandwich is, indeed, unique. It's kind of like a pan fried crispy-soft pita bread. This was my favorite out of the two. 5/5  - #20: Thinly sliced turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and sweet mustard sauce. This was good as well. It was a little messier to eat because it was stuffed with fillings. It, too, had good flavor. 4.5/5  Service: The cashier was really friendly and talkative. I did mention that I found Zookz through Yelp but the waitress failed to mention that if I checked in I would get 10% off. I have a habit of checking in while I'm waiting for my food, in other words, too late. It would have been nice if she said something. The owner stopped by to ask us how we liked our sandwiches. She was really nice and approachable. 5/5  Final thoughts: My husband doesn't ever compliment food. Everything is okay to him. But he loved Zookz! He said it was one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. If he likes it, it's gotta be good! I can't wait to come back here when I'm in Arizona!

The location was adorable, so cute and fun to sit and people watch.  We ordered a 25,30, 20 and the dessert sandwich with Nutella, PB and Bananas.  My daughter thought the horseradish on the 30 was too strong but she still ate the whole sandwich so that tells you how good it was.  The 20 and 25 were both incredible.  The toasted bread is the perfect texture and thickness and the ratio of filling was perfect.  The kale salad wasn't my favorite.  But we were all big fans of the Tims chips.  The sweet sandwich was kind of mushy and just had a strange texture.  It was hard to swallow with the thick Nutella, PB and mushy bananas.  The lady who took our order was so friendly and informative.  I was super impressed with the service.  The sandwiches arrived promptly to our table.

I absolutely love Zooks! I am surprised it is not all over the valley. The staff are amazing, very friendly and seem like they enjoy what they do. The owner is very down to earth too. I had the kale and potato salads-amazing. I also liked the turkey sandwich I had. The meals are light, does not feel fattening! You must check them out

Stopped in for lunch this past Tuesday for lunch. Food was deeeelish and super fast. Quality ingredients and modern warm atmosphere. I got the #20 -  turkey, bacon avocado tomato and cheese topped with the most awesome mustard sauce, it was scrumptious. Loved everything about this place except for service. For such a cute inviting place one of the woman behind the register left me a bit irked. She was extremely curt with her answers to my questions about the menu. She seemed very frustrated and acted like I was bothering her. Not very welcoming.

Enjoyed lunch today at Zookz Sandwiches. My 10 yr. old daughter hesitated given the sandwiches looked different but she really changed her tune after taking a bite. She had the pork and slaw and loved it. Dad snuck in a nibble as well. The family also enjoyed one of the breakfast sandwiches and the roast beef as well. The establishment was very clean and staff were very friendly. A great place for a quick meal.

Tried this place for lunch today and it was great! I ordered delivery and it came so fast I didn't even have time to wonder where it was. I got Tim's Cascade with Honey BBQ chips and an Oatmeal Coconut Chocolate Chip cookie. The sandwhich was delicious, crunchy on the edges and soft but not soggy in the middle. Great taste and fresh veggies. I will definitely be ordering deliver again! Highly recommend.

I'm absolutely addicted to this place. My boyfriend and I stopped by here on a whim while googling places nearby to eat. The sandwiches are always delicious and you can't beat the customer service. I've tried a variety of the menu and it's all good, I haven't been disappointed yet. It's definitely a place to try if you're into sandwiches, comfort food, and a great environment. Now is the time of year to be in Arizona and it's great to dine in a restaurant with the option of sitting outside. I wish there were a way to give this place more than five stars. Try the Zinger and the #25

Perfect for eat in our car on the way to Sedona lunch. Sandwiches were so yummy. Breakfast sandwich with poached eggs probably wasn't the best for our situation. While good the other two we got were better. We got the 22 with roast beef with horseradish was by far our favorite. The turkey with Parmesan apples and cranberries was also great and a hit with the kids. Would definitely come back.

My wife and I travel across the country nine months per year.  We always look for local favorite breakfast spots on Yelp. This is the most unique experience we have had. The breakfast sandwiches are beyond good.  In fact, we have been there six times over the past two weeks! The restaurant is exceptionally clean and the staff is very friendly. They even remembered our names after the first visit.  The breakfast sandwich is plenty enough for a satisfying meal.  Our favorites are the #22 and the #55 (Nutella, peanut butter, banana, almonds).  Try it once and you will go back. Little wonder it was named "Best Sandwich Spot" in the valley by a local magazine.

The sandwiches are good, no doubt about it. Definitely get the sides, not the chips with your meal. The sides are where it's at. Never tried the kale salad but I've heard it's very good. You can't really go wrong with any of the sandwiches, but my personal favorite is the No. 20. I've been eating here since they were at the old location right on central, and the new location across the intersection is great! I was worried that with the move the place wouldn't be the same and that the expansion would negatively affect the quality and taste of the food, but it's still great! My only gripe with them is the size of their meals, it's just not enough for me. I am 6'5 with a big appetite so I rarely go when I'm really hungry. With that being said my girlfriend thinks the portions are perfect so don't let that stop you from going! Plus the owner is super nice! Enjoy!

This is a MUST, if you're in the mood for something new and delicious. The breakfast combos with mimosas are a great weekend meal, and the #55 desert sandwich will blow you away. Check this place out!
Staff is super nice, and the pocket sandwiches are really good -a bit small tho- I LOVE their kale salad: the best in town!
Freakin' TASTY stuff here, fresh, hot, made-to-order, sweet owner and staff, clean as can be, what's not to like?

Awesome owner, awesome food, great atmosphere, amazing aura, just a very cool place to grab a quick bite to eat or sit and relax in the funky orange chairs.  The "pocket" sandwiches as I like to call it are amazing. I've been here a couple times before and they have these sandwiches dialed in! Brownies/treats are made at home (by the owner) and are very tasty, must try!!  Cheers!

Well they hit it out of the park again. I'm from CA where I own my own Award Winning Sandwich Shop called Noonerz, so when I tell you ZOOKS is one of the Best, Freshest, Coolest, Hottest, Must Do Spots in Phoenix I totally mean it !  And now every single issues Zooks may ever have had are gone as they moved around the corner to Uptown Plaza and everything is a zillion times better.  Check out their extended hours ( don't forget one of the best Breakfast in town) but now they cater ! Zooks is owned by locals and I feel very strongly that we all should shop and eat in our neighborhood, not in some distant chain owned restaurant.  Do yourself a favor, eat there once, you'll be back many times over.
Awesome concept and great taste. Suit to order option and breakfast selections are superb.

Zookz is one of the most creative concepts I've experienced in Phoenix lately. I really love the founder's story of how she began to make these sandwiches and where her inspiration comes from.   If you haven't been to Zookz, let me explain why it's so special.   The founder created a special sandwich press that perfectly toasts a round, crustless sandwich filled with delicious items of your choosing. They have a number of amazing combinations - both sweet and savory, breakfast or lunch options.   I love the menu items with eggs in them, and I LOVE the nutella one, too. Favorites are No. 22,  No. 10, No. 7, and No. 55.   No. 22 2 Poached Eggs, bacon, ham, cheddar cheese, black beans, avocado, zookz Chipotle Sauce  No. 10 Thinly sliced Turkey, crunchy apples, tangy parmesan cheese, cranberries, almonds, zookz Sweet Heat Mustard Sauce  No. 7 (Salad) Kale, shredded carrots, crushed pineapple, coconut, roasted almonds, and zookz voodoo dressing.  No. 55 Peanut butter, nutella, bananas, roasted almonds, and powder sugar  Don't stop at the sandwiches - the side salads are wonderful, too (like No. 7, above)!

Wow! So amazing. Fresh and flavorful sandwiches. Whatever this bread they use, it's out of this world.   My wife had number 11 and I had the number 35. We also got the garbanzo bean salad...now garbanzo beans are not something I would buy on a trip to sprouts....but this was SOOO good.   The owner (manager? Not sure) came by and made sure we enjoyed our food. She asked if we tried the kale salad and, of course we didn't. My wife knows I hate kale and kale fads...lol...well she made is try it, and I finally found kale I enjoy! It was flavorful and sweet. Very fresh.   We will be back as our church is right up the street.

After seeing amazing #foodporn pics of sandwiches from Zookz via direct mail and on local billboards on numerous occasions, I decided to head over one morning to bite into one!  Zookz offers a central location, plenty of parking, a fast-casual atmosphere, friendly service, free wifi, and indoor/outdoor seating.  The menu consists of a variety of moderately priced breakfast and lunch sandwiches and a couple of salads.  I went for a breakfast sandwich (#11).  Sadly, I wasn't overly impressed... I felt my sandwich lacked a ton of flavor despite having eggs, cheese, bacon, tomato, etc... I added sriracha sauce and gobbled it up regardless, but I don't know that I will rush back.  That being said, if sandwiches are your thing, this place is worth checking out.  I hope that you'll be more impressed than I was!
This place is awesome, good food and they were all very friendly. If we are ever in Scottsdale again we will defiantly be back!

I have seen the reviews and i bookmarked this place right away. Walking in we were greeted by none other than the owner. She approached us and knew from our faces this was our first time. She was super friendly and super informative on the concept of the place. She gave us suggestions on what to get. I ordered #35 which was a roast beed sandwich with the potato salad that was included. My mother got #25 which was a turkey sandwich with the garbanzo beans side salad.  Honestly they were both amazing. The pricing is reasonable.  I wish i lived in Arizona to get the chance to try this place again before heading back to California.  Im gonna try to visit this place agin before i leave.  I can truly say we don't have something like this in socal. Love the food and flavor and love the service as well.

No 20 with kale salad $7. Refreshing, yummy and fast. Happy friendly staff. Clean modern atmosphere. I thought it was a pita from the pics but actually actual French bread pressed into a circular panini like press
Yesterday we decided to have some tasty sandwiches.. the only place we go lately is Zooks. They are very good. Every single one we've tried. I highly recommend giving them a try.  5stars for the food

Saw Zookz while driving around. Stop in for a sandwich, had no idea what to expect. Each sandwich comes with a side: chickpea salad, potato salad or kale salad. Got the Kale and the Chickpea, both were pretty good. Would recommend the chickpea. Got the number 10 and 20. $18   My take on it was just a different version of a grilled cheese. The contraption they use is pretty cool. I'm glad they didn't use the basic white bread I remember having when I was young. It's a bit of an upgrade I'd say.  Would I come back? Probably not, when I think of a good sandwich, the bread is my deal breaker. Cool concept if you love grilled cheeses. Just didn't tickle my fancy.

The hubby and I were in the area the other mornin and wanted breakfast.  We love breakfast sandwiches so we came here.  They were very nice and our sandwiches were great.  They did still add sauce to my husbands sandwich when he asked them to hold it, but he liked the sauce luckily.  I had the first sandwich on the menu with bacon, tomatoes, basil and cheese, it was very good.  The hubby had the second, it was southwestern with chipotle sauce.  He liked it.  We will be back for sure, the other sandwiches on the menu sound awesome!!

Great tasting sandwich! First time here and had the No. 20. Only 4, not 5, stars because of the lack of parking and the small size of the sandwiches. However, this is definitely worth it and I'll be recommending this place to friends.

Original concept....sandwich (hot pocket) was decent, potato salad was good, and place was clean and nicely decorated.  But if you're hungry or in the mood for a great sandwich, skip this place and try your neighborhood deli instead
Best #33 in Phoenix Poached egg, feta, Parmesan cheeses  with spinach, tomato  & basil .... Yummy

Extraordinarily mediocre and overpriced. The kale salad was essentially inedible. Tasted as though they had dipped each kale leaf individually in a bowl of sugar.   It's worth mentioning that it's not really a sandwich place it's more of a hot pocket restaurant. If you're really into people who think they can reinvent the wheel this might be the spot for you.

The owner is such a delight! Every time we are in there she stops by to say hi and make sure we are enjoying our food. The sandwiches are unique and delicious! Try the kale salad side and one of their yummy fresh brewed iced teas to complete your meal! Best of luck as they continue to grow into their new shop!

If you are a sandwich lover, you will enjoy this place!  They also have really yummy salads including a kale salad that is to die for!  Fresh spin on the typical sandwich, fresh ingredients, and a great atmosphere!  And the owner is super sweet and nice! What more can you ask for.  Oh yeah, the price is just right too!
Fantastic breakfast sandwich. Had the one with black beans, guacamole and bacon. It was unreal. Very friendly staff there too.

The sandwiches have great flavor and there are a number of different side choices.  The staff is very friendly and there is plenty of seating.  It's also very clean and it's a great location.  There are also both breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  Only tip I have is that if you are very hungry you'll probably lean hungry after as the sandwich size is relatively small.  Great place for a light lunch if you anticipate a larger meal after.

Traveling with a coworker who lives more locally, I am super glad I fessed up to being a snob about eating at chain restaurants.  I turned down Subway and broke out my Yelp app!  Zookz was nearby and had good ratings so we checked it out.  What a different idea.  It reminds me of Uncrustables in the freezer section of the grocery store but with much more adult and better fillings.    I walked in and saw a picture of the #13 which is poached egg, feta, spinach, tomato.  I didn't even look any further..this looked amazing.  And it was!  I wish I could have tried more!  I do think my coworker could have eaten more but they did have some side options available.  The sandwich was less than $5, I believe.  All options appeared $7 and less.  They also have Coke products...I'm a sucker for a fountain diet Coke.  The service was really friendly with someone greeting us immediately, taking our order promptly, and even asking how our meal was and how we heard of Zookz!  My only desire is that they open one in Dallas or Plano, Texas!  (:

A poached egg. That is what was at the center of this lunch, literally and figuratively. I went into Zookz for two reasons. 1. It's near my work and 2. every morning I pass it and it has this huge banner outside that reads "Best Sandwich in Phoenix". I'm not sure which of their sandwich's are the best. Unfortunately their lead sandwich, the #11 is not the best sandwich in Phoenix.   The sandwich is a panni-esk meal with two "poached" eggs, bacon, tomato, cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and basil. When my sandwich arrived it looked like it was cooked in one of those sandwich makers someone gives you as a wedding gift. I opened it up to hoping to find two perfectly poached eggs bursting with yoke over some thick applewood smoked bacon and fresh tomatoes and basil. What I got were two incredibly hard boiled eggs, some bacon shavings, a very tart tomato along and some wilted basil.   The sandwich doesn't work. The problem is you can't poach an egg and then press it in a sandwichmaker and expect it to not come out overcooked.   Zookz gets two stars (Meh. I've experienced better) because the owner was terrific. She came out immediately and tried to explain to me that their egg cooker is set at five minutes (so its not really a poached egg) and that the eggs come that cooked. She said they would try to undercook the egg and hope that it worked with the press.   To their credit the second sandwich, though still over "poached" was better than the first. The owner was very kind and went as far as to reimburse me for my meal because it took about 20 minutes for me to finally eat. It was an underwhelming sandwich, great staff, but wrong concept. Overall it's kind of a hot mess, literally and figuratively.

Looking for a quick breakfast place while waiting to start on a job. Smelt the toasting of the breads and followed the aroma.   Didn't get in the door a half a second and was met by a bubbly counter lady, Stacie,  who was generous with her happiness. It was nice to see a pleasant face first thing in the morning. She educated me on all their  sandwiches and explained which was best for breakfast and what her favorite was. She even got the cooks in the back the smile while they are making my sandwich.  I had the Zinger, which is a breakfast sandwich and I was trying to figure out how to come back for lunch. They have a large door open between the outdoor and indoor area where you can sit outside or inside, I sat in between and enjoyed the train and the outside air while I ate he delicious pocket like sandwich. This place is a little jewel right off of Central Avenue and Camelback and should really be much busier then it was.  I will definitely start recommending this place and bring friends by, maybe even for lunch today.

Quick place to get a pressed-sandwich. Prices are reasonable and they have convenient online ordering so you can order your sandwich ahead of time and have it ready to pick up. The #55 with peanut butter, nutella, banana, and almonds is my favorite - highly recommended! I tried the #77 with chocolate, coconut, and almonds once and wasn't overly impressed - there was way too much coconut and not enough chocolate, made it pretty dry.
The best sandwiches ever. The ambience, the story and the love are personified through every item on the menu. Thank you Carol and Berdjoui!

I can eat this everyday.   The owner Carol is super sweet and you can tell shes following her passion of making people full and happy.  The turkey cranberry is amazing even though it may sound bad. The eggs in the breakfast sandwhich are cooked to perfection.  You actually cant go wrong here.
Stopped by for a snack. Breakfast sandwich was amazing. Flavorful and delicious. Sad I haven't tried this place earlier.  Can't wait to try more menu items in the future.
These are bizarre little sandwiches - and hippy dippy salads - but, they are SO YUMMY! Anytime I'm in Phoenix, I hope there's time to have at least one lunch here. They are just perfection.

Definitely a great new sandwich place! We had the #20 and #32 with side kale salads. They were hot and full of flavor! The kale salad was great as well! Looking forward to trying a different sandwich next time.

Love it!  Place- clean, casual, and modern. Inside outside eating areas. Service-friendly and curtious. You order get your drink and they bring your food to your table.  Food- fresh, non greasy, filling, and delish! I've had the no. 20 &22. Yum!

My coworkers and I came in here for lunch today. We got in at about noon... It was busy but not overly crowded for it being prime lunch hour.  I ordered the Number 45 (caprese sandwich) and they both had the turkey, bacon, avocado. All sandwiches come with a side of either potato salad, chickpea salad, kale salad or chips. I also ordered a large iced tea. They have an awesome selection of freshly brewed tea. I did think it was unusual that iced tea was about a dollar more expensive than the fountain drinks (in the same size.) Not a fan of that.. but it is unlimited refills on all drinks so I will let it slide. All in all my sandwich, side, and iced tea rang up to about $13.  The sandwiches are the perfect size for lunch. The panini press makes them into cute little pockets that don't leave you feeling too full. Overall I enjoyed my sandwich, but it was just your typical caprese panini. Nothing to make it out of the ordinary. I didn't really enjoy their take on potato salad. It is more like mashed potatoes with black beans and corn. It was pretty bland even with the chipotle and my coworkers and I had to season with salt and pepper. I think I would go with the kale salad or chips next time! We enjoyed our lunch! I am not sure Zookz will be at the top of my list, but it was still a nice lunch spot.

First off, I'm a huge sandwich fan so this is right up my alley. I had just landed in Phoenix and wanted something quick. Dutch bros coffee recommended i go here as I grabbed a coffee and it's down the road. So good! I got mine to go but staff was very nice when I was there and it was clean. She knew I was taking mine on the road and cut my sandwich up more for me, #20. It was delicious! Bread toasted crisp, fresh veggies, just enough sauce. The garbanzo salad was also good and everything was very reasonably priced.

The store is trendy looking. It has outside seating and walls that open up to let the air in. In March, it was quite comfortable. I'm not sure how that works in July.  When I grew up, we had a sandwich press which was fun to use. Put in a slice of bread, meat, cheese, and another slice of bread. Put the top down and cook for a couple minutes. Well this place has made a business with these machines.  The edges are a little hard, but that's a result of the sandwich press. The insides are hot and melty.  This is a great place for a sandwich!
Hands down the most delicious and unique sandwiches I've ever eaten. 20, 25 and 35 are my favorites so far. Clean, friendly and fast.

Wow ... Stopped by for a late lunch and to my surprise, I was extremely impressed.  They take pride in their work and each sandwich is meticulously put together !!  With an explosion of flavors and awesome presentation, I'd say this was the best sandwich I've had in a Long time !!  Well done !!
Great concept, Great potato salad.  The only drag is the lack of available parking.

I was excited to finally try Zooks. It was everything I had hoped for and more. Great service, food and environment. They even gave me a free kale salad to try since it was my first time in. I would highly recommend.

This place is great! They have fun and creative sandwiches in a way that I've never had. I've tried a breakfast sandwich and a lunch sandwich and both are delicious. With the breakfast sandwich, it's nice that they ask if you'd like poached eggs or scrambled, and the poached eggs are great. The lunch sandwich I got was a turkey bacon avocado and was out of this world. The side salads are also something different, and so far I've liked the kale over the others. Also, try the teas that they have, they are fantastic. Great place for lunch and super friendly staff!
One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! Delicious sandwiches, great ambience, and super friendly people, what's there not to like? My personal favorite is the #20 and the kale salad.

What a great idea!  Making a sandwich like this took me back to my childhood.  Went with my daughter who is vegan and Carole the owner went out of her way to make sure she was taken care of.  Strongly recommend.  Quick friendly service.  Sandwiches were so flavorful. We will be back
I loved the bread, especially.  The side of potato salad was tasty, too.  I made a special trip here, and I enjoyed it.  I'd go again!

First time here last weekend and I really enjoyed it. The cashier guy was super friendly and helped us pick a sandwich based on what we like. The owner stepped out, greeted us, and checked in on us as we were enjoying our food. I really liked the fact that the seatings extended indoor to outdoor, really opened up the restaurant and made it a very welcoming atmosphere. I also like the fact that they have a small sink near the soda dispenser so you can conveniently wash your hands without going all the way to the bathroom.   On to the food: I got 2 egg frittata sandwich. It was very good. Delicious flaky bread, yummy fresh ingredients. Apparently they get their bread specially made by wildflower bread company.   I am totally coming back! And you should definitely try it out.   --keep eatin'

So I need to get better about writing reviews because I only do them for the very best or very worst. Zookz is one of the very best. Such a cool and yummy concept! It's like uncrustables filled with the best stuff, and the back story is really cool (you can read it on the wall if you're so inclined) I'm not going to say I had a mimosa at 8 am on a Tuesday, but if I did, I would bet the passionfruit one was soooooo good. I don't eat meat, and the owner was super accommodating and made great suggestions. We did breakfast, mine was egg and cheese and avocado and a crazy good sauce, my friend got the frittata one because he doesn't like runny middle eggs but after, the owner told us we can get any Sammie  with harder cooked eggs. He loved his too. This is my new regular breakfast stop for sure

My friend and I were in the mood for a sandwich for lunch so we decided to look up what was nearby when we found Zookz and decided to give it a try since the reviews were so positive.  The staff was friendly and the interior was clean bright and breezy from the open doors letting in the fresh air and light. It felt almost like being on a patio instead of indoors. He ordered the #25 and I ordered the #35. Both were delicious, if somewhat smaller than expected. For a light lunch the size is perfect,  especially if you have the kale salad alongside it. I actually liked the kale salad so much I decided to ask if I could get a larger order to go to have as a healthy snack while at work.  The owner came by our table to personally ask how we enjoyed our food. I told her how much I enjoyed the salad and asked her if they sold a larger portion to go. She informed me they didn't, but would happily pack one for me. That's what I call great service! I found her very friendly and accommodating. I was pleasantly surprised...There aren't that many owners who take the time or care to go around personally asking customers how their experience was...that's a great way to keep people coming back.  Overall my friend and I enjoyed Zookz and will be back.   By the way: If you check in on foursquare you can get 15% off your meal...also on yelp if you check in, they give you 10% off.
Full five stars. Every visit is consist. It exceeds our expectations time and time over again.

I'm digging the new location because the original location had limited parking. I woke up one morning and was starving so I had my hubby stop at zookz for breakfast. We split #11- poached eggs, bacon, cream cheese, tomato and basil and a sweet one #55: peanut butter, Nutella, almonds, and bananas. #11 was good for the savory part of my meal, but #55 was freaken awesome for the sweet part!!  I definitely recommend trying one of the sweet ones because for as long as I've known zookz (a few years now), I've never had the sweet sandwich till recently and I feel like I've been missing out!!

Been in Arizona 5 days and this is the first enjoyable meal we have had.   Basically a gourmet uncrustable. Delicious, fresh and worth a visit.   Staff was friendly and helpful. Trendy atmosphere and very clean.  The dessert was amazing too. We will certainly return.

Just had lunch at Zookz and I must say that I'm impressed, this is the type of place that you want to try everything on the menu.  The service was excellent and I recommend checking this place out.  A great spin on the traditional sandwich a+

Not your average sandwich! I have been coming to this place since before they moved to Central and Camelback and I love it so so much! Sandwiches are these warm, toasty, flavorful rounds of goodness! They have the best potato salad in the world, the chickpea salad is to die for and I have yet to try a sandwich I don't love. The owner is also super sweet she comes around the tables to make sure everyone is doing okay.   Zooks is a must try!

Stopped by on a whim and so glad we did! Friendly and attentive staff. Reasonably priced items on menu. I ordered a cheddar cheese and sliced ham sandwich that came with a choice of sides. I chose potato salad and it was delish! The sandwich was super delish! I indulged in their Strawberry iced tea. Amazing flavor! I will highly recommend this gem of an eatery to my friends and family!

I was looking forward to coming here but I have to say I was disappointed. The portions are way way too small. It's also fairly overpriced for what you get. These sandwiches are maybe as big as a Cd/dvd disc....but probably smaller. We got two sandwiches and 1 water =$21. For me it just felt like a light appetizer, I was still hungry afterwards. It just felt like a waste of money. I like the location and the decor but I don't think I will come back for food that's for sure.

Um...I might have an addiction! Every thing I have ever ordered there has been great! The owner is very cool and checks to make sure everything is perfect! She even brings us samples of new things to try and asks for our feedback! Love that! Can I just say...the #55 with peanut butter, Nutella, bananas and almonds...I die!

I had no idea what to expect when I came into ZOOKS and I have to say I was totally impressed!it was really laid back and  such a comfortable place to eat! Plus you get the food quickly and it's so good! My boyfriend isn't much of a breakfast person and he loved it as much as I did! The service was great and the atmosphere was awesome I can't wait to come back!

In from out of town, had no idea where to go. Found it on Yelp, but always skeptical with the ratings. This is one of the best places I have ever eaten. I will be sure to come here next time I'm in town. I had the #10 with a garbanzo bean salad and carrot cake for dessert.

A MUST stop. Incredibly lovely shop with the most delightful owner and staff. They had me at their story, but the food was creative and delicious. They don't skimp on quality, or quantity. I loved their large assortment of non-carbonated beverages and the cup size was extremely generous. Attention to the detail in the decor. Overall 5 star experience.  And did I mention the owner is enchanting. This is a must support place.

Seen this place on a billboard ad and saw some friends try this place out so a friend and I decided to check it out and we were impressed! The atmosphere was relaxing and the staff was extra friendly. We tried the number 22 and number 11 breakfast sandwiches and they were both great! We will definitely be coming more often!

This place is heaven on earth. Every sandwich I get changes my life. I love this place for lunch. The owner Carole is a doll and everyone who works there is so NICE. Nothing beats this place. I'd come here over a chain any day. I have not tried breakfast yet, but am looking forward to when I do. My favorite so far is the #25! AMAZING! You have to try it out.. But I warn you that it will be your new addiction!

Really good and unique sandwiches. They use a press that I've only seen sold in India to make their sandwiches.  Wash sandwich comes wit a side. The side kale salad was very good too.   Everyone who works here is very friendly. I will be back!

I was on my way to another restaurant, saw the picture of #66 sandwich on the, well, sandwich board, and had to have it. Yes, boiled eggs are usually an indication of dry things to come, but it seemed worth the risk. The balance of sauce and other ingredients produce an independent item with near perfect new flavors.    About the only thing better than the food is the service. The staff is friendly, patient, and helpful - in a natural unforced manner.   On a side note: food, especially sandwiches and/or eggs, are generally either not photogenic (see: any place with pictures on the menu) or look over produced (Barbara Walters lens filter with a side of vibrant greens for a youthful effect). Zookz somehow cracked the code - the pictures are great.  Great job!
Unique sandwich place with good food and great vibe. Friendly atmosphere and great location, right off the metro.

First time to Zookz today and i had a great sandwich at a decent price! The cashier immediately noticed I looked a little perplexed and asked me if I had ever been there before. I told her I had not and she quickly and cheerfully explained the menu to me. My sandwich came with a salad or chips. My food was brought to my table more quickly than I anticipated. The sandwich was great and the atmosphere was trendy but comfortable. I'm impressed! I'll absolutely be back for more unique, delicious sandwiches!

Tried it, lunch sandwich was tasty however small.  Potato salad has beans and corn in it way too much going on.  Would have been helpful to tell me the tea was unsweetened and the cookie wasn't a real one it was oatmeal or something.  Oh well im sure plenty of people enjoy this kinda stuff.  Not my cup of tea.

Recommended by a woman I met, we went the same day for lunch. It was pricey but the sandwiches are freshly made and there isn't anything like it. I did #35 roast beef and enjoyed it immensely. The potato salad on the side was different but good as well. This is not your average sandwich place, and definitely worth a try.

First time going to Zookz and it was a great first time experience. Their menu is different and so unique, and since it was my very first time going the cashier was so nice and patient giving us time to take a good look at the menu. I got a Sandwich #42 and a potato salad. It was delicious! & to top it off, the owner Carole went to our table and greet us, and gave us a little chat about the background of how it all started. Definitely had a great experience going, and I surely go back again.

While over on Central decided to check out this sandwich shop, it has been on my radar. I chose the roast beef with the horseradish sauce. It was absolutely delicious. Kale salad was fresh with a nice mix of ingredients. Coffee was great too. Will be back to try something else. Oh and the ladies behind the counter were great too.

Great place great sandwiches. Love the story behind the sandwich press. Owner was awesome came over and chatted with us, and made us a breakfast sandwich for us to try! Definitely will be back and can't wait to try more breakfast sandwiches!

Yummy!!  This was a great place to eat a good sandwich. I had a craving for a different type of sandwich. Not ur firehouse typical. And this place blow my mind with the coleslaw and roast beef. I loved it.

Zookz sandwiches is hands down the best sandwiches in all of Arizona, it's my little hide away spot and trust me you can't go wrong with any of the choices. The service is immensely wonderful and the owner? She's just a sweet heart, you can tell she loves what she does and what she puts on the plate, I only hope she has the ability to open a zookz near ASU because it'll be hit. I never write reviews but this place is amazing.

100% absolutely wonderful. The experience here, from right at the beginning, was incredible. Very, very friendly and welcoming. And those sandwiches! Damn, they're good! Next time we are in town we are coming back!   Thank you, Zookz!

This is a great little find! I will definitely be going back. It's not real close to where I live but whenever I'm down in that area I will not pass it by. Highly recommended! Very delicious, not overpriced, very friendly.

I had this for the first time today with a girlfriend and it was awesome!! The sandwich shop is very clean and well designed. The chef is a phenomenal lady and has done a wonderful job with the place. She also allowed us to try something new that she is considering! Job well done Zookz Sandwiches! :)

I've drove by zooks several times and always wanted to go in. Today I finally did and I'm glad I did I had to very picky teenagers with me so not trying zooks before I was a little worried. As we walked in we were greeted by a nice guy behind the counter who explained the zook menu I ordered the #20 and my kids customized their sandwiches they got chips and I got kale salad. We got our drinks and sat down shortly our sandwiches were delivered and they were great pot pie like sandwiches, my picky kids loved them everything at zooks was great we're going back soon!

Flew in from Michigan and yelped for a good breakfast sandwich, this one had the most reviews and now I know why! Absolutely delicious and fresh! Cheese was melted and combination of tomatoes basil and  cream cheese paired really well with the poached egg! Then the bread with an edge, literally. Pockets everything so well. What made this experience even better was that the owner was greeting each table, bussing things that needed to be picked up and delivering food. She came by and talked to us for a couple minutes. Great Experience! When I come back into town I am for sure going back!

Quality, consistent and so tasty! Been there many times and have been going down the breakfast lunch dessert and salads - before writing this review. Yes great food across the board and plesant caring staff appears to filter down from an on site working owner/creator chef. If you have not tried this reasonably priced eatery you most definitely are missing out.
Use to make these sandwiches with a press back in the day. Generous with the filling, side salads are good, nice chill spot to eat at. Been here many times.

Such a fun lunch! We went with a traditional turkey/avocado/tomato type (#20) and something a little different, a turkey/almond/cranberry/apple choice (#10). Both had an awesome tangy mustard sauce and we super satisfying. The hubs and I usually share but opted not to from other Yelp reviews. It was a good call; he devoured his and I ate almost all of mine.   The price was about $8.50 a sandwich, not bad at all but I would have rather not had the price of the side dish built in, as I didn't like any of the choices- kale salad/potato & black bean salad/garbanzo bean& corn salad. We went with the potato but it wasn't good.   We will definitely be back to try the breakfast options (served all day!) and one of the dessert sandwiches also.

We love Zookz! My boyfriend and I tried Zookz for the first time this morning, and the owner introduced herself and made some suggestions for us to try- she was awesome!  We ordered two breakfast sandwiches and they were both AMAZING and just the right size to fill you up! We took some to-go menus with us, because we have a feeling this will be our new favorite spot! The service was exceptional, and the food was mouth watering, finger-lickin' good!

5 stars, as usual Zookz. This place has seriously become one my favorite places to get a quick, affordable breakfast/brunch.  Ventured off the breakfast menu today, ordered the pulled pork sandwich and it was incredible. Would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.  The care that the owner puts into the restaurant shows through almost all aspects of the place. Really a great place.

Had the #20 with a side of black bean and potato salad, and a passion fruit mimosa. Everything was delicious, service was fast and friendly. Plenty of seating inside and out. The staff was very nice and I even met the owner who was super friendly! I look forward to visiting again in the near future!
One of my favorite lunch spots!  Great food and the owner is always there to make sure we have the best experience.  Portions are perfect.
Delicious, fresh food with friendly service.  Had the No. 10 with kale salad and pomegranate green tea.  Best lunch in town!

On our way up to Sedona for the holiday weekend, my wife and I did a quick pit stop at Zookz as we were driving out of town. We got there pretty early - around 10 AM - so the restaurant was pretty empty, and Carole (the owner) was working the register herself. She's very friendly, and she brought out our sandwiches once they were done. The interior itself is pretty much what you would expect for a fast-casual spot, but you can also read the story of how Zookz came to be on the wall next to the television - a very interesting and cool background!  As for the sandwiches - it's really well-done, particularly the crisp on the outside of the bread, and it definitely fills you up...you can fit a lot of stuff into those pockets! I ended up going with one of their breakfast sandwiches that had typical breakfast foods (egg, bacon, avocado) and topped off with some sriracha-infused sour cream (I think) that made it a properly fusion breakfast sandwich. My wife went with No. 25 - more of a lunch offering perhaps, but it also has black beans, avocado, and definitely more of a Mexican bent. The ham in particularly was quite juicy, providing a nice contrast to the crunch and crisp of the bread. We got a small side salad (corns and black beans being the base), which was pretty much in-line with the Mexican-inspired theme that the breakfast sandwiches take.  Overall - a really delicious meal at great prices. You'll definitely come away from here filled, and I really do wish there were more stores selling jaffles (which seems to be the name used in most other ex-British colonies, according to trusty Internet research). Although the sandwich may be unique, the fillings fit right in, and it's hard to go wrong with any of the choices offered. If I'm back in Phoenix anytime soon, I'll definitely be swinging by here for a meal!

Simple, tasty, fast - it was exactly what we were looking for. The prices are great too!   Their "sandwiches" are close to an empanada or calzone with all of the ingredients sealed into a sourdough crust.  It's crispy on the outside, but still soft and moist inside. My son keeps dreaming about his meal so we are on our way back there today!

The two owners are very nice-the sandwiches are fantastic.  Two types of potato salad.  The bread tastes great and it's kind of like a thin hot pocket kind of sandwich - with fresher ingredients inside!  Patio seating and nice atmosphere.

I was shocked of how delicious the sandwiches are here. Very unique combination I tried 2 different sandwiches and they were both awesome  The iced tea is fresh and brewed 4 different flavors unsweetened and again lots of flavor kept going back for more  Only knock is they are round sandwiches size of a bagel and run about $8.50 each  Plenty of parking

My boyfriend and I were in the mood for a good sandwich so we decided to try Zookz after seeing all the positive reviews on Yelp.  We are very happy that we did - actually, we were so happy that we went back 3 times in 1 week! The sandwiches are very unique and there are a good number of variations to try. The Kale salad is also very good and is a nice and healthy accompaniment.  I also recommend trying the "carrot" cake which the owner told us is not made with carrots at all, but actually beets. It is really delicious.  Not too sweet and just the right amount of frosting!  The owner is quite friendly as well and you can tell that she really cares about the quality of her food and providing a positive experience for her customers.  Overall, I'd say that Zookz is a fantastic new addition to the Central Phoenix area when you are in the mood for a tasty sandwich for breakfast or lunch at a very reasonable price.

So glad I tried this place. Note to the owners: That big yellow "best sandwiches" banner you have really works, otherwise I would never have even noticed Zookz! We went for breakfast. I had the #33- 2 poached eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, fresh spinach, tomatoes and fresh basil. It was awesome. I do wish there were more meatless, savory breakfast choices. I can't wait to try some of the lunch sandwiches.

What a great find!  I am having  the #66 breakfast sandwich and the poached eggs are perfect.  The menu is small but I like that.  I would rather have a few well prepared, delicious items rather than a vast menu that hasn't been perfected.  The staff is fantastic, the place is clean, and the prices are unbelievably cheap.   Cute and quiet indoor/ outdoor seating  makes it a peaceful place to hang out, eat, and read a book.  Which is exactly what i am doing with my yummy loose leaf iced tea.

My husband and I wanted to try something new. We were treated so so nice and I LOVED the food. You have to try it! I had the 15 but with chipotle. I have definitely put Zookz on my FAVE LIST!!! Keep up the good work Zookz. Glad you are in the neighborhood
Just can't hardly decide which to eat.  They are all delish. Wish they stayed open a little longer.

Love Zookz!  I work downtown so time was limited. I ordered online from their website, zookzsandwiches.com. It was so simple to do. I got to choose my pickup time. I got there at noon and was able to go directly to the counter.  The cashier was friendly and had a big smile on her face.  My food was out within 60 seconds and my sandwich (the #45) was nice and warm- and 10 minutes later when I got to my office it was still warm and fresh.  I had kale salad on the side. The flavors were excellent and ingredients were fresh and crisp!  With placing my order to go, I did not get a good look at inside, however I did notice it was clean and open to the outside eating space in the front.  With the quick & easy online ordering, the quick & friendly staff, and the fresh & delicious food, I will definitely be back!

I really want to give it a 5 star review but I can't..... Yet.    Stopped in here to try somewhere new and after reading all the reviews I knew it wouldn't disappoint.  I ordered the 45, which had spinach, basil, tomatoes, mozzarella, red peppers and probably something else I forgot.  I also had to try the kale salad.    My first bite was delicious!  Yummy bread, good flavors... A real winner.  Then I took a second bite and realized the inside was still ice cold.  :-(. The big chunk of spinach was super cold and the cheese wasn't melted.  It was sooo disappointing but I still ate it because I was hungry and it didn't taste bad cold.  The kale salad was out of this world!  Sooo yummy!  I will definitely be back to try it again and hopefully it will be fully cooked.  Even with the sandwich being cold inside, I still liked it enough that it warrants 4 stars.  The fact the ingredients were fresh and it wasn't frozen spinach helped with the good rating too.  I will try it again soon and update my review to what I'm hoping will be 5 stars!    Seriously... the kale salad is yummy... go try it now!

Zooks is delicious. They are soo friendly here and love to help you out with suggestions. I definitely recommend trying any of their top sellers (#25 is what i got).   The sandwiches are not huge, so if you are big eater...get a salad or another sandwich.   One wish I have for for Zooks is that the egg yoke would be runny instead.. That would be AWESOME!

I've seen the ads. I've read the reviews. And the fact is, people are selling this place - and selling it hard! Maybe too hard, in fact.    If you're automatically wowed by something that you've never had before, then I guess I can understand the appeal. Additionally, if you're the type that enjoys your sandwiches jam-packed with a hodgepodge of ingredients, then fully expect great things.    I ordered the No. 22, which seems to be one of the more popular choices. Honestly, it's really just a boatload of stuff all jam packed into toasted bread, that looks somewhat like a cross between an empanada and a pot pie. I expected the bread to pop in flavor based on appearance. The reality is that it's not really anything special beyond a mere crispy shell. The edges were hard and chewy. The ingredients were all okay, but as previously stated, it's a boatload of stuff that is all muddled together to the point where nothing really stands out except maybe the eggs.    For six bucks, I guess it works for what it is. But let's face it, a five star Pane Bianco sandwich this most definitely is not.    Their dessert options look like they'd be interesting to try and I'm sure I'll return at some point to sample another sandwich.    Maybe I just don't throw out five star reviews as liberally as other people. It's not bad, but there are far better places to go if you're looking for a good sandwich. But if you're seeking something quick, cheap, and edible, then Zookz is definitely worth trying.    Just keep your expectations realistic.
Average at best. Not sure why the rating is so hi. It's a hot pocket and the portion size Is small. Not satisfying
This place is adorable and super yummy!!! Everything on the menu looked delicious. I order 66 and it was so amazing!
Loved this place! Owner warmly greeted us and walked us through her favorites on the menu. Salad was delicious an my colleagues enjoyed the sandwiches. Highly recommend Zookz!

My friend Nancy, read a story about Zookz, and thought we should try it out. Even thought it was quite a ways from Fountain Hills, it was definitely worth the drive. My husband and I shared the #66 and the #20 (one breakfast and one lunch)....delicious. Nancy also had the #66.We loved both of them though I was partial to the #66. The potato salad was so good, also. We met the owner, Carol, who was delightful and made us feel like we were friends as soon as we met. The service was fast and friendly. We will definitely be back, as it's the kind of tasty food that keeps calling our name :-)

Discovered this place just looking for someplace to eat that was pet friendly.  Well, they're not only pet friendly, but, people friendly.  The owner greeted us and made us feel welcome.  I had seen some of their unique sandwiches on this site and had one thing on my mind....good poached eggs.  I was not disappointed.  I had the No. 11 breakfast sandwich and I can say without a doubt that it was the best thing I have eaten out in recent memory.  My wife had the No. 25 and she loved it as well.  Our pet Dolly got a nice bowl of cool water and a dog biscuit (she was much more interested in what we were having, though)  When I ordered, the owner informed me that they cook their eggs through and if I wanted them any different, just to ask.  I custom ordered it with my eggs just before fully cooked.  I got my sandwich and they were done to perfection, not to mention the sandwich itself was perfection.  Crispy on the edges, good "tooth", in the middle and the inside was pure deliciousness.  Their unique method off cooking a sandwich makes any of their sandwiches simply delicious.    Hey, and don't forget one of their hand prepared sides.  Like potato salad?  You'll love their version.  Like kale? Their kale salad is like no other.  If you think you don't like kale or have never tried kale.......try it!  You'll be glad you did.  I'll definitely be going back to try all their other sandwiches and try to pick a favorite.

Had my first taste of Zookz at breakfast this morning with long time pal.  I had number 66 he had number 11.  Our collective conclusion is we WILL return.  Very good value, very good food, light flour/bread, terrific choice of ingredients.  The pie tope crust is reminiscence of the sandwiches we made on camping boy scout outings.  Crust on both sides thin not thick. Owner Carol recently relocated to Uptown Plaza from original location just south of Camelback on Central where there was limited parking and trolley track problems. Plenty of parking at Uptown Plaza. Seating for 50 inside, another 30 outside-covered-windows open for more ambiance with misters when needed.  outside is covered. The one weakness in our opinion is the coffee, it is bitter.  Breakfast sandwiches are $5.95 plus tax.  Each is a little different. Homemade salads as well as homemade sandwiches.   Weekday hours begin at 7 AM and 8 AM Sat/Sunday
The food was great and the service outstanding. The owner is hands on and takes tremendous pride in everything served. I would recommend and will be back for more.

Amazing. Another local Phoenix gem.  I'll try my best to use words to describe why these sandwiches are brilliant. They are pocket sandwiches cooked up superbly. The fillings are sliced delicately thin and diced just right. The fillings are tenderly nestled between two circular pieces of bread, and the whole thing is cooked so that the bread is toasty brown and the fillings are warm and juicy. The whole thing adds up to a party in your mouth. It's almost like a gourmet grilled cheese, but way more amaze-balls.  I had the #20, turkey, bacon, avocado with some amazing magical sauce in it. You get a small salad with any sandwich. I had the kale, nut, mandarin orange salad. As if the sandwich wasn't amazing enough, the salad put me over the edge.  On my second visit, I had the roast beef cheddar bacon (#35). Yum yum yum yum yum.  The service is great and the place is very cute.  I highly recommend Zookz for lunch.

Got the no. 33 sandwich and even after reading the positive reviews and viewing the photos, the sandwich managed to surpass my expectations! Service was excellent as well. Keep doing what you're doing.

Went there today to check the place out. Was highly rated on the Yelp site...THE FOOD IS AWESOME and the price is VERY REASONABLE. The owner takes pride in her menu and came over to talk to us for about 5-10 minutes. We both started our with their patented pressed turkey sandwiches, which come with a small side salad. Both the sandwiches and side salads were FANTASTIC. How good?  I picked up two full side salads "To Go". Yes, we were impressed and Yes, we will be returning soon. By the way, the Prickly Pear Tea was delicious...

Awesome twist on the sandwiches. They have around 8-10 options,but you can always customize and add/remove ingredients.  The size portions may be on the smaller side if you have a big appetite,but the side salad(i love the chickpea one) helps.  They cater to your sweet tooth with the Peanut butter jelly sandwich as well. The owner(I think its the owner) is really involved and will make sure you have the best experience.

Interesting concept for a sandwich. I enjoyed the taste but still find myself to be a sandwich traditionalist so I'm not sure that this is a place that I will frequent. The staff was very nice and the service was quick.  The bread tasted a little sweet, almost like a griddle type of bread.  With everything baked in, I almost feel like I lost the the taste of the individual ingredients.

It is so refreshing to go into a restaurant and have the owner ask if she can help you. The owner, Carole, is amazing! Zookz has become my go to place for a quick, light, terrific meal. Number's 11 and 33 are my pockets of choice. The ambiance is fantastic and the food even better. Five stars all the way for me!

We saw this place on tv show "Check Please Arizona" so decided to stop in for lunch. They didn't seem to have as many sandwiches as what we thought from seeing on tv. I had the #11 and my wife the #10. We both enjoyed them but afterwards both questioned why they didn't have a grilled cheese with tomato soup. How good that would be with their pressed circle bread. There teas are awesome, similar to Flower Child. Even now Im looking at there menu and see sandwiches as high as #77, but there menu board only seems to have 2 or 3 columns. Definitely unique and tasty and can be healthy too. Must try!

I had my first Zooks experience yesterday for lunch.  Carole the owner of Zooks created great place to go in District 4. I got the #30, a creative combination of ham, brie, apricot and roasted almonds, my mouth is still watering from it.  Not only was the sandwich amazing but Carole suggested that my team and I try the kale salad and the oatmeal cake, what a good suggestion that was. It was an amazing lunch and can't wait to come back with my team.

These are the best sandwiches in Phoenix. The owner is so friendly and will make sure that you enjoy what you get. It creates a wonderful environment of great guest service.   The only problem is that since the sammiches are so good, you never get enough! I've ordered two before because I couldn't stop eating them.    The kale salad they use as a starter is so good that it could be its own meal.   It's seriously a treat to eat at Zookz.

When I was a child. Yes 50+ years ago we had a device to make grilled cheese sandwiches in the design as this establishment so I experienced a time warp when I got my sandwich These folks have innovated the sandwich. I've only been for breakfast but by far the extra attention they use must be experienced. Whether it is adding cream cheese or basil to a breakfast sandwich which makes you pay attention. Hey if you want ordinary go get an egg Mcmuffin. Excellent. Excellent excellent. My only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that I'm a morning eater and to me coffee is king. I would step up the coffee service so people stay and eat there. That's all. These sandwiches are taaaaaasty!!!!!!! Good job. Please it's been a while since I moved to Chandler so you may have improved the coffee service. If not take this as kindly input. And you don't have to go the barista route ($) just get a premium brew and containers to hold them hot without further heating like a hot plate which sours the coffee in 15 minutes. I want you to thrive because I looooove these sandwiches.
This is my first time here and it's delicious! I can't wait to come back and try everything else. Everyone is so friendly and the patio is wonderful.   I'll be back, Zookz!

Had to convince my mother to come here. We always struggle when it comes to dining places because she craves very unhealthy foods that do not appeal to me at all.   I think she enjoyed it!! I know my #33 was fabulous ... Every bite was heaven!   Great patio out front dog friendly with misters which keeps it nice & cool! Thank you for being so thoughtful   Will repeat.
