Mom said it wasn't as she imagined & the food had flavor which means we don't have to fight about my selection!

We were a few hours early for our flight out of Arizona and decided to grab some lunch before heading in to the airport. I searched around and saw that Zooks was pretty highly rated and affordable, so we decided to try it out.  I'm glad we picked Zooks for our last meal in Arizona, because it was awesome. The location is small, but incredibly clean and bright. The menu is easy to understand, and every employee was incredibly pleasant and helpful. I got the number 35, which was excellent, and my mom got the...Turkey club one. Not sure about the number., but she liked it. We also tried the potato salad, which while different than the egg or mustard potato salad I'm used to, was good. Creamy with a bit of spice, but not overseasoned. My mom got the garbanzo beans, which she loved, and then an employee who may or may not have been the manager also gave us a kale salad to try for free, which was, like everything else, fantastic.  This ran us about $20 with fountain drinks, which isn't bad for lunch. If I'm ever in town again, I will definitely be coming back to Zooks (or maybe they could open a location in Dallas? :D)

This place is amazing. Fun and funky twist to what easily can be a regular old boring sandwich. The secret is their bread. It is an old family tradition but similar to a pita. The sandwiches are similar to a panini but with much more pizzazzzzz(snap). Very friendly staff and very affordable. This is a Phoenix must try.

In my opinion Zookz is over priced for "specialty sandwichs", but they so use good quality ingreide  Zookz is always very clean, and that's a big thing for me, I don't enjoy eating in a dirty establishment. No matter how busy it's been when I've been in there it's always clean.   The best thing about Zookz is the amazing woman, Bevy Jo, who manages the place. She's always so pleasant and the customers seem to really like her. The owner should be proud and happy to have such a great manager on staff! Even on a busy day, and busy lunch rush the wait is never very long and the manager always makes sure to ask if everything is enjoyable. I've never been to a busy lunchtime restaurant and had such an attentive member of management take the time to check on her customers. I would simply comeback to this establishment because of the way each customer is treated.

El Hubbo (aka the Hubs or Hubby) and I stopped in on our way from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport to Sedona AZ, as I had bookmarked this place as our lunch destination after reading the great reviews of it!  First and foremost, I don't know anything about the Phoenix area, but the location of this place looks a little sketchy and in fact, I took a business call outside, prior to going into Zookz (because I didn't want to be obnoxious and talk on the phone while trying to order), and some random dude that was walking by starts mocking me.  LOL.  Weird.  Anyway, enough of that nonsense!  Zookz is a small place and when we did go in, we were the only ones in there because it was like 2 p.m., so clearly after lunch time for most normal people (including me, but I'm not normal).  I ordered the No. 20, which has turkey, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, and Zookz mustard sauce, and a small kale salad.  I was so hungry that I ate the kale salad immediately and it was OMG scrumdeliumtious!!  I really wanted more of it but knew I had a sandwich coming.   When my sandwich arrived, it was cute & round!  It reminded me of the sandwiches I use to make at home way back when with my little Presto Sandwich Maker, and that's how it tasted, too!  It was really yummy!  I liked that it wasn't too filling, it was just right.  I kind of felt like I could eat 2 of them, but then I knew I would be in a carb coma on the way to Sedona.  The employees here are super friendly and I also liked that they have a Hot Dog Cart Showroom across the street.  Are hot dog carts big in Phoenix that they need a showroom?!  BAHAHAHA!  We would definitely return again if in the area!!

Unique and addicting sandwiches! These sandwiches are one of a kind and a must try!! If you like trying new foods, try this place! Their sandwiches are all great, fresh and bread/crust is amazing. Always made to order. Like Cornish Pasty but better in my opinion! Service is top notch! The staff is always friendly and caring. Yes, they seem to care about your lunch! The owner is very genuine and you can tell she loves her restaurant and staff. Highly recommend this place and bring friends here whenever I can.  Love the Kale salad but I wish it were a little larger in size in my opinion. I just get two salads because one just isn't enough.  Don't forget to get a punch card! You will be back. :-)  Thanks Zookz!

Wow is all I can say about my Breakfast Sandwich !!!  Plenty of parking, a very friendly staff, who will walk you through your order especially if it's your First Visit.  The Breakfast Sandwich was Delicious w/scrambled eggs, bacon & cheese. A tasty sandwich w/apple juice all for a Great Low Price !!  My only complaint about the Restaurant, is it's in Phoenix and I was only visiting for Five Days.   I'll be back next year and it will not be just One Time.
Great price point for the area! Decor is wonderful and the staff is warm and inviting! The menu is diverse and the side salads are delicious! Definitely recommend the potato salad

Zookz is a cute little joint just south of Mazie's, offering, in their words "sandwiches with an edge."  Intrigued by their catchphrase and not too far from the office, I stopped in for a to-go order.  The design is simple, functional, modern, and inviting.  Very friendly staff.  I ordered the No. 50: spinach, corn, tomatoes, avocado, cheddar cheese, and chipotle sauce.  The edgy sandwich has no edges in fact; it is a buttery toasted circular-filled disk.  It was pretty good, and I do appreciate the unique attempt, but to me it simply tasted like a grilled cheese sandwich.  The bread is pretty straightforward, and there was just too much butter and cheese to taste any of the veggies inside.  Also, the way the sandwich is toasted together so firmly makes the spinach and corn heat and wilt nicely, but makes for soggy tomatoes and avocados.  Served with a nice little side of corn, feta, and black bean salad the whole thing filled me up but for anyone with a slightly larger appetite you may need two to make a meal.  They are open weekdays only from 11-3, the price is right, and based on the grilled cheese-like creation and very limited parking this place will probably do well catering to the Brophy & Xavier kids across the street.
Excellent fast casual sandwich spot. Perfect for a quick, savory breakfast sandwich that's grilled in a pocket-like pasty. I'll definitely be back. Very reasonable prices too.

A friend and I are new to the area and found this place on Yelp! And  WOW! so impressed!  We went for lunch time. Pulling into the parking lot, it already had a good vibe. Clean and friendly. There are sliding glass doors that can be open to allow fresh air into the building and a patio to sit at.   We didn't know what we wanted to eat because of the different style sandwiches and the owner helped us. She was awesome. Even suggested what to add to my sandwich. While allowing my friend to sample the sauce she was unsure about.  A side comes along with the sandwich, and my friend picked chips and I picked the potato salad. The owner insisted we try the salad... and just gave it to us! So Impressed again!!  We decided to sit outside on the patio and enjoy the weather. The cashier came out to make sure we were okay as well as the owner. I will definitely come back here again for the great customer service and the amazing food. Thank you so much for the great experience!

I do enjoy and have enjoyed zookz from their original storefront. Though I've never gone in, I've always enjoyed their food when delivered for our large corporate lunches. Today I made my first visit in and was impressed by the variety as well as the layout and locations of the menus. Makes it very easy for someone to decide what they want. I mainly chose to come in based on knowing a side salad is included with the lunch portion. However it's very easy to get confused when the signage reads "your choice of one of our homemade side salads".  When ordering I chose a salad from the board, which is apparently not protocol. "It sounds like you haven't been here before. You choose one from the cooler and give it to me and I put it in the bag" I was told. In a slight sense of confusion and shock I had to leave the counter from ordering to select a salad, none of which were labeled at the chiller aside from "contains nuts" on the lid. It was unclear to tell what was what so I grabbed something that was green. While I do enjoy the food just a few words have put a "bad taste in my mouth".

The sandwiches were sooo delicious! My boyfriend and I came from Michigan to visit. We wanted a quick breakfast bite to eat after the gym and Zookz hit the spot! We had the #44 & #66, a mimosa and iced latte and it was perfect!
Oh my gosh! The baked goods are AMAZING FRESH delicious. NEVER had Caribbean Cake until now. WOW. Now I have another ZOOKZ addiction.

Pretty good sandwich. Not huge. Just the right size. I had the #30 and my BFF got the #20. Both good. If you have a sandwich maker at home you could probably replicate any of their sandwiches. But if you're out and about and need an inexpensive lunch stop in!

Wow, I could not be a bigger fan of this place.  The first time we went to this place, the ladies (owners) were so sweet.  They chatted a moment with us about their options and top sellers.  They managed our order fabulously.  I got the #35, a fabulous SW potato salad, and a dessert sandwich with nutella and powdered sugar.  ALL, and I mean ALL, of it was fabulous.  #35 is like eating a burger, but not so awful for you, the SW potato salad is not spicy but has a SW flavor that is addictive, and the nutella sandwich was SO decadent. The biggest problem is due to all of the carbs/starches, I was SUPER full, so plan on taking some home if you are a light eater. BUT, it refrigerates and microwaves well at home. (At least the #35 did). :)  The restaurant is spotless, the hand washing station is magic, and I love the recycling section of the trash cans.   This place is officially in our lunchtime rotation and I am obsessed with how sweet the ladies are that work here, they are what make the place magical.  I will definitely be back for more.

Came here last week to try this new craze, I ordered the turkey since that's what they recommended and it was very delicious. The crust was a little hard to eat but the sandwich overall was very good. Parking is tough in this location but I hear they're moving nearby to resolve that. I can see this type of place blowing up because it's got a very trendy & casual atmosphere. Will be coming back soon.

The ingredients and recipes are good, but the delivery needs improvement.  I couldn't eat the edges or crust, because it was too hard and hurt my teeth.  Also, the sandwiches are fairly small.  I ate two of them and was still hungry.  For roughly $7.00 per sandwich, I would rather go somewhere else.  They are overpriced by $1.00 - 2.00.  The people are nice, the place is clean, and the service is fast.  Unfortunately, I wasn't too impressed with their product.  Oh, yeah, their potato salad was good...

Just tried this place out for the first time and will definitely be going back.  Cute place inside with nice interior.  Very open feel to it and you can sit on bar stools, look out at Camelback Road while you eat. We ordered the #11 and #66 which were both delicious.  Coffee was strong and hot!  Nice little breakfast spot!

We visited today for the first time. We had two breakfast sandwiches - #22 & #66. We asked for our poached eggs to be soft. The owner explained why it might be difficult (because of the grill machine) but then accomplished it. I was expecting the #22 to have a nice smoky chipotle flavor but it was overpowered by the mustard (which wasn't mentioned in the description). When the owner came by to see how we liked our sandwiches, I mentioned this. She promptly made me another without the mustard and at no additional charge. That's the way service should be! Thin, crispy bread is exactly what I want in a sandwich and they do it perfectly. We will definately be back. And this will be my new take out spot for workday lunch.
This place is delicious. My favorite sandwich is #22. Customer service is great! Also dont forget to try their Iced Mocha Coffee its's amazing too.

What a great place!  Clean and modern, very hip, but absolutely not missing the warmth and love of a locally-owned business!  Carol, the owner, was walking around making sure everyone was happy, offering tastes to a party that was having a hard time choosing.  The sandwich was great, but I particularly liked the side salad selection (I had the potato salad, VERY yummy).  I love sandwiches, but get tired of chips...Zooks has four side salads to choose from, each looked better than the next, which comes with your sandwich instead of chips.  The windows were open, the weather was gorgeous, and this was a great intro to Phoenix for me.
Hands down best sandwich shop in the valley. The sandwiches are BOMB and the lady who owns the shop has nothing but sweet vibes for customers.

What a great idea! Toasted sandwiches seared around the edges and filled with lovely, inventive, tasty fillings! Some may call them called Toastites or Toasties. Delightfully paired ingredients for breakfast or lunch. Quick, fresh, hot, delicious...what more could you ask for. Oh yes, breakfast around $4 -$5 and lunch around $6.50. Tasteful modern clean interior. Now open every day this will become a fast favorite. Try the Kale side salad (included in price) with chef/owner Carole's secret dressing. Wow!

We ended up here by accident when something else was unexpectedly closed. I would probably go out of my way to go back. The sandwiches were delicious and so filling. I had a breakfast special sandwich with sausage, poached egg, sausage, and cheese. I also had the oatmeal chocolate chip cookie and it was one of the best cookies I've had in a while. The owner was there and she was so friendly. I hope they open one in Tucson soon, but I will be back next time I'm in Phoenix for sure.
Awesome lunch place!!  The owner greeted us at the door and explained the sandwiches.  I had the kale salad after reading the yelp reviews about it.  I was not disappointed.  Great find in Phoenix!!

One bite and  I'm hooked. #30-ham, a layer of Brie, a spoonful of apricot preserves and a sprinkle of roasted almonds all gooey and melted is definitely the way to go. I also really loved the kale salad side dish. It had a sweet vinaigrette and had pecans (and maybe bits of apple?) in it. I only wish it were larger. :)  My friend had the turkey with the curry mayo and cranberries and it was awesome too. I really can't wait to go back and chow down on these little frisbees of awesomeness. Do check in while you're there and you may get a 10% off coupon. I didn't discover that till we were leaving but it said I could use it next time!

My husband I are visiting from San Antonio to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary.  But because our hotel didn't offer a typical free breakfast that most hotels provide these days, we checked Yelp for a local affordable establishment.  That's how we found Zookz.  It was affordable ($) but held 4.5 stars.  So, off we went.  Lorrenna took care of us and made great recommendations. OMG, round toasted breakfast sandwich were so delicious that both my husband and I found ourselves making all kinds of noises while we were eating because it was so yummy.  The bread was perfectly toasty on the outside.  The eggs and other ingredients on the inside was perfect. The staff said we need to come back because their lunch sandwiches are even better.    And, because we mentioned we found Zookz on Yelps we received a 10 percent off their already inexpensive price (Breakfast sandwich was less than $6).  Good thing we don't live locally or we will be here every day!!  While you're hear, be sure to read the origin of Zookz! We'll definitely be back before departing Phoenix.

I love this place. It's fresh and delicious. It's my favorite place to stop while Im out running errands because I know I won't spend more than $8, it's healthy and fast. The owner is so nice and I love the story behind the sandwiches.  It's definitely a local business worth supporting.
Try number 35 if you're a horse radish fan! Extremely good value, terrific concept! Would recommend in a heartbeat!

This place is adorable.  There are so many things to like, but the reason they only get 4 stars is they have a pretty limited menu, so you may not be able to find something for everyone to enjoy.  I walked in expecting a sandwich slapped together on two pieces of bread. The sandwich I received was far beyond this. I ordered a sandwich with poached eggs, avocado, and cheese. The sandwich reminded me of a toasted uncrustable, except with eggs and cheese instead of PB&J (but they have that if thats your kinda thing). Although, the bread is definitely not white bread -- it is more of a pot pie, uncrustable, sandwich, with breakfast on it. The poached egg was fantastic -- perfectly cooked! I 100% ordering a breakfast sandwich. They know how to cook an egg.  The atmosphere -- Its in a great location. They have a dog friendly patio and the inside is trendy. Service was quick and they were friendly. Nothing to brag or rag on.  I definitely suggest a visit to Zookz -- It is an out-of-the-box sandwich shop that's a perfect spot for brunch.

I've been wanting to try this place since I first saw a photo of one of their sandwiches. It was everything I had imagined and hoped for. I met the owner Carol who was kind enough to buy me a cup of coffee while I waited for the cooking contraption to get hot enough to make the sandwich. It was a delight speaking with her and hearing the story of how this place came to be. I highly recommend this place  and fully intend to be a regular.

I come here probably once a week for the #22 and a big iced tea. This spot is perfect for a hot summer day or an early morning breafkast on the go. Takes probably 5 minutes from the time you order.   #22 is cheddar cheese - two poaches eggs - avocado - bacon - ham - black beans - and zookz chipotle sauce  This is a must have if youre in central phoenix or off camelback!

I was in the Pheonix area visiting one of my best friends and decided to check this place out one morning.  The exterior is very inviting with a large bouquet of fresh sunflowers that match the bright yellow covered outdoor seating area. The interior is an open space with some bench style seating and private tables offering warm and fluffy pillows to make you feel at home. The menu is great, offering a plethora of rounded toasted breakfast and lunch sandwiches, in addition to healthy salads and juices.  I opted for the "Zinger" #66 which is crusted toasted bread pocket filled with poached eggs, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, bacon, and green onions, topped with a Zinger cream cheese sauce. So YUMMY! The lovely woman at the register was a ray of sunshine!! She was very welcoming when I walked in, offered to go through the menu of the most popular items and then gave me a free kale salad on the side -also delicious! I will be stopping back for sure!!!

Yesterday, we wanted to try something new for lunch..  We were in the mood for a good salad and my friend did a search and Zooks was on the list.  We headed over and in my mind knowing where this was located, I dreaded the parking situation I was going to find.  Luckily, the parking wasn't bad because we went at 1pm, but we did get the last spot that we had to squeeze into.  A truck would never fit.  Anyway, we walked in and the atmosphere is pretty fresh and clean with bright colors and images of fresh veggies adorning the walls.  Pretty nice.   When you walk up to the counter, a pretty nice guy greeted us and asked if we had been there before and when we said no, he explained the menu to us.  We went right for the salads, even though some of the sandwich options looked pretty good. I got the #5 and an iced tea.    We took our seats and one thing that stuck us as a little odd was that the AC system was over the windows but the air was so forceful it didn't matter where you sat in the dinning area, you were going to be blasted.  Not a huge deal, but it was noticeable.  It's Arizona and it's hot, so I guess we should be thankful.    Once we got our meal, it came in a plastic to-go container.  One thing I might recommend to them is using something less environmentally unfriendly and costly for people who are dinning in.  I mean it seems very "pre-packaged" and not to mention it's totally crappy for the environment, but I digress.... The salad was full of wonderful ingredients, crumbled bacon, roasted almonds, dried cranberries, apples, carrots, and Zookz Creamy Apple Mustard Dressing.  It was so good, it left me wanting more.  (Meaning it was great, but it have had more to it or at leas greens at least.  They should bottle that dressing for sure, though because it was awesome!   This is a great place to grab lunch so check them out.  I think I definitely want to try a sandwich next time.  Maybe split it with my friend and have the salad again too.  I hope to see them fix the way they package their salads so when you dine-in you aren't getting it in a to-go container. Heck, it's going to save them money in the long run anyway.

Very good and unique.  You should try this place, I've never had anything quite like it. It is not so unique or foreign that you should be scared, it is a sandwich after all.  It is a little expensive for what you get, but yummy.   If you like Roast Beef and Horseradish.. there is a killer sandwich here for you! :D

At first you wonder what the hell these little things are... you then bite into them and realize who cares... because they're delicious! I order them from DoorDash and it's here under 30 min, you can't go wrong. Soooooo yummy. The #11 is prolly my favorite. So easy and basic yet amazing. I've only had the breakfast ones tho, I need to go for lunch soon!
Friendly service, cute building, awesome sandwiches, and large/delicious sides! Definitely recommend!

We love this casual sandwich shop that specializes in disc-shaped toasted sandwiches. The owner is always around greeting her patrons and making sure that the quality is consistent. The sandwiches themselves are awesome. Perfect crunchiness every bite but never burnt.  My wife had her favourite, curry turkey (no 15), and it was just as good the first time we came by. I had the poached egg and bacon (no 22), which was good, but I probably should have gone with a lunch sandwich given the time of day. Every item on the menu has been an explosion of savoury delight. This is our favourite sandwich place in the valley.

Five stars for this place. The best sandwich I ever ate! Not kidding. Not over loaded on bread.  The perfectly crispy, toasted, melty thing I've ever ate!  Met the owner who gave talked with us and gave us the history on Zooks! Yum.  We will be back!! If you are in the area this is a must try!

Services was super friendly and helpful! And the food was great. Usually u see pictures of the food and the actual food looks nothing like the picture but  this place made the food match thier pictures! And it tastes just as good as it looks! I love the choice of making it the way you want but i didn't even need to cause it was already perfect! Wish they had one in Yuma cause i would be there everyday!

The employees were incredibly friendly and helpful, even offering a suggestion to my 12 year old daughter who is a bit picky with foods. We had the #35 and #20 and both were delicious! I thought the portion size was right on, especially since it also comes with a side. Sure you could spend a dollar or two less at a fast food drive through but this is is quick, casual dining with high end taste and ingredients. Also, we always love finding a local spot that is family friendly and satisfies our foodie palettes!  Definitely will be coming back to Zookz and recommending to others for both the food quality and excellent service.

Amazing fresh food and service. I came and tried the sandwiches with the garbanzo bean salad. The sandwich was amazing and flavorful with just the right amount of ingredients. I personally did not like the garbanzo beans as much but there are plenty of other choices to choose from.  Not only that, but the service was excellent. The staff was very friendly in helping me to decide what to order and struck up a conversation with me while waiting for the food. Even the manager came out to ask how the food was. Highly recommended.

such a cute place and great sandwiches!! I got the #15.... if you like curry or flavor you will love this. the cafe is perfectly decorated and makes you feel welcome. great for a quick lunch date or work lunch hour. prices are not bad either especially because you get your choice of a salad with it!

My boyfriend and I are new to the area and are constantly having to rely on yelp for recommendations and I have to say this was a great recommendation! We got numbers 20 and 25 with sides of potato salad and a free side of the kale salad! The staff was very welcoming and helpful with these recommendations and we will definitely be back sooner than later!!

I think this place is great! The staff were really friendly and the environment has a relaxed vibe. I got the kale salad, which was astoundingly delicious for being healthy; the kale wasn't bitter at all. The #35 was savory and flavorful. The sauce and juiciness of the tomatoes went well with the dryer, flatter bread, which in itself is an innovative twist- it's more like a smushed toast or cracker than a fluffy bread.
These sandwiches are small but filling! They are so incredibly good, a panini mixed with an uncrustable from Smuckers.
You must give this little sandwich shop a try!! It blew my socks off. Plus the owner is a ray of sunshine. Wish I lived closer.

First timer here. Ordered a No. 10 with a No. 9 side salad. Newcomer to this pocket sandwich idea and IT WAS AMAZING!!  Ordered through UberEats and was deliver freaky lightening fast. The sandwich was still warm. The parm sauce inside was the perfect tang to the sweet apples & cranberry in my turkey sandwich.  The crunchy crust!  I need this in the morning. Will have to try the AM sandwiches.  Absolutely loved this meal. I am one happy camper right now. It was a little expensive but I'm ok with that - I have a big smile on my face.  THANKS!
It was okay. Kind of reminded me of a hot pocket. A large, delicious, expensive hot pocket. Probably won't be back but had a good experience.

I thought Zooks was alright, but obviously I didn't enjoy it as much as others. The sandwiches were small and the ingredients (while fresh) were so mashed together they were hard to decipher. I couldn't tell if I was tasting a tomato or an avocado, there was just too much going on inside that little round pouch. The kale salad tasted like watery sweet coleslaw and I wouldn't order it again.   Overall it was just ok, I made similar sammys in my college dorm with a plug in press I had for years... Service was great and the place was extremely clean.

I should start by mentioning, I love sandwiches. They're my favorite. So when I Yelped restaurants near me and Zookz Sandwiches came up, I knew it was meant to be.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. We made small talk while I ordered and she helped me choose a delicious sandwich (the No. 10, more on that in a second). The other patrons were also friendly. I live in Southern California now, this is rare and special. There was also plenty of seating, with options to sit inside or outside, on stools, chairs, or a cute cushioned bench with throw pillows.   The coffee is out on the counter where I could get my fill and mentally prepare/caffeinate myself for the day. My sandwich was a perfect, toasted, sweet and savory hug from the inside. There was turkey, almonds, cranberries, and apples on it.   Thanks, Zookz! See ya next time I'm in town!

Was in the area. Didn't have breakfast and was hungry. Searched on yelp and just chose a place. Found Zookz and it looked delicious. Went inside and was greeted by some chill dudes. I ordered the No. 33 which had: 2 poached eggs, feta ans parmesan cheese, fresh spinach, tomatoes and basil in the sandwich. Very very delicious. The outside was crunchy and the inside was soft and savory. It was pretty cheap too. I will come back if I am in the area again.

I really enjoyed this casual and inviting lunch spot! I ordered the mozzarella and spinach salad and it was yummy! Klutz that I can be, I dropped half my kale salad on the floor just as I was telling my friends how yummy it was. When I mentioned it to the owner as an aside, she brought me another one without me even asking!  Talk about customer service!

I have been wanting to try this for a while now. Went in today with my bestie. The design and vibe is gorgeous. The owner overheard that it was our first time in, she came and introduced herself and suggested her personal favorites and chatted for a few minutes. Very sweet. Once we ordered she came to check on us and started to explain how Zookz came to be, great family story. The sandwiches were heavenly, the side salad was perfect, the best fresh tea I've had in a while... I loved the entire experience. Most of all, I appreciated how kind she was... Would give ten stars if I could. Thanks for making our lunch perfect :-)

Never thought I'd say this but I love round sandwiches. This place offers a unique twist on you every day sandwhiches. I had to order 2 lunch sandwhiches and a dessert to try. Everything was delicious and fresh. I wished we had one in albuquerque. The food tasted great and the staffs were super friendly. We came in on new years eve and although they had abbreviated hours, they did not hesitate to stay open until all their customers got their food.  Can't beat business practices like that.
Best sandwich place I've visited in a while! Friendly staff, excellent sandwiches (I had to get 2 on the first order),  and the owner even came out to talk to us. Definitely would recommend!

This place is great for breakfast or lunch! Fun take on a different kind of sandwich, similar to a panini. I had the #20 turkey, bacon, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, avocado, with sweet heat mustard. My sandwich was so yummy and I would definitely order it again. I also had a side of potato salad which was okay but nothing impressive. I kinda wished I had a pickle on the side. Their assortment of iced teas are awesome as well. I Mixed the prickly pear with the green tea  The atmosphere is my favorite part, great patio seating! Can't wait to try their breakfast and fresh squeezed orange juice/ mimosas, next time for sure.

It physically pains me to write this review. I've been wanting to try Zookz for years but didn't see many vegetarian sandwiches and when I discovered I'm gluten intolerant I put Zookz out of my mind. Luckily I saw on Facebook a couple of months ago that Zookz now has gluten free bread AND from my favorite bakery, Gluten Free Creations.  My husband picked up Zookz yesterday so we could have for dinner. I got the No. 40 which I've had twice before on gluten free bread, they even write "gf" on it. I don't know what went wrong yesterday, but OH BOY!!!! I ate half the sandwich last night around 7:00 and by 1:00 am I was writhing in pain. Anyone who has gluten sensitivities know exactly what I mean. I am positive the bread was gluten free, but Zookz does not have a gluten free kitchen nor do they claim to have one. I believe cross contamination occurred at some point.  I enjoy Zookz. The owner is super nice and actually cares about her business and customers which is why I'm saddened that I can no longer eat there. My husband has no gluten issues so he'll be back.

I really like this place! For someone who doesnt really like sandwhiches i love it! Its very cute and i love the decor and seating area. I got the #11 which has bacon, cheese, tomato, cream cheese, and egg. I knew the sandwhich was going to be rich tasting right off the bat because of the cream cheese. To be honest i wasnt expecting a lot of bacon, because lets be real here, what place actually puts a lot of bacon in anything? To my surprise it was filled with chopped bacon. 4/5! Also to add the ladies at the front were extremely nice!  And of course the REAL reason i came here was because of the #55. Nutella, banana, peanut butter and roasted almond goodness! Ugh. Im a sucker for anything chocolate and peanut butter. Oh my gosh this sounded like heaven and it was!!! 5/5 This is the only reason for my 5 star review. I didnt know such thing even exsisted on earth. This will def be bad for my wallet and ill pay for it at the gym.. damn

Came in her for a quick bite to eat one day as I read good things about this place, plus I remember when it was a Sweet Tomatoes so I wanted to see how the place has changed. I ordered the #35 and my wife got the #20. The sandwiches are small, but are delicious. The flavors complimented each other in a great way. To top off our experience, we splurged for the prickly pear tea and pomegranate green tea which were both delicious as well. I would have given it 5 stars, but the service wasn't that great as I think they were trying to close up for the day, but it wasn't bad enough to make us not come back again.   Definitely recommended!!!

I finally got a chance to go here today after being teased by that freakin' billboard on central and camelback.   Here I go: I walked in and the young man behind the counter was very pleasant and took the time (the time I didn't have) to explain what they're all about. The owner was there too and she was super nice. They kept addressing me by my first name which I thought was really friendly. It made me feel like I was at a friends place. I ended up getting the mozzarella and tomato sandwich that came with a TINY salad. There are a few different salads, I went with the kale one. So when I went back to work, the moment of truth was bestowed upon me and I took my first bite and it was...OKAY! Nothing to rave about honestly which sucked because I wanted to love it. It lacked flavor was just plain bland. The kale salad was too oniony.  The prices were decent also.  I am all about local support, so I probably will give it another shot. 2nd times the best time, right? (I don't know where that even came from)
The hype is 100% warranted. This place is great. If you're boring and basic and want a plain sandwich, go to Subway. If you want your mind blown by an incredible sandwich like no other, go to Zookz.
Amazing!! I recommend this place. It's clean, every employee is smiling and the sandwiches are DELISH!!! Come check it out!

I can't say enough good things about this place. The decor is clean, adorable, and trendy. I went with four people, we all got different sandwiches, sides, and drinks and everyone of us raved about our meals. Seriously the most delicious sandwich ever. My garbanzo side was so good too! The choices of flavored tea was impressive. The food was well worth telling friends about and a return visits. But we also had to good fortune of meeting the owner. Probably one of the friendliest kindest businesses owners I've ever met. You can tell this place is a work of passion. She has a way about her that makes you think you're sweet and fun aunt is cooking for you. She's the type of person you want to invite to family affairs. She was so helpful in explaining her menu and being hospitable. She even brought our table a free dessert which was amazing and I now unfortunately will not be able to go back without getting one in the future! Go here! You will not be disappointed!
Food was great. I would def come back if I lived in the neighborhood! I got #66 and it was quick and fresh and decently priced!

I'm in my first trimester of my pregnancy and woke up craving a breakfast sandwich. I found this place online and after seeing the pictures of the sandwiches I had to go. Ive been extremely nauseous this pregnancy and I hardly enjoy my food as much as I normally do, but I remained optimistic... It was raining today so, my fiance and I dressed our two toddlers in some warm clothes and headed out. When we got there the parking was sparse, but luckily we found a spot right in front of the restaurant. When we got out of the car I noticed the place was a bit smaller than I anticipated, but I liked that there was a nice, large sliding glass door which was opened. I liked that there was a good amount of seating outside as well. When we walked towards the register we were greeted by a very kind and friendly lady. I let her know it was a first time there and she seemed very happy to help us. She told us about their most popular sandwiches and kindly recommended the sandwich with nutella, banana and almonds for our children. My fiance ordered The Zinger which was amazing according to him and that's a huge compliment because with his father being an impeccable cook, he is all about quality and taste when it comes to his food. I'm not sure if my sandwich had a name, but it had turkey ,bacon, avocado and honey mustard I believe. I asked for the mustard on the side, because I wasn't sure if my unborn baby would take to it. The woman who took our order told me a side was included with my order and showed me to their refrigerator which had a few health conscious options. I decided on the garbanzo bean salad and she kindly handed me her kale and tangerine salad as well. I enjoyed both sides. My family and I sat outside since the rain had died down and enjoyed the fresh air. The woman who took our order also took our food to us outside while we were all taste testing the sides. My sandwich was amazing, my children's sandwich was amazing and the pomegranate green tea I ordered with my sandwich was VERY good. The woman came outside to check on us and to also let us know they will be moving down the street to the plaza with AJ's Fine Foods by the end of December because they are aware of the parking issue. I think with the food being so good they've outgrown their space. I had a very good overall experience  and will be visiting them at their new location in the near future!! I have not had many GREAT experiences with food in the last 3 months, but this was definitely one of them!
I had the #20.  Deeeelish, kale salad was yummy too.  I had never been there before and the guy behind the counter was so nice and helpful in making my sandwich choice.

You are now aware that Zookz makes uncrustables for grown-ups. And while you can't get a PB&J, they are delicious.   I must have stumbled upon a meeting of sorts during my first visit to Zookz. About six workers stopped, looked my way, and greeted me with huge smiles. I can tell when someone is faking it, and these grins sure were genuine!  I wanted the very best they had to offer, so without hesitation I went for their most popular lunch--turkey, bacon, avocado, and sweet mustard. It came with a tiny, but scrumptious side salad of kale, craisins, and walnuts. Delightful! Some say these are small, but this is a right-size lunch at a good price. Totally snagged a little jug of apple juice with my sandwich and dropped less than $9 for a satisfying meal.   A fair criticism to ding a star for is that it's not as flavorful as the ingredients would suggest. Rather than an eclectic sandwich, it almost tastes like the best grilled cheese you've had in your life. I would use less cheese and probably go for something sharper, just to let everything else shine.   Whoever writes the menu has some creativity and a keen palate for mixing flavors. If you're around CenPho and seeking a tasty, casual lunch, don't pass this place up!

Just had lunch here for the first time and OMG it was so delicious! I had the No 20 and it was so good and a kale side salad! OMG YES, I ordered and paid online and as soon as I got there my food was ready I was in and out in 3 minutes. Love it, definitely going back.

I've been to this place more times than I can count. I usually try to come here on the weekends for a quick brunch after Zumba or before doing errands. If you haven't been here, you are missing out.  Where do I even begin?! This place is a quick, to-go breakfast & lunch sandwich place. Personally, I love breakfast sandwiches, especially if they are quick, cheap, and amazing! You get all of that plus more at Zookz. My personal faves for the breakfast are the No.11 and No.66. Both are oozing with flavor. For lunch, my go-to is the No.10. I didn't think I'd like the sweet mustard with the apples + cranberries combination, but to my surprise, this one hit the spot. Other times, I just stick to the 11 and 66 because who doesn't like breakfast at any other time of the day? Aside from the sandwiches, this place has killer potato salad.  Inside, there's corn, black beans, green onions, and more. You'll have to try it yourself.   The service here is superb (hi, Adrianna!). Because of coming here so many times, I see how consistent the service AND the food are, which both keep me coming back. The ambiance of the place is SO cute and charming. The yellow color scheme makes the place feel vibrant and fresh. The owner is awesome too! Even when it's busy, she tries to walk around and address customers inside.  The parking is shared with many other places in this area, right in front of the entrance and on the sides. I haven't had much of an issue with this. They're usually open 7am-4pm... although I do wish they were open later (breakfast for dinner is one of my faves).   Overall, if you're looking for a quick breakfast, whether you want to sit inside with a date, group, or by yourself, or just a quick pick-me-up, Zookz is definitely worth the try.
Their sandwiches are very unique comparing to others.  I definitely come back again with my little one.

My husband found this place while golfing with a buddy. He raved about it all week long and then insisted we go back the following Saturday morning. I tried the No. 11 with avocado and it was so good, my son even likes this place and he's a finicky eater. The owner Carol came out introduced herself and asked if we needed anything. Overall I would definitely venture Back to central Phoenix for another Zooks No. 11.. The service was quick and great, the staff is friendly, the food is really good!!!

I've been here twice now, and while not bad, I find nothing really satisfying about the place. First visit, my breakfast sandwich fillings were distributed mostly to one side, so one half was relatively tasty but the other side was bland. 2nd visit, my lunch sandwich fillings were good, but nothing really stood out that would make want the sandwich again, or even to return to Zookz at all. My biggest complaint about Zookz is the bread. Their 'uncrustable' style of sandwich pocket pressing results in a very dry, very hard, unappealing, nearly inedible 1" surround on the sealed edge of the bread. If they buttered the bread before closing it up in their clamshell press, it might improve the product.   Zookz isn't bad; it just fell far short of my expectations based on reviews. Two visits & I'll opt for the many other better sandwich places around town from now on.

So I used to cater from this place before she moved into this new location across the street. My guys used to complain that the sandwiches weren't big enough so I usually ordered 1 1/2 - 2 sandwiches per person, problem solved, the sandwiches were $5.75/$5.95 each so it wasn't a huge price to incur when you're simply feeding a lunch meeting.  Now I decided to take my son in for 2 sandwiches (because I KNOW one isn't going to fill him up, he's a teen and they're always ready to inhale everything after school). Imagine my surprise when I see she's increased her prices to $8.50 a sandwich, same flavors, same size just MORE money. So for 3 almost hot pocket sized sandwiches, a bag of chips and 2 small..and I mean small side salads the total was $27 and that's with NO DRINKS.  I'm sorry but it appears that she moved into other new snazzy location in the AJ's lot and is passing the cost on to her customers. Good sandwich, and I mean just good..nothing spectacular or extraordinary but for $27 I can walk around the the walkway to AJ's and buy a pound of their finest ham, a loaf of their gourmet, fresh baked bread and some imported cheese and go home and make 8 toasted sandwiches and still have money left over for a couple cookies to eat afterwards.  Shame because there were already complaints of the sizes of her sandwiches for the price when they were cheaper but now at this rate, she won't be in that corner long.

Today was my first time trying this place out , the food was very delicious and atmosphere was very peaceful and unique.  I got the No. 33 Breakfast sandwich which included 2 poached eggs , fresh spinach ,feta cheese, fresh basil and tomatoes . The most unique thing about there sandwiches are that they are in mountain pies( campfire sandwiches) and so delicious , it reminded me of going camping during summer camp and making mountain pies around the campfire.  Thanks for helping reminisce on old times.   Beware during lunch you may have a hard time finding a parking spot in front , but there is always parking on the other side of flower child ,Or by see' s candies.  The staff was super friendly,  they have Wi-Fi here but unfortunately my computer wasn't letting me use it for some reason (famous: connected but no internet error).  Only thing I would have liked was to have outlets outside or inside (then again i didn't see any where I was seated) so that people could sit out side and work .

If your wanting a quick breakfast or even lunch this is your place!   The food is absolutely amazing and great prices no more than $10   The owners are awesome right when you walk inside. They always ask if you have been to zoosk and can probably tell/if you need a little help understanding the menu or what it is exactly.  The eggs are always cooked to perfection, the place is clean and bright and fast service !   I highly recommend but you have to go early because they close at 3pm !

The sandwiches are toasted round filled with different delightful ingredients. You can order more traditional breakfast fillings with eggs and maybe cheese and sauce and tomatoes or a number of different things. Then there are the rest of the sandwiches with turkey or beef ir ham and ... too many  lovely things to tell in this venue. With the "lunch" sandwiches there are several salads that accompany the sandwich and they are wonderful too. The people who serve you are also very friendly. It's a pleasure to go there and I would recommend it highly.

The kale salad is off the chart! The whole experience was fantastic. I had a question about ingredients and the chef was right there to happily answer my question. The atmosphere was cool and clean. Zooks is an instant fav

This is such a quaint sandwich shop with delicious food and great service. The owner Carol was great...very friendly, informative and welcoming! I highly recommend checking this place out...we will be back!

Got the 20 to go but absolutely amazing. I've never had a sandwich like this and I'm a big fan. The chocolate coconut dessert is great too. Im not a big eater and finished it with half of dessert so some of you should order 2. Ill be back for a breakfast sandwhich and a beer for sure.

Took my daughters here for a quick, light meal.  I was unfamiliar with the business, and didn't know all their sandwiches were pressed.  I had a turkey sandwich, with bacon, and feta. It was AMAZING!  My daughters had turkey, and roast beef sandwiches, which were equally delicious.  I met the owner, who was very pleasant, and gracious.  I will likely return.
This place rocks,  a must try I'm only disappointed that I haven't tried it sooner. The roast beef with horseradish is excellent.

SoooooGoooood!! :) I had never heard of this place.  I asked my phone for a sandwich shop nearby my new office/Central and Camelback.  The service was outstanding, and when I got back to my office to eat at my desk...I had to stop eating to pick up the phone, and call them to compliment them on how amazingly delicious my sandwich AND potato salad was. (I had the #20)  No lie...this was ridiculously delish!! I am headed back there at least once a week. Congratulations to Zooks!! Glad your here!

Absolutely loved it. We came and had a #20 and a salad, so we could try them both. When the salad first came out, it looked small, once I started mixing it, it was quite filling. The bread that the sandwich is made with is so yummy and creative. Love the crust.

I love Zookz! I always have! I don't know how some of these yelpers can write 1 star when they're angry they caught you outside business hours. It forever changes your rating and she HASN'T EVEN TRIED THE PRODUCT!?! Look at the hours, people! and don't get all hurt because you can't do your homework by looking at the hours!

Wow! Loved my sandwich, tea, and side kale salad. Everything's seems fresh, and what a unique and creative idea for sandwiches. I loved it. Recommend trying it if in the area. Definitely left me with an itch to come back and try different sandwiches! I had the 35, basically roast beef with horseradish sauce, it was very tasty!

I was craving a good salad and was also feeling lazy. After some searching, I discovered you can order Zookz online and walk right in and pick it up. Score! I ordered the No. 5 Salad which is fresh Mixed Greens, chicken, crumbled bacon, roasted almonds, cranberries, diced apples, shredded carrots, and Zookz Creamy Apple Mustard Dressing. It was everything that a salad should be! Light, refreshing, yet extremely satisfying. I ordered the dressing on the side to be a little healthier, but it was so good that I ended up eating it all anyways.  A week or so later, I decided to try breakfast. I went with the online ordering again and got a Nutella, peanut butter and banana sandwich for my boyfriend and an egg sandwich for myself. The sandwiches look a  little on the small side, but are surprisingly filling. They are also more like an uncrustable than a regular sandwich, but that's part of the charm.  The Nutella sandwich was pretty good, and not overly sweet considering its contents. I liked my egg sandwich that included bacon, ham, cheddar, black beans, avocado, and zookz chipotle sauce. My only dislike was I wish they let you do a little more customizing when ordering online.  I hope they consider some later hours in the future. They only open through lunch right now, and it would definitely be convenient to order online and pick up dinner on the way home... if I still lived in Phoenix.
First stop after we landed at airport. Delicious sandwiches. Very nice staff. Enjoyed the setting.
It's a glorified hot pocket. It tasted good but the portion size was disappointing. It's a perfect snack not a meal.
One of the more unique sandwiches I've had. I feel like I'm eating a sandwich with a pot pie crust instead of buns/bread. Breakfast sandwiches are great hangover food.

I know this isn't the popular opinion here, but I really didn't care for this sandwich place.   Customer service is stellar. Owner was there and friendly and helpful.   The food? Kind of boring and bland. My son called it a glorified hot pocket. I do think it has a lot of potential, but it's just not there yet.
They moved to a new cute location!!!! Love the new spot and the new sandwiches! The pulled pork is craymazing!!!!

Came here for the first time this past weekend and will certainly return.  Great service, unique sandwiches from a a bread standpoint and my roast beef and cheddar was very tasty and had just enough horseradish sauce!

I got the No. 20 and it was alright but the crusts of the circled sandwiches were way too over cooked and the sandwich kept falling apart. I don't feel like they have perfected they're unique sandwich yet. Not sure I would come back

First time here today and I met the owner. She was lovely! Very personable. I appreciate the welcome right when I walked in. It's a cute little place very modern industrial. Definitely a place to stop by for a bite. They serve breakfast all day long!! That wins my vote!!! I recommend this place to anyone who likes fresh local food!

Great prices, great food. Zooks is my go-to spot when I'm hungry and in a hurry in Phoenix around lunchtime. The #20 (for turkey lovers) & #35 (for roast beef type people) are my favorites! I always get the kale salad on the side. Service is very friendly!

Went there in the early morning on a weekend just after they opened.  The owner was there and the lady working the counter.  They were both so friendly and sweet.  I wasn't familiar with the menu or what exactly the sandwiches were all about.  I ordered the most popular breakfast sandwich, and it was very yummy.  I ordered a coffee which was also very tasty.  I liked the whole backstory that's on a big sign on the wall.  I love that it's all inspired by her grandmother and the amazing travels she would go on.  The decor is very cute and cozy and I wish I had the time to sit in there.  I'm almost never early enough to work to have the time to stop in, but I hope this place does a lot of business.

This place is mediocre at best. The name is ridiculous. They should have named if after the sandwich her grandmother made. These are basicly hobo pies. The portions are really small. For $12 I left hungry. Plus the layout is all wrong. You have to double back to get your drinks and fight the crowd to sit down. I was not impressed.

Ok, so I want to love this place, I've been waiting to try it for months, but in my opinion it's really just ok. I can only speak for my experience and for the two items that I ordered. I came in at noon on a Tuesday and ordered the mozz/spinach sandwich with a side of kale salad and a drink. While I waited for my sandwich, I stood by the fountain drinks waiting for the repair man to get down from his ladder blocking the faucets...he didn't. I stood there for 10 mins waiting for him to move until I finally asked the cashier if I would be able to get a drink. Ok, forgiven. The extremely hard crust on what is deemed to be a crustless sandwich was inexcusable. The contents of the sandwich were good, but only after peeling off the edges was I able to enjoy it. The kale salad was sub-par. Maybe I came on an off day, or maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  Overall, worth a shot but don't build it up before you go. It's nothing to write home about.

Zooks just popped up on my UberEATS and I had to check it out. I'm indecisive and starving so ordered a breakfast, lunch and dessert sandwich. Oh. My. God. Every single one was incredible. I can't wait to go in person.

First visit here I was not disappointed. The owner greeted us told us about the sandwiches said if we didn't like them she would make us different ones, needless to say she did not have to make us new ones. We had the zinger and the turkey one #20.We also had the kale and a garbanzo salad. Sandwiches were toasty good We will be back They will be moving soon to the AJ's shopping center off Central so make sure you don't miss this unique place. Also very fast service.

Love the food and the concept. Original sandwiches, healthy, clean, and fresh flavors. Ate there for the first time today and the owner was a beautiful and kind lady. I highly recommend everyone check this place out and make it a routine!

I have a friend who comes here almost every day, and her pictures and posts of Zookz made me HAVE to make the trip to Phoenix to eat there. The location is really cute and I loved the decor. Service incredibly friendly and attentive. They asked how I heard of them and I told them how I heard through my friend (they immediately knew who I was talking about). I really enjoyed the feel in Zookz. You can tell it is a small, locally-owned business that treats their employees right.  The food: I got #20 with the potato salad (and a soda, because their cups were cute. I'm weird). My friend got #25 with the kale salad. I'm forgetting what exactly was in mine... I think turkey, avocado, cheese, and tomatoes... but it was delicious! I was really impressed with the bread, which was crispy and light but with great flavor. My sandwich + soda was ~$9. Pretty good price for a locally owned small business.  I highly recommend Zookz to anyone who is in Phoenix (or even by making a trip out there for those of us who live in N. Scottsdale). I've already told all of my friends about Zookz, and I can't wait until I can go back!
My favorite place to get sandwiches! Everyone is friendly and the food is ALWAYS delicious. Thank you Carole!
Food is awesome and customer service is even better. Great place to swing by for a break from work or school. GCU student approved

Great little place. The guy at the counter was very helpful explaining this new sandwich concept and pointing out popular items.   They take two slices of bread sort of a french bread, put the ingredient in the middle and press it in some sort of machine to melt and seal it all together. Very tasty.  I had a breakfast sandwich with poached eggs and my partner had a turkey sandwich that came with a side salad. Both sandwiches were fantastic with all the ingredients fused together  and the side kale salad with orange dressing was amazing. Please make this into a regular size salad with chicken or something, its delicious.

Nice Sunday casual food. I had the ham, avocado, black bean chipotle.  It was great! I'm not a fan of hot sandwiches but this might change my mind. The potato salad had corn and black beans and it was a fabulous twist! Atmosphere was very laid back and cozy. I would have liked a wheat alternative to the bread as I don't care for white bread. Worth seeking out! Oh-- I think the owner said hi and that was nice!

Love this place. Food is consistently good. #22 is my fav.  Love the variety of flavored teas they serve. The vibe is low key and family friendly. The owner almost always comes out and says hi to us and other guests. My folks have been going here for years and my only regret is I didn't start coming her until recently!

Wow... From the first moment I walked in!! Such friendly staff who greet you! I got the #33 without tomatoes and it was very delicious!! I would say the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a very long time. I'm not a fan of spinach but I kept it on the sandwich and it tasted great with the egg and cheese. All fresh ingredients and the taste definitely shines through. Easily a 5star place based on atmosphere, friendliness and taste. Thank you Zookz, a true Diamond in the rough!!! If I'm ever passing through Phoenix again, no doubt I will stop in and eat me some deliciousness!

Walked right in on Tuesday after Christmas.   No sign on the door, nothing indicating place was closed.  Door was open, employee sitting inside said, "sorry were closed."  Closed forever?  Closed for today?  Closed until when?  Why was door open and no sign saying clised?

After I finished facilitating my meeting for work, my co-worker and I decided to get a bite to eat.  We were starving, we were hungry, we were cranky.  Unfortunately for us it was still early so everywhere we wanted to go was still not opened.. That's when we decided to give this place a try.    The restaurant was clean, service was good, staff was helpful and nice, the food was unique and good, plenty of lighting and unfortunately the price is kinda high, but no big deal.   Overall a good little place, we had a nice time, and I would probably only comeback....
Very good sandwiches fed my craving. The owner came over and was very helpful. I'm glad I live near this place. We will be back.

Ate here this morning with my wife. Ordered number 66 and a 22. We really enjoyed it and has a unique style to delivering breakfast. It's simple but good. I've been told by a couple friends to check it out that are in love with it. And I think it's worth the money.

His is by far the best sandwich I have eaten at by far, if you want a light, flavorful, crisp sandwich that is full of favor I suggest this place, everything is modern, cute decor, and a perfect first date spot. The menu is cheap; and the food is great!!

I am a regular lyft driver and today i picked up a woman with limited mobility and very limited eyesight. I have to admit i would have never have gone here, if she hadnt asked. Nonetheless, i was skeptical about how this encounter would go and asked if she had gone before and what the deal was. She said it was The best but another nameless rideshare company wouldn't help her out with the whole journey. We ordered pickup from her house and then cruised, 10 minutes tops on a Friday during lunch. The counter person was extremely friendly, helpful, and compassionate. The owner greeted the woman and they discussed her love of the restaurant at length. The space itself is quaint and has the coolest door in the world. I loved the selection, menu, and overall atmosphere. The sandwich itself is like a empanada made out of bread. The bread is pressed in a panini manner. Served hot. After the transaction was completed, she asked if i could take her home. At a stop light she begged me to take a bite of her sandwich and we ended up sharing our #24 and #25 in the car. It was a truly beautiful sandwich. I wouldn't have found it wasn't for this nice ole lady.  I guess i need to bring someone here and repay the favor to appease the sandwich gods.

I came here with my mother who was visiting from another state and we both absolutely loved our sandwiches. The salads we got with them were just as amazing. The portions were just right too. Not so much food that we wasted anything but enough that we definitely left feeling full. We'll definitely be coming back here.
My fist time here I was doubtful of what to order but I went with the pineapple coconut sandwich I think is 44 or 40 really good and make feel so happy and light
Loved the breakfast sandwiches, crispy on the outside and full of flavor on the inside. The atmosphere was great and laid back on the Inside, and they had a great selection of iced teas!

Hands down my favorite spot to get breakfast during my morning bike rides. The No. 44 is my favorite egg frittata. Bacon. Ham. Yummy!!!  I usually get a couple sides to go with it. The kale salad is to die for!!!  Great job ladies!!!

We are from out of town and watched a live feed from this establishment on the morning news. Wife and I decided to try it. Did not disappoint. I had #25 the ham & cheese and the wife had the #33 poached eggs. Great choices! The bread was toasted to perfection. With the lunch sandwich you get a choice of a salad or a bag of chips. Great seating area with water misters on the patio. Definitely recommend.
Yum you have to try this place! They are the nicest people. Be sure to mention Yelp for a 10% discount.

Was in the area and thought I'd stop in for a quick bite to eat.  Located off Camelback Road but can be a little difficult to miss unless you're in the actual compound, then the sign becomes visible. Lots of parking.  The place is on the small side (-1).  There is outside seating, tough in my opinion, not enough.  High chairs and tables are available indoors, but still I couldn't help but feeling quite choked whilst in there. Staff were great and friendly.  Answered any questions we had and even made recommendations.  Menu was easy to comprehend.  Restaurant has an open concept so I'm not sure how customers would be cooled during the hot summer months.  Restaurant was clean.  Food was delicious.  The rounded toasted sandwich concept is interesting and innovative.  Everything is made fresh.  I had the pulled pork (I believe #60) and that comes with a side. I chose their potato salad.  The latter was fresh, tasty, and a small kick to it.  The sandwich tasted fresh and flavorful. If I'm in the area again, I'd definitely like to try some of the other choices on the menu, but will probably take it away or eat in my car.

This sandwich shop is amazing. The staff was very nice and the food was extremely good! I recommend getting the Num 35, roast beef, and getting the kale salad for the side.  The owner, who I believe was on the line cooking, made it around to ask how our sandwiches were which I felt made her very open to hear what her customers thought.  Their dessert is also amazing! My wife and I shared a Banana, Nutella and Peanut Butter sandwich. This was a great way to finish the meal.

I went here with coworkers for a quick lunch and was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The manager also came out to see how we were enjoying our meal.  I am not sure how to describe the sandwiches that they make. They look like two pancakes, but they are not, that are fused together with the delicious meat, cheese, and vegetable combinations stuffed inside. I had the turkey bacon and avocado and it was scrumptious.  The sandwich came with an orange citrus kale salad that was unexpectantly delicious and I don't normally like kale.  As a surprise from my coworkers the staff brought me a piece of their oatmeal coconut cake. I wasn't sure what to expect but it did not fail. The cake was light and moist and the coconut was not overpowering.  I would highly recommend that if you are ever near camelback and central for lunch to check out this place.

Great sandwiches, I had the #45 and it was delicious!! These sandwiches are like toasted pockets that keep everything in. Oh and definitely try the kale salad! Average price is 10 bucks. I'll definitely will be back

Since zookz moved to Camelback and Central they've really surprised my taste buds! One morning a friend and I decided to grab breakfast and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing customer service provided by the associates and the owner! She was welcoming, warm and excited to see us back again! So excited to try more toasted sandwiches! Cheers!

First time there and it was a good impression. Not great but good. Ordered the Chicken curry sandwich and the side Kale salad. Sandwich was warm and the portion was good. However, I'm use to Kale salads being sour. This one was sweet. I know it said a Citrus dressing but I wasn't expecting sweet citrus. I was impressed with the tea selection. Very good unique selections. Overall, a good and expedient experience.
Unique sandwiches! Loved our lunch! Really impressed with service and how quick our food came out even though the place was packed! Strongly recommend

Love this place! I have tried half the menu so far and every sandwich tastes so good! The food tastes healthy and has so much flavor. I also always get the potato salad with my lunch sandwich and it is so good! The service and food quality is never disappointing! So glad I found this place.  Oh and the people that work here are so friendly. Almost every time I come in the owner is working. She is so kind and ensures her customers are happy and satisfied with their food.
Great concept!  Great Environment!  Prompt with the food!  And frankly cheap!!  Not to mention my sandwich was excellent!!  I had the #66

If you're looking for a quick fix, a yummy breakfast, and a semi-non-messy meal, go to Zookz. These tiny little sandwiches are like little pies ready to be devoured. Is it a calzone? Is it a pie? Is it an empanada? I have no idea which exact family Zookz sandwiches fall under, but just know that there is a delicious filling tucked into a circular blanket of dough. I've ordered the popular No. 11 a few times now, which has cream cheese, egg, and bacon in the filling. Biting into it, the cream cheese gushes out in ample glory and egg yolk drips in suit with each bite. I adore breakfast food and can't help but be a fan.
First time, delivered through Uber Eats, order was accurate, interesting take on a sandwich. Very good. Didn't love the outside crust but the sandwich itself was fantastic.
The new location is great! Love the owner she is so nice and the food is always fresh and amazing. The #20 is my favorite with added egg.

Sandwiches are delicious and unique. Fun experience, staff was very friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed corn salad and kale salad. Food tastes fresh and the hot sandwiches arrived to our table quickly! We had lunch but would love to return for breakfast!
Delish sandwich and amazing little salad.  If the items were cheaper or the portions bigger I would give them 5 stars.  Come if you're feeling peckish, not famished!

A cool idea for sandwiches. Toasted, circular, and sealed. Fantastic service. Very friendly. Had an egg frittata sandwich with feta, bacon, ham, Parmesan cheese, roasted red peppers, and basil. It was really tasty, can't wait to try the lunch sandwiches.

Heard about this amazing place from a friend. It was like a grilled cheese for breakfast! Nice quality ingredients, and very reasonable prices. The owner was incredibly accommodating and friendly. Very passionate about her business. I will most definitely be back!  I would also like to add that I went here for breakfast and had to take half the sandwich home. They're very filling!

GAD-ZOOKS I can't say enough about Zooks! We make the drive from Gilbert just to eat here. The staff is very nice and helpful.  The atmosphere is super welcoming and comfortable.  The food? Well the food is fresh and super delicious. The sandwiches are on a fantastic bread panini style. SOOOO GOOD! You also get a side salad or chips (I've never gotten the chips). It's a choice of a freaking delicious garbanzo bean salad, mouth watering Kale salad, or Potato salad that will knock your socks off!  If you are looking for a new place to eat I highly recommend ZOOKS!

Been wanting to come here since they've been open.  Literally 2.3 seconds away from ny house    Amazing delicious little spot.   #45 #20 #33 a mustttttttttttt  the Potatoe and kale salad was to die for. I killed it. Hehe :D  Carol the owner was wonderful. So kind and very friendly. The people here were so friendly especially being first timers here and was a pain. Lolz.  I AM COMING BACK!!!!

My girlfriend and I just ate here for the first time today. The customer service of the staff gets a 5/5, they were friendly and helpful. The food gets a 3.5/5 (I gave it a 3, my gf gave it a 4). We both got the turkey bacon avocado lunch sandwich with no mustard. It was a bit dry, would have been better with a little ranch. I'm excited to try the breakfast sandwich next time. The interior was awesome, all open to the patio (its November so the weather was beautiful). Very cute. Overall, 4/5. I would suggest this place.

I wanted to love this place, but....service was slow (I was the only person in the place), the portion size was small (for the price) and my drink was watered down and ice machine was either empty or broken (which meant a metal container was left on the side with a paper cup in it - how many hands touched the cup and toss it back in?!) No Thanks!  I will say that the taste of the food was good, but it's pricey.

After a stressful morning I came here with my best friend for the very first time. It was lunch time but I ordered breakfast  Ordered number #33 and it was bomb dot com!!! It was like a food gasm in my mouth. Oh and the prizes for the sandwiches was super reasonable. It's like $5-6 per sandwich.   Oh and I also walked in on a girl using the restroom so I think you guys need to fix the bathroom lock. Haha.
service was sub par, ordered the number 22 for breakfast and it had very little avocado on it bacon and ham and was overloaded with black beans, I was very unimpressed
Only downside is parking.  Unique and delicious sandwich.  My favorite is the PB&J... Nice little treat!

Very unique sandwiches, healthy, delicious, fresh and warm.  The staff is very friendly and there's a great story behind the place.  The owner is there and pours her soul into the sandwiches and the customers, delightful lady.  The place is neat, clean and inviting.   Get a sandwich with an EDGE and support a fledgling new business.

I like the concept and that the sandwich I had was not greasy.  I could see where this type of sandwich could get really greasy, but I did not think that it was as amazing as the reviews led me to believe.  It was good, but I've had better kale salads and potato salads.  The customer service was excellent.  Perhaps I will go back and try a different sandwich, but it did not wow me.

I ate there 2 weeks ago when I was in town for a diamondbacks game and I have been dreaming of these sandwiches. Come on, its just a panini on round bread, ahh, no, its so much more, that sauce, there has to be something in it. Sweet mustard. Idk but I seriously cant stop craving it. Worth the 2 hour drive, but not quite worth the drive back to Tucson. So so good, hope they expand.

In love with Zookz! One of my to go lunch spots. The 35 is my favorite on the menu, make sure you add avocado. The pomegranate-green iced tea is addicting, I could drink this all day. Make sure to say hi to Carole the owner, she'll make sure everything is great. The level of service is how it should be nice, receptive, and willing to help you out as soon as possible. Can't say enough about Zooks. If you haven't tried it give it a try.

So I've been a roll on trying new great lunch spots and Zookz is just that. I was craving a salad (even though their known for their sandwiches) and I saw one on their menu that made my stomach jump up and down with excitement.   I got the #3 salad that has mixed greens, black beans, corn, sunflower seeds, feta cheese, chicken, and a honey balsamic dressing. And yes, it was as delicious as it sounds! My stomach and I were completely satisfied. I ordered to go and they made sure to put two dressing in there with the salad which made me happy. Nothing worse than an underdressed salad!! Situation averted.   As I was standing in line I was able to briefly skim the rest of their menu and see some pictures of their popular breakfast and lunch sandwiches. They looked amazing and I was surprised to find out that they are unique sandwiches as they're pressed/made/heated into a pocket like form so all the goodies of the sandwich are invisible to the naked eye until bit into (or cut in half). Basically, they look yummy and fascinating. I can't wait to go back and try one out. They also have dessert sandwiches too!  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I wish I lived a little closer so I could frequent this spot more often. ALSO, check in on Yelp and received 10% off your bill!! Can't beat that!

I love the sandwiches here!!! Ordered several to try them all and first of all they're hella cute. Little sealed in grilled toasted cute things!! Secondly they are super yummy! No complaints at all. I would say maybe add a smiiiiiiidge more salt but not really necessary I suppose. I also got the mocha something or other drink which was really sweet but interesting and delicious. I like the food and overall vibe of this place (: would recommend to a friend!!

So delicious! The four of us got different sandwiches so we could try several then we split 2 dessert sandwiches. Everything we tried was delicious! Their sandwiches are big enough to fill you up but not too big that you can't finish them. If you are really hungry I would grab a dessert sandwich to go with it. The sandwiches are small enough you won't walk out feeling like it was too much.  Fair pricing! A sandwich and drink come out to about $7 and dessert ones are less than $5. A must try if you're nearby!

Zookz is serving up some really yummy sandwiches!  Their sandwich is definitely unique. The way the bread is toasted/pressed together makes it even more enjoyable.  I'm pretty sure the press used to make the sandwiches is proprietary so this was the first time I've had a sandwich pressed in this style.  I went with the #20 ($8.25): Turkey, bacon, avocado and tomatoes, with shredded cheddar cheese, and honey mustard.  It was really tasty, perfect amount of everything so each bite was delicious.  It had the perfect amount of honey mustard, I ate it all up and was hungry for more. It is a modest portion, but was so enjoyable.  The wife went with the #45 ($7.25): fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, spinach, roasted red peppers, fresh basil and honey balsamic vinaigrette.  She absolutely loved it. Very good vegetarian sandwich.  Again, just the perfect amount of ingredients including the very tasty honey balsamic vinaigrette.  The potato salad was pretty good and had a southwest take, including black beans and corn.  I'd be back for the sandwiches. Very tasty and a great to go option when on the run.
Love their sandwiches! I highly recommend to others!

Super interesting and delicious spin on a traditional sandwich. They have a lot of unique options, and are always willing to substitute anything. It's made it order so very customizable. Very friendly staff and owner as well. Lots of seating. Free WiFi. Giant window which slides open for great weather days. I've introduced a lot of friends here and got them hooked! The desserts and sides are also really good. Give it a try!

Really yummy fresh ingredients. Try the potato or kale salad and you'll be delighted by the taste and textures. On our first visit, the owner came right out and talked to us about the menu and checked back in to make sure we were enjoying. It's such a cute little spot. We will absolutely be back.

These sandwiches are just alright.  I don't understand the hype.  They're on the small side and I found the turkey sandwich to be rather boring.  I won't be back.  If you're into uncrustables this spot may be for you.

First of all, parking is awful. It was a Saturday at noon and no one was in the place, but there wasn't a space available!  Park on a sidestreet behind the little shopping center and you'll be fine.  Be sure to get the kale salad. Who likes kale? :-P You will after this salad!  It's tiny, but get it instead of chips. We split #35 and 20, roast beef and turkey. Both very unique!  Skip subway or McDonalds for lunch. Try Zookz. Sandwiches are a cross between a grilled cheese, pita pocket and calzone.  Very friendly service.

Number 66 is great. Both dessert ones are great. The owner is great. The location is great. Even the oatmeal coconut chocolate chip cookie is great. The prickly pear tea is... That's right... Great. This place should be everywhere.

Zookz has been open for about 18 months now... and I am truly upset with myself for not trying it sooner.  On the flip side of that, at least now I have a new regular lunch spot!  The owner Carol was extremely outgoing, friendly, and cordial!    These sandwiches could be described as fancy "hot pockets" on a phyllo-style dough... BUT I don't think that description actually does these sandwiches justice.  I'll just default to Zookz' description as "sandwiches with an edge"...  a very good edge!  And lunch and breakfast sandwiches are served all day long.    The #25 is a glorious combination of ham, turkey, black beans, melted cheese, tomatoes, avocado, and some sort of sauce that I can't recall because I scarfed down the sandwich so quickly!  Sooooo good!  Yay!
