Awesome tasting "flying saucer" sandwiches! Her desserts are diet killer! So good. The kale salad with the light dressing is full of flavor.

I can honestly say this was a great place to eat! I was here in Arizona for business and wanted to eat at a quick but good place and stumbled upon Zooks! Such a great staff and good food! The owner was very courteous and friendly. I would definitely recommend! Will be back next time I'm here for business again!
Oh my goodness!! Amazing Sandwiches and sides!! The people here are also so nice. I had an amazing first time experience  all around!

This is a really cute little eatery. The good is good. Portions are not that big so it can seem a little pricey. The customer service was excellent. The owner came over to make sure everything was okay and even said she would remake a sandwich for us if we didn't like it. One of the sandwiches had horseradish on it and I didn't like it and the owner kept her promise and made me a full new sandwich! The kale salad was also delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area.

My hunger quest brought me to Zookz. The sandwich that I ordered was the number 10 consisting of turkey and apple. I loved the sandwich. The place looks nice and brightly colored. Service was good and I will definitely will be wanting to comeback.

I've passed by zookz many many times, but, for whatever reason, I never went in. After the shop moved to its new location, I finally decided to give it a shot. The new location is super cute...I love the color scheme. I went for breakfast and had their sandwich with eggs, spicy cream cheese, bacon, and green onion add basil. I really enjoyed the sandwich except the fact that they can't control the cook on the eggs resulting in overcooked egg yolks. Who wants that? Anyway, the crust and the rest of the ingredients were delish and the prices were inexpensive. I would definitely return!

I had my first visit today with my co-worker and friend who suggested it after coming a while back with her husband and I am HOOKED! The ladies working behind the counter were super nice, helpful, and very welcoming. We met the owner who was the sweetest lady and I even suggested an idea for a sandwich. The ambiance of the place is relaxing and open, not stuffy at all or has that heavy food smell. The meal deal is a great price because it includes a side that is a decent portion with the main dish you order. I had the popular #20 with the kale salad as my side and the pomegranate green tea.....YASSSSS AMAZING! The style of the sandwich is so unique and it's just enough to fill you up! The bread is similar to a sourdough in the way that it is soft in the middle but has a great crunch on the outside but it doesn't cut the roof of your mouth like some breads do when they are toasted. Everything was fresh that was in the sandwich and in the salad. I will definitely be back and this place is PHENOMENAL!

Visited today for the first time with my family for lunch. Atmosphere was very friendly and quite busy. We had the opportunity to meet the owner. She was an absolute delight when she came by our table. We had read about this place in a local newspaper article. The sandwiches were amazing and a real treat. We even got sandwiches to-go for dinner. I would highly recommend this place to someone who wants something different than a run-of-the-mill sub.

All I can say is wow. Awesomeness in the form of warm breakfast and lunch sandwiches. My husband and I tried the "Zinger" which apparently wasn't on the menu originally but the owner said everyone loved it so much it is one of the most popular sandwiches. They also have sweet sandwiches as well if you've got a sweet tooth. We are only in town for a couple days and loved this place so much we are coming back again tomorrow. If we lived in the area this would definitely be one of my regular spots. Also to note the owner is super sweet and her staff is very friendly. They are pretty quick in the kitchen as well so if you don't have a lot of time this is a great place to grab a quick bite. Enjoy! You will not be disappointed.

This is the second time I've been here and again they have good sandwiches.  Also if you're a tea person they have fresh brewed (unsweetened- my personal favorite).  It's a cute place set in downtown right off Central.  There are lots of other things to do around here as well and I suggest making the time of your hungry for breakfast.
Good not great. Wasn't super filling but it was a fun atmosphere and unique sandwich experience.

We really loved this place. The owner stopped by to talk to us on our first visit. She explained how they worked hard to build their signature sandwich makers and that they work with wildflower bakery for their bread to be made in the shape they need for their sandwiches. I would try any of the sandwiches on the menu - excellent breakfast selections. I had the #25 which was the ham, avocado, black bean, cheese and signature chipotle sauce. DELICIOUS. Plus if you check in with Yelp you get 10% off your order. I can't wait to go back. I highly recommend this place. They have been open for 19 months. Right on the light rail in central phoenix.

Went here to pick up a sandwich to go.  Counter lady was friendly.  Chose the Mozzerella/basil/tomato.  When I opened the bag, I thought- Oh, man- it's so small. (the size of a appetizer paper plate)  But it was REALLY, REALLY good and filling!  There are no bread choices- it's sorta the 'Hot Pocket' concept, but fresh and round.   I wasn't offered any side choices other than the kale salad which was really good.  It was a bit soggy n the middle when I got back to work.  Had I eaten in, rather than to go, it would have been perfect.  This is not a buy the sandwhich and put it in the fridge until lunch kinda place.  I will definitely go back and eat in or within a few minutes.   I hope they make it!!!!
They have good breakfast sandwiches and the staff is always really friendly. They could do a few things better taste wise on some stuff but they are definitely creative with their food.

Great little spot for a quick bite, but furniture is not comfortable enough to hang out.  Cool twist on a sandwich with the perfect ratio of bread to yummy fillings.  Loss of a star because parking sucks.

Stopped in today for a late lunch. Outstanding. Friendly service. Excellent sandwich and the kale salad was amazing as recommended.    I got the ham and brie with apricot spread and almonds. Very tasty. The machine presses the sandwiches, reminds me of what we called hobo sandwiches around the campfire. I do taste the smokiness. Haha.  Be warned though, the sandwiches are small. Thats okay though, go with a friend and split a third sandwich. Perfect.     :-)

This is a wonderful sandwich spot. Sandwiches are uniquely made and prepared to satisfaction.  This owner operated independent freshly clean new Phoenix restaurant offers a reasonable variety of hot sandwiches. Don't miss out on the kale salad.....it is heavenly.  We ended up having a bog bowl reorder after we were done with lunch.......it was soooo good.  The owner is very friendly, makes sure all customers are catered to satisfaction and custom makes sandwiches to your liking. It is definitely one of our new lunch/breakfast spots in town. :)
The food is delicious, simple and fresh. The owner and staff are friendly and thoughtful. The store is lively and bright. Excellent neighborhood sandwich shop!!

My coworker sent me over there for lunch. And may I say those sandwiches are delicious, just a bit small for my taste though. You might need two or more make you full. The interior of the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous and I love the seating. They even have misters outside! Great for this AZ heat. And there is outside seating for people with dogs.

What a fantastic breakfast and lunch place.  Unique, tasty and affordable.  Grilled sandwiches filled with fresh ingredients.  We had the turkey, dried cranberries with mild curry sauce. Incredible.  My husband had the ham with brie and apricot preserves.  Equally fabulous!  And the kale salad is to die for. Freshly prepared food in a clean and modern environment at these prices just can't be beat!  Breakfast sandwiches are only $4.50 and the lunch sandwiches are only $6.50.  A great experience.   Service is quick.   Owner came out to meet us and is lovely. New location is corner of Central and Camelback next to FlowerChild.

This place is absolutely adorable. I love the bright colors. They have a nice little patio with misters. The owner is so passionate and so nice. All the staff were actually very friendly. We ordered a cocoloco, zinger, and number 25. We chose the kale salad for a side, which was super fresh and had just enough citrus. The eggs were perfectly poached. The zinger sauce is amazing. And the sandwiches are super affordable! We so wish we had one in our neck of the woods. We will definitely be coming back next year!

I always see this place when I go to Maizie's and have wanted to stop by. They are strictly breakfast and lunch, close by 3:30. After driving around the other day in circles in the dreaded "Where should we gooooo", I finally took a sharp turn and ended up here.   They serve breakfast all day and lunch comes with a side salad. I tried a number 30 (ham with brie, apricot spread, and almond) while the sis had a breakfast hot pocket, I mean sandwich. I opted for the garbanzo bean salad with feta. It was tasty, but I asked for an extra lemon to kick it up a notch. The kale salad also looked pretty tasty. While we were eating, I leaned over and said, "It's like eating an adult Hot Pocket!" She totally agreed. I mean really, you have crispy, hot french bread (almost croissant like), filled with various forms of meat and cheeses, served hot.   For both Zookz', a medium drink, my included side salad, plus an extra 10% for checking in, it was less than $14. Not too shabby for lunch in Cen Pho. I definitely want to come back and explore the menu more, especially their frittata breakfast sandwich and whatever one mentioned Nutella.
Delish! Had a breakfast sandwich to go and it was rich, filling, and perfectly sized. I really want to try their other sandwiches.

This place is amazing! I was starving and wanted a fun and unusual place to eat for breakfast. I found Zooks on Yelp and I'm so happy I listened to the reviews. The owner is so friendly and inviting. She helped me pick out my breakfast sandwich. She convinced me to try the "Zinger" oh boy was that thing delicious. She also mentioned that if I didn't like it that she would make me another sandwich no problem. The sauce on the sandwich with was a cream cheese siracha sauce and it was so yummy! But the real show stopper for me was the side kale salad. It was sweet and savory. I've never had a better tasting salad in my life. I can't wait to go back with my fianc√©! You have to go!
Delicious food and friendly staff.  Even had a chance to meet the owner.  Tasty salad, had the no. 5.  My husband had a Jaffle- one of their signature sandwiches!

I picked up. Easy to order over the phone and the food was ready when I got there.   I got #25 it was ok. Not the best sandwich I have ever had. But I am willing to try a different one and see if I change my mind. My side was a potato salad that was good.

Was there again today and the place continues to win me over and over again. All the employees are very friendly and I've dealt with the owner and she's a wonderful lady. Both the breakfast and lunch sandwiches are consistently good and the ambience is casual and modern. Can be irritatingly hipster at times, but it's downtown, so is expected. Highly recommended!

So to start off the second we walked in, the owner walked up to us and introduced herself and completely explained the whole menu to us. One of the most friendly people there is. In addition the food was awesome. Such a great innovative new idea. Lastly as we ate she checked up on us at least 4 times to make sure everything was perfect. It deserves a 5 star for overall rating for sure

Great food, packed to enjoy on the go.  Stopped here during a road trip.  Had the turkey, bacon, avocado, tomato sandwich along with their house salad.   The salad is also very delicious -- kale (used for texture -- you cant really smell it), along with several other ingredients and pickling (i believe) -- eg) chives, onion, small oranges, shaved almonds...   Definitely recommend.

Sandwiches are a fun round shaped. All sandwiches are toasted and made to order. You can also add or subtract from the sandwiches. Try the kale salad, too. They have a great house dressing. The employees are highly motivated to ensure that you dining experience is wonderful! I can't wait to go back!!

I see all the mixed reviews so don't listen to them, listen to me!  PRO:  The food here is very good.  I had a sandwich and potato salad   CON.  The prices are high, charged me $8+.  Which wouldn't be an issue if the kitti-kat portions  were not so small.  That 4 oz salad doesn't cut it.  Which explains why there are so many females in here for their foo foo lunch.  But a REAL MAN who is used to eating a double burger combo with fries and quart of beer will leave very hungry or very poor.  Be warned

Sandwiches are crunchy and creespy. I love the food inside of the sandwiches like a box. Salad is good with sanwishes. But the drinks is so artificial flavor for me. I ordered the tea, it was not a real tea.

Awesome delicious and different sandwich place! Corn and bean salad was good, would like some other options.  Definitely want to go back and try one of everything! Staff were friendly.  All around great new little spot

Excellent, fresh, fast and affordable. Again Yelp has brought me to a place I would never have known about. So nice to walk in to be greeted by the owner who cares about her customers. The sandwiches were amazing, can't wait to try them all.

Must try sandwich place,  serves breakfast sandwiches all day,  best sandwiches I've had in Phoenix.  Hubby and i shared no. 20 Turkey and no.35 roast beef.  The flavors explode in your mouth,  making you close your eyes and say mmmmm with each bite. The potato salad and the garbanzo bean salad are so yummy too.  Definitely our new favorite place.
Interesting spin on sandwiches. These sandwiches are tasty, filling and reasonably priced.

My wife and I had a meeting in downtown Phoenix we wanted to find a new place to eat. we heard about this place and stopped in for a quick bite. I had one of the daily specials (ham, mozzarella, pinapple/jalapeno chutney) and it was fantastic. The flavors melded just right for a perfect balance of sweet and savory. The zook was nice and toasty without being greasy. My wife got the NO. 20 and was raving about hers as well.  The chipotle potato salad was light and tasty, we devoured them in just minutes as we were waiting on the sandwiches.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, we will definitely make the trek from Chandler just to come here.

I just had a wonderful experience here so 5 stars it is. If George Foreman owned a eatery it would be Zooks. Lol- they make their sandwiches in a machine that transfers your meal into a pocket type of sandwich melt kind of like the grills Foreman makes. See, so I made that fun connection. However, the difference is the owner Carole is a gem. (Okay, maybe George is too but I don't know him personally or have ever met him before - Call me George Foreman the next time you are in Phx and Zooks is on me.- lol, silly me.)   After I walked in looking a little lost, a woman comes running over to me with a big grin on her face. She was so welcoming and explains the entire sandwich making process to me. I had no idea what to order so we began to chat. "Wow, the staff here are so helpful and nice," I am thinking to myself. ( especially after I tell her I meant to go to another restaurant and found my way here by mistake. Well not really since Zooks was on the "Gotta Try List" anyway. I believe Karma led me here today ) Well, as it turns out this charming lady is to my great surprise the actual owner, Carole. She is so delightful, helpful and friendly. It is apparent Carole loves what she does and is proud of her place.   The breakfast sandwich I received was pretty tasty. They use Wildflower bread, Ummm, "Yummers!" I can't wait to come back and try all of the different menu item sandwiches. I read all these great comments on the Kale salad so I will have to try that too.   The only thing you might want to note is that the sandwiches are smaller than the average way too big portions we seem to be familiar with in America. I was thrilled myself. However, some other people who do not know any better might be forewarned.   Thank you Carole and the pleasure was all mine to meet you. Just a note, I never made it to the other restaurant at all. I might never with you nearby.
What a wonderful find!  Super friendly service that you just don't find anymore. The sandwiches are amazing. Great value for family. We will be back.

I checked this place out on yelp before I went, I saw a lot of good review so I ventured and got me a sandwich after church. I was really impressed with the place, it has a very colorful atmosphere and a personal welcoming feeling from the staff. I ordered the #22 breakfast sandwich, and the guy asked for my name. I personally prefer being called by my name rather than a number on my receipt. The sandwich looked sorta small when I got it but it was very filling. You get a 10% coupon if you check into the restaurant, so make sure to check in into yelp.

We went here randomly after driving around starving bordering on being hangry. I'll lead with my favorite thing here- their teas! Like 6 different fresh brewed choices, I got peach and then the green tea. I run the other way when I see machine tea Lipton as it's a tea joke. Moving on, this is a panini lover's heaven. There are a bunch of different choices; we ordered one that had eggs, spinach, ham and sweet mustard in it. They press the sandwich into a closed circle, the bread was a good different, I can't place it but it was somewhere between a waffle and toast. The service was great and I appreciated the openness of the layout. Perfect breakfast and lunch spot. They even have mimosas which I heard were really good. We loved it here and the urban vibe of this restaurant made me feel so cool!

I'd been meaning to try this place for months and was finally able to yesterday. I stopped in around 1:30 on Sunday and not a single other customer was in the place. I was greeted by a smiling man behind the counter who was friendly and gave me some helpful suggestions on what sandwiches were popular. I opted for the #10, even though that wasn't on his suggestions. It came with turkey, apples, parmesan cheese and hot mustard and I opted for the side of their kale salad over a few different kinds of potato chips.   After a short wait, my to-go order was brought out. As I took my Zookz sandwich out of the bag once home I realized it was a warm panini like sandwich that reminded me of those crustables PBnJ sandwiches you see in the freezer aisle. To my delight, the sandwich was really good. The apples gave the turkey a nice crisp sweetness and the flavor mixture was good. I really enjoyed the kale salad as well and dressing that came on it was nice and light and perfect for the salad. I would consider it a light lunch but it did fill me up for several hours.  I can't wait to go back and try all the other options! I checked their website for nutrition information but didn't see any. Anyone know if they have it? If not, I hope they do soon!
Sandwiches were amazing! Got a breakfast zook and was instantly hooked. The prices are also great so that's a plus. Definitely will be returning!
